story:
I'm running my first marathon in Austin, on February 15. I am so excited to challenge myself and push my limits to run those 26.2 miles. 

As I took on the challenge, I thought about how I could give back to my community. Working at Posada Esperanza, a children's and women's shelter in Austin, has opened my eyes to a lot of things we take for granted. 

Families at Posada work hard to save up for their future and so things like after school activities, ballet and basketball classes, often aren't possible. 
I would love to fund as many kids as possible, so that they can experience the joy of learning some dance steps or how to score in soccer. 

I am therefore raising 140 $ to run the marathon, and 60 $ to buy some gear I need. 

The rest goes to these kiddos. 
Anything helps and I will be thinking of all of you when I run mile after mile. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Je vais courir mon premier marathon à Austin, le 15 
février 2015. Je suis heureuse de pouvoir pousser mes 
limites et courir ces 42 kilomètres. Quand j'ai décidé de 
faire ce marathon, j'ai réfléchi à ce que je pouvais faire 
de plus. Depuis que je travaille à “Posada Esperanza”, un 
refuge pour femmes et enfants immigrant aux Etats-Unis, 
j'ai réalisé qu'on considérait beaucoup de choses commes 
acquises.
Les familles à Posada travaillent dur, et économisent 
tout leur argent pour s'assurer un avenir. Les activités 
extra scolaires sont donc un luxe, et les enfants qui vivent 
à Posada n'y participent presque jamais. J'aimerais 
financer autant d'enfants que possible, pour qu'ils puissent 
ressentir la joie qui accompagne un cours de danse, de 
karaté ou de musique.
Je vais donc récolter 140 $ pour pouvoir participer à la 
course, dont 60$ pour acheter du matériel dont j'ai besoin.
Le reste sera pour ces enfants. N'importe quel montant 
aidera et je penserai à vous tous, kilomètre après 
kilomètre.

story:
Greetings!

First and foremost...

Thank you for considering or making a contribution on behalf of us.

We are the 2014-2015 Hampton Preparatory Varsity Cheerleaders and  are extremely honored to make that statement.  We say this because Hampton has not had cheerleading in 3 years! Can you believe that?  As students, we saw the need to build school moral and spirit in both our hallways and our community. With enough support behind us, we realized anything was possible. We were able to get the support of faculty, staff, family, and friends in order to push for our team and are now proud to say .... WE ARE HERE! :)

With that same dedication, we figured we would fundraise to go to camp for 2 reasons: 1.) Team bonding is so important in order to run an awesomely amazing team and cheer camps will definitely contribute to that and 2.) We know how much our parents have already sacrificed in getting our uniforms. For the last 2 months, our team has hosted several fundraisers for camp from selling concession items such as Koolickles (yes, koolickles are Kool-Aid pickles)  to raffle tickets. We are determined to go to camp and we know that with your help it is possible.

As a team, we have already developed the meaning and purpose of unity . We are ONE (as Coach would say) and know that we all need to go to camp to represent Hampton Preparatory School, repectfully. So, if you do decided to sponsor us, it would be in support of an amazing cause.

Love. Peace. and Toe Touches-

<3 2014-2015 HPS Cheerleaders

story:
Finally, a wearable device that makes exercise fun and enjoyable!

Gymtrack was exposed at the Maker Faire in the Bay Area on May 2014!
Featured on:

Gymtrack is a wearable device aimed to gamify exercise. The device is designed to be worn around the ankle, it monitors your physical activity and then it sends all data via Bluetooth to your laptop, tablet or smartphone. The software will translate that data into actions on a 3D video game that you play while you exercise!

Gymtrack offers a new way to experience exercise. Other wearable devices related to fitness only track your physical activity, but you're still left with the fact that exercise can be a boring activity for most people. Without a motivation, it can be hard working out at the gym. 

What are the benefits of using Gymtrack (some of the features)?

  • Enjoy an augmented reality experience at the gym and keeps you motivated working out.
  • Track your activity in real time, and see relevant information from your workout such as speed, distance traveled, and estimated calories burned. 
  • Set different goals (i.e lose some weight in a certain time period) and the software will guide you through different levels of difficulty so you can reach your goal in the desired time. 
  • Train for a race (whether it's running, cycling, rowing or any other activity) by competing against the computer and beat it to make sure you can keep up depending on the level of difficulty you choose.

How it works

Gymtrack is designed to worn around the ankle. You put the device inside the band, tighten the strap around your ankle, turn it on, and connect to your computer, tablet or smartphone with Bluetooth! After connecting to your device, you will be able to start enjoying a fun workout session with an augmented reality interface that will monitor your physical activity in real time.

The software consists of an app that you can run on your IOS, Android or Windows device. It's totally free! 

Travel in a virtual world while you exercise

Whether you are cycling on a stationary bike, jogging on a treadmill or using any other fitness machine, you will always have a different game and virtual world to play in to make the workout session more enjoyable.

Stationary bike


Treadmill


Rowing Machine


Elliptical

Features

Some of the most notable features of Gymtrack:

  • Compete against the computer, against other users online and even compete with yourself to beat your own record!
  • Choose among different virtual worlds and different game modes depending on the workout you want to do.
  • Track your progress in real time or in different time lapses (daily, weekly,  and monthly) so you can see your progress over time.
  • Incorporate social media to share your progress and physical activity with your friends and family. 

Some future upgrades: 

  • Play different type of games to keep you motivated while working out. For instance, want to escape from zombies while you run? Or you need to make sure you deliver all of the city's newspapers while you ride a bike? These are some of the concepts that we are currently working on to implement into our video game.
  • Interface other type of sensors to the Gymtrack such as a heart rate monitor. 
  • Use the Gymtrack in different parts of the body (such as the wrist, and arms) to play different games for other types of exercises (i.e push-ups).
  • Use Gymtrack to play any other game you want and not just the exclusive games for the gymtrack. Want to play call of duty while you run? You will be able to do that!
  • Open API. Develop your own apps/games for the Gymtrack.

Why do we need your support?

We have a finished working prototype. Now we need to refine our prototype and get it ready for mass production. Our current prototype's case was produced with 3D printing technology, and the band was handcrafted. The final product, however, will be manufactured in a factory including the band and its case. In short, we need the money to refine our prototype, develop the software that will run on Android, IOS, and Windows, and do some major upgrades to our prototype such as making the device slightly smaller.

Perks

Some of the perks that we are offering to our supporters!


- $15 Get one of the bands! Just tell us the color you'd prefer and we will send one to you!


- $25 Your Gymtrack T-shirt!

- $29 Your Gymtrack polo shirt!



- $120 Early stage prototype! Be one the first ones to try out the prototype! You will receive a band with the color of your choice, and a fully working Gymtrack.


Meet the team

 Luis Cruz: developer, programmer and CEO at intelsath.

 Carlos Cruz: Media editor, works at 3D modeleling and animation.

Luis F. Cruz: Technical support engineer.


We hope to count on your support to bring this project to the market! Thank you!!


YMTRACK

www.intelsath.com

story:
Bioenergy Healing in Dominica!

                           

Hello friends!

My Name is Melanie Winston and I reside here in beautiful Dominica. I have had a lifelong interest in the area of health & wellness and for the last 10 years have helped people to create healthier and more satisfying lives through the use of my herbal remedies, natural products and organic produce.  I continue to search for new areas in the field of natural healing and just recently have been presented with an incredible opportunity, and this is where I need your help!

The Great News!

While exploring various energy healing therapies such as Reiki, Qijong and Prana/Chi,  I was always attracted to the Domancic method of bioenergy therapy which was developed over 35 years ago in Europe and has successfully helped millions of people with many different  health conditions. Bioenergy combines simple techniques in specific, proven protocols that benefit all health conditions, instill wellness, and boost peak performance in sports, arts and business.   I now have an opportunity to learn this holistic healing art and take the first steps to become a certified practitioner by attending the first two training seminars in October, one in Canada and one in the USA.

How will this benefit you?

What this means is that another safe, effective, alternative healing therapy will be available to everyone in Dominica and to everyone outside of Dominica too!  Bioenergy therapy is available and effective by distance treatments.

This bioenergy method can help any condition (simple or serious) as it empowers the body’s own immune system to function at its best. In fact, one of the method’s many fortes is to help improve health conditions that are deemed “incurable” by modern medicine in a safe and totally natural way and avoiding debilitating side effects, pain of invasive procedures, and the burden of extreme medical costs.  You don’t have to be sick or injured to benefit from bioenergy healing. Therapy at least four times a year helps keep your body functioning at its optimum.  Keeping the immune system in good working order is the only way to prevent illness and ensure your body stays healthy energetically, physically and emotionally..

This bioenergy Healing is extremely effective in helping achieve peak performance for athletes, dancers, actors, artists, writers, musicians, and in the workplace.  Bioenergy healing is also effective with your pets and animals, which respond easily to this therapy.

The Campaign Is On!  ... I Need Your Help!

Here’s where I need your help to make this happen! I am appealing to friends, family and everyone interested in holistic therapies to help me raise the funds to begin training.  I need to travel next month from Dominica to Canada and then the USA to attend the first two training seminars. I am trying to raise US $5500 which will cover the cost of airfares, accommodations, and enrollment in the 2 trainings.                                                                                                                         

For Your Generosity & Help

To express my gratitude for your support in helping me achieve my goal, here is what you will receive for your kind contributions.  Gifts include local and long distance biotherapy treatments, beautiful handmade thank you cards and origami art created by my children Nazarene, Rebecca, Janessa and Jahniyah.   As well I will be including two of my most recent paintings (acrylic on canvas)

Thanks for all your help! 

Please feel free to help us share this campaign! Spread the word around on Social Media and ask others to contribute.   Please forward this link to your friends and family and anyone that can be of help.  And let people know about this wonderful energetic healing modality!    Email me (melanieawinston@yahoo.com) with your questions, inquiries, support, and positive thoughts.  I’ll be happy to respond to your emails as soon as I get the chance!


FYI.  Learn More About The Bioenergy Method!

Domancic Bioenergy method can help any condition (simple or serious) as it empowers the body’s own immune system to function at its best. This method can be used to heal or treat many various diagnosed, classified diseases and illnesses including: Allergies, Asthma, Arthritis, Anemia, Anxiety, Autism, Alzheimer's disease, AIDS, Cancer, Cholesterol, Circulation Issues, Cardiovascular Issues, Diabetes, Depression, Epilepsy, Fertility, Gangrene, Heart Diseases, Hormonal Issues, Jaundice, Kidney Disease, Lung Diseases, Liver Disease, Leukemia, Migraines, Parkinson’s disease, Stress, Shingles, Sinus. In fact, one of the method’s many fortes is to help improve health conditions that are deemed “ incurable” by modern medicine in a safe and totally natural way. Thus avoiding debilitating side effects, pain of invasive procedures and in some countries the burden of extreme medical costs.

story:
Every 2 minutes, a pedestrian/cyclist is killed. Millions more are injured every year--many left permanently disabled. Traditional forward-facing headlights and red tail lights on bicycles are inadequate and ineffective.They are dull, overpowered by street lights and headlamps, easily covered by backpacks or clothing, blend in with the environment--and in most cases can't be seen from angles. Reflective clothing requires headlights to be shown directly on the subject to be seen and arm bands only provide visibility on one side of the body. We knew something needed to be done. So we created a solution....

The BEACON is the solution. 




BEACON by LumaGlo: 

The BEACON by LumaGlo is an wearable, smart, bluetooth-controlled LED lighting system that provides intense visibility from every angle. It's custom iOS and Android app allows you to choose 16 million colors to gain the attention needed for your situation. The dynamic patterns allow you to create intense visibility from several blocks away and helps to prevent the light from being overpowered by street lamps and headlights. The intensity of the light is spectacular and can be seen from hundreds of feet away. 
We took it one step further by integrating a wearable brake light for cyclists. The built-in accelerometer can sense when speeds are reduced and will begin flashing RED to alert drivers around them. 

But wait, there's more! The smart phone connection sends visual notifications from your phone to your lights--stay plugged in even while you're on-the-go! 
"It's the only product invented that integrates safety with wearable technology." 



Accelerometer-based brake light!

Yes, you read that right! This is the ultimate safety device for cyclists. The lights will begin flashing an intense red pattern when you come to a stop. When you pick up speed it will automatically revert back to the previous pattern. 

*motorcyclists check with your state traffic laws regarding use of multi-colored LED's on roadways. 


VISUAL NOTIFICATIONS:

Stay connected even when you're on-the-go. The lights will notify you when you get a message, text, phone call, etc.  


True. Millions. This is the ultimate device for self expression! 

The custom Android & iOS app allows you to choose up to 16 MILLION colors for each  LED node. Set the color to match your mood!



Dynamic & animated patterns!  

Choose a pattern that gets attention for your situation. Every single LED node is individually controllable. Yes. Every single one. 

This allows you to choose vibrant, eye-catching patterns to gain added visibility. 

 

Why would I use endless colors and patterns? 

Great question. While we don't think anyone will use all 16 million colors (I wonder how that long would take?). It's incredibly awesome that you have the ability to choose every color under the sun! This really is the ultimate device for self expression. 

But more importantly, you can use your full controllability and customization to increase safety. Here are some examples: 

  • Flashing red pattern in an emergency situation
  • Brighter, flashier patterns in city rush hour traffic. White and red lights are easily overpowered by street lights. Use Blue and yellow to really stand out! 
  • Maybe you're on a run in a rural area. A solid color may be all you need. 
  • Crossing a busy street? Try the orbit pattern. It's animated and will draw attention. 
  • Sending your kids to school? You probably don't want to take any chances. Try a multi-colored chase patterns. It's bright, colorful and animated.

And millions of other ways to grab attention. 



How is BEACON different than other LED belts? 

We've spent 1.5 years perfecting the design to create a device that saves lives while offering useful and meaningful features. See for yourself! 

How is it powered?  

Every belt contains a compact  micro USB rechargeable battery. 

How long will the battery last before it needs charged? The short answer to this is between 2-10 hours. Different colors and patterns consume different amounts of power. For example, solid colors require more power and flashing patterns require less. Also, full white consumes the most power, whereas colors consume less. 

Maybe you need it to be more intense so it can be seen broad during daylight, but in the dark you can reduce the brightness down to as low as 10% to conserve power yet still be seen. Want to be more visible? Crank it up to 100% and you'll stop traffic! 

Charging is simple and fast! Just plug in the micro USB and let it do its magic! 

SIZING: 

Every belt is adjustable. In the photo above, the adjustable section is pure black and does not contain LED's. It is tucked behind the belt for photo purposes only. **note: on average, 2/3 of each belt is lit, the remaining 1/3 allows for adjustability so that every person gets the perfect fit!

Currently we are offering the following sizing options. No need to make your selection now though. After the campaign is funded you will receive a survey in which you will choose your size: 

  • Dog collar: Choose from 2 sizes: fits necks 20-28" (approx 1/2 lit)
  • Child sizes: Choose from 2 sizes: fits waists 20-28" (approx 1/2 lit)
  • Adult sizes: Choose from 3 sizes: fits waists 28-40" (approx 2/3 lit)
  • Sash style: Adjustable from 50-60" (approx 2/3 lit)


Why not a 'One size fits all?'

To uphold the robust durability of the belt, the 'adjustable section' does not contain LED's (the frequent bends would cause it to wear out prematurely). If we did a one-size-fits-all it would greatly increase the the size of adjustability section--consequently reducing the lit section.  We want our backers to have the most visibility possible and the only way to do this is to offer multiple sizes.

One of the greatest quotes we've heard was by Tony Gaskins: "If you don't build your own dreams, someone will hire you to help build theirs." 

We began building our dreams by developing smart LED products with integrated Bluetooth controls. Our first product was called 'Freedom Lighting' and was in more of an accent lighting form factor. Although we were passionate about that product, individually we all became more aware of the market need for safety. News broadcasts were filled with stories of tragic accidents and the local paper repeatedly reported horrific accidents. We live in the cycling capital of the world, Portland, and began noticing that there wasn't anything available for cyclists or pedestrians that offered a true solution to becoming visible. As our kids began walking to and from school, it became clear that we needed to do something. We began exploring ways of using our LED system to save lives. 

Here is the team that made it happen: 

We're a passionate team of engineers, developers and inventors that have come together to make a dream become a reality. The 4 of us have worn all the hats at different times throughout our journey of making LumaGlo become a reality. Collectively, we all bring different skills to the table and all bring different ideas. 

Russ Lathrop, Co-Founder, Video & Media. Russ is a Sports Television Broadcast Director and Editor. A regular on NBA, MLS and College Basketball crews, his career has taken him to almost every major North American city as well as countless small towns and back roads. Working multiple World Cups and Olympics has given him the opportunity to travel the globe. Running, soccer, photography, music and reading are just a few of his passions. Russ enjoys the busy adventure of travel just as much as a relaxing with a cup of coffee on the front porch with his dog. At LumaGlo, Russ is responsible for conceptualizing, capturing and editing the videos and media to share with the world. He brings ideas, visions and passion to all things LumaGlo.

Jill Saucedo, Co-Founder, Business Development. Jill is a Business Development Leader with extensive experience in all organizational levels creating, promoting, and delivering solutions designed to support the organization’s business plan, both in the private and not-for-profit sectors. Volunteering in schools and other organizations with a mission to support children is her passion, along with sitting on the sidelines with her husband, watching their kids play sports. At LumaGlo, Jill is responsible for strategic planning and implementation, establishing business relationships and partnerships, and managing day-to-day activities. 

Randy Lathrop, Co-Founder, Software Engineer. Randy has been a firmware developer for over 20 years, creating the “hidden” software that powers the world of devices that contain small microprocessors. He has worked on products ranging from traffic signal control, projectors, digital video processors, DSL modems, audio amplifiers and large touch screen displays. At LumaGlo, his passion is bringing the vibrancy of moving colors via Bluetooth control to the compelling experience that is the wearable LED strip. He also is responsible for developing our custom smart phone iOS and Android apps. 

Ward Ramsdell, Cofounder,Electrical Engineer.  Ward is an electrical engineer with 15 years' experience and a number of successful consumer product designs under his belt. Ward brings to the team his experience from consulting on product development with technology companies throughout the country, both large and small, on projects ranging from GPS receivers to wireless speakers and industrial payment systems. At LumaGlo, Ward is responsible for the electrical design.

Our Development Process:

In November 2013, we launched our first kickstarter campaign--Freedom Lighting--which was a modular, wall or battery powered, Bluetooth controlled, LED strip. We gained valuable insight into which traits of the product concept were popular--a "wearable" LED strip.  

Next we consulted with a wide variety of people: runners, cyclist, business mentors, designers and anyone else interested, for their feedback on what would make for a compelling product. The consensus was to use "Dual Mode" Bluetooth for control and a relatively large battery to provide a long duration of visibility. Dual mode Bluetooth support offers compatibility will virtually ALL smart phones and a battery capacity of over 1000 mAh would power the LED strip for over 2 hours. Having these two primary design goals clarified, we began designing form factor and the LED strip controller.  

As for the project aesthetic, we determined a belt form factor would provide the best means to house the LED strip and we determined that a strong fabric belt with a large buckle would provide robust protection, but would remain light enough to not burden the user. We experimented with various colors and form factors, ultimately settling on black with a white sleeve for the LED strip so as not to reduce the light output.  

Finally, we needed to design the controller. We opted to place the battery inside the controller enclosure to tightly integrate the microprocessor and power supply and reduce the form factor. This also means the only exposed connector is a micro USB for charging the battery. The final result is a sleek, lightweight design.

Risks and challenges

We spent 18 months designing and developing this product and have strategically planned each manufacturing phase of the LumaGlo BEACON. We are confident we have the infrastructure in place and can fully execute. However, as with all new product inventions of this scale, there are inherent risks and challenges involved. This is primarily because we rely heavily on outside sources to execute their plans as efficiently as we expect. We have 20+ years developing hi-tech consumer products for our employers--this brings us confidence in our abilities to solve problems, move beyond setbacks and build alternate plans in our infrastructure to keep things moving forward with integrity.

With that being said, we are excited to share this journey with you and look forward to SAVING LIVES!

-Jill, Randy, Russ & Ward 
Co-founders
story_txt:
Every 2 minutes, a pedestrian/cyclist is killed. Millions more are injured every year--many left permanently disabled. Traditional forward-facing headlights and red tail lights on bicycles are inadequate and ineffective.They are dull, overpowered by street lights and headlamps, easily covered by backpacks or clothing, blend in with the environment--and in most cases can't be seen from angles. Reflective clothing requires headlights to be shown directly on the subject to be seen and arm bands only provide visibility on one side of the body. We knew something needed to be done. So we created a solution....
The BEACON is the solution. 




BEACON by LumaGlo: 
The BEACON by LumaGlo is an wearable, smart, bluetooth-controlled LED lighting system that provides intense visibility from every angle. It's custom iOS and Android app allows you to choose 16 million colors to gain the attention needed for your situation. The dynamic patterns allow you to create intense visibility from several blocks away and helps to prevent the light from being overpowered by street lamps and headlights. The intensity of the light is spectacular and can be seen from hundreds of feet away. 
We took it one step further by integrating a wearable brake light for cyclists. The built-in accelerometer can sense when speeds are reduced and will begin flashing RED to alert drivers around them. 

But wait, there's more! The smart phone connection sends visual notifications from your phone to your lights--stay plugged in even while you're on-the-go! 

"It's the only product invented that integrates safety with wearable technology." 



Accelerometer-based brake light!
Yes, you read that right! This is the ultimate safety device for cyclists. The lights will begin flashing an intense red pattern when you come to a stop. When you pick up speed it will automatically revert back to the previous pattern. 

*motorcyclists check with your state traffic laws regarding use of multi-colored LED's on roadways. 





VISUAL NOTIFICATIONS:
Stay connected even when you're on-the-go. The lights will notify you when you get a message, text, phone call, etc.  








Millions of colors!

True. Millions. This is the ultimate device for self expression! The custom Android & iOS app allows you to choose up to 16 MILLION colors for each  LED node. Set the color to match your mood!





Dynamic & animated patterns!  
Choose a pattern that gets attention for your situation. Every single LED node is individually controllable. Yes. Every single one. 
This allows you to choose vibrant, eye-catching patterns to gain added visibility. 

 
Why would I use endless colors and patterns? 
Great question. While we don't think anyone will use all 16 million colors (I wonder how that long would take?). It's incredibly awesome that you have the ability to choose every color under the sun! This really is the ultimate device for self expression. 
But more importantly, you can use your full controllability and customization to increase safety. Here are some examples: 

Flashing red pattern in an emergency situation
Brighter, flashier patterns in city rush hour traffic. White and red lights are easily overpowered by street lights. Use Blue and yellow to really stand out! 
Maybe you're on a run in a rural area. A solid color may be all you need. 
Crossing a busy street? Try the orbit pattern. It's animated and will draw attention. 
Sending your kids to school? You probably don't want to take any chances. Try a multi-colored chase patterns. It's bright, colorful and animated.

And millions of other ways to grab attention. 






How is BEACON different than other LED belts? 
We've spent 1.5 years perfecting the design to create a device that saves lives while offering useful and meaningful features. See for yourself! 





How is it powered?  
Every belt contains a compact  micro USB rechargeable battery. 
How long will the battery last before it needs charged? The short answer to this is between 2-10 hours. Different colors and patterns consume different amounts of power. For example, solid colors require more power and flashing patterns require less. Also, full white consumes the most power, whereas colors consume less. 
Maybe you need it to be more intense so it can be seen broad during daylight, but in the dark you can reduce the brightness down to as low as 10% to conserve power yet still be seen. Want to be more visible? Crank it up to 100% and you'll stop traffic! 
Charging is simple and fast! Just plug in the micro USB and let it do its magic! 


SIZING: 


Every belt is adjustable. In the photo above, the adjustable section is pure black and does not contain LED's. It is tucked behind the belt for photo purposes only. **note: on average, 2/3 of each belt is lit, the remaining 1/3 allows for adjustability so that every person gets the perfect fit!
Currently we are offering the following sizing options. No need to make your selection now though. After the campaign is funded you will receive a survey in which you will choose your size: 

Dog collar: Choose from 2 sizes: fits necks 20-28" (approx 1/2 lit)
Child sizes: Choose from 2 sizes: fits waists 20-28" (approx 1/2 lit)
Adult sizes: Choose from 3 sizes: fits waists 28-40" (approx 2/3 lit)
Sash style: Adjustable from 50-60" (approx 2/3 lit)




Why not a 'One size fits all?'
To uphold the robust durability of the belt, the 'adjustable section' does not contain LED's (the frequent bends would cause it to wear out prematurely). If we did a one-size-fits-all it would greatly increase the the size of adjustability section--consequently reducing the lit section.  We want our backers to have the most visibility possible and the only way to do this is to offer multiple sizes.



About us:One of the greatest quotes we've heard was by Tony Gaskins: "If you don't build your own dreams, someone will hire you to help build theirs." 
We began building our dreams by developing smart LED products with integrated Bluetooth controls. Our first product was called 'Freedom Lighting' and was in more of an accent lighting form factor. Although we were passionate about that product, individually we all became more aware of the market need for safety. News broadcasts were filled with stories of tragic accidents and the local paper repeatedly reported horrific accidents. We live in the cycling capital of the world, Portland, and began noticing that there wasn't anything available for cyclists or pedestrians that offered a true solution to becoming visible. As our kids began walking to and from school, it became clear that we needed to do something. We began exploring ways of using our LED system to save lives. 
Here is the team that made it happen:

Collectively, we all bring different skills to the table and all bring different ideas.

A regular on NBA, MLS and College Basketball crews, his career has taken him to almost every major North American city as well as countless small towns and back roads. Working multiple World Cups and Olympics has given him the opportunity to travel the globe. Running, soccer, photography, music and reading are just a few of his passions. Russ enjoys the busy adventure of travel just as much as a relaxing with a cup of coffee on the front porch with his dog. Volunteering in schools and other organizations with a mission to support children is her passion, along with sitting on the sidelines with her husband, watching their kids play sports. At LumaGlo, Jill is responsible for strategic planning and implementation, establishing business relationships and partnerships, and managing day-to-day activities.

He has worked on products ranging from traffic signal control, projectors, digital video processors, DSL modems, audio amplifiers and large touch screen displays. At LumaGlo, his passion is bringing the vibrancy of moving colors via Bluetooth control to the compelling experience that is the wearable LED strip. He also is responsible for developing our custom smart phone iOS and Android apps. 
Ward Ramsdell, Cofounder,Electrical Engineer.  Ward is an electrical engineer with 15 years' experience and a number of successful consumer product designs under his belt. Ward brings to the team his experience from consulting on product development with technology companies throughout the country, both large and small, on projects ranging from GPS receivers to wireless speakers and industrial payment systems. At LumaGlo, Ward is responsible for the electrical design.

As for the project aesthetic, we determined a belt form factor would provide the best means to house the LED strip and we determined that a strong fabric belt with a large buckle would provide robust protection, but would remain light enough to not burden the user. We experimented with various colors and form factors, ultimately settling on black with a white sleeve for the LED strip so as not to reduce the light output.  
Finally, we needed to design the controller. We opted to place the battery inside the controller enclosure to tightly integrate the microprocessor and power supply and reduce the form factor. This also means the only exposed connector is a micro USB for charging the battery. The final result is a sleek, lightweight design.



'under the hood' final prototype design. The compact battery is housed in the same small casing as the Bluetooth controller board, resulting in a sexy, sleek design.





Risks and challenges
We spent 18 months designing and developing this product and have strategically planned each manufacturing phase of the LumaGlo BEACON. We are confident we have the infrastructure in place and can fully execute. However, as with all new product inventions of this scale, there are inherent risks and challenges involved. This is primarily because we rely heavily on outside sources to execute their plans as efficiently as we expect. We have 20+ years developing hi-tech consumer products for our employers--this brings us confidence in our abilities to solve problems, move beyond setbacks and build alternate plans in our infrastructure to keep things moving forward with integrity.
With that being said, we are excited to share this journey with you and look forward to SAVING LIVES!
-Jill, Randy, Russ & Ward Co-founders

story:
Short Summary

I'm a Singaporean female traveler who decided to quit my corporate job and fly around last year. It's been 10 months since I last left home and my journey has been amazing. I hitch hiked in Japan, met someone I loved and flew all the way to South Africa to have a love story with him, came to Vietnam to be an English teacher but found myself a bar by the beach to work in, in Hue. Then something bad happened. 

As I was riding my motorbike back to Hue city, a young girl dashed out, I couldn't stop in time and had an accident. My left knee had a direct hit on the road and shattered. My tooth chipped, I suffered road rashes everywhere. I was sent to the hospital immediately to get my knee operated on. 

Everything that I planned for is gone. My knee is fractured. What a devastating news for me as a sportsperson and traveler. I can't work. I can't get insured because I don't possess a motorbike licence. I'm stuck in Vietnam. However I'm grateful to receiving all the help and concern I have from my friends in Hue and someone offered to put me up in his home for 3 months. At least accommodation is not an issue, I'm relieved! 

Can't work, budget woes!

I'm putting this up as a 'why not try my luck' thing! Hospital bills killed a big part of my fund. Thankfully Vietnam is cheap to live but I really need some financial help here to keep going while my leg is immobilsed. I'll be grateful even if I get a dollar out of entire thing! I'm grateful that I'm still alive, my head is alright and I have friends to help me. But I need to depend on myself financially at some point of time!

Every dollar you donate helps me to sustain my expenses in this period when I can't walk and work. I don't spend a lot, really. It's 20,000 dong for a meal here, that's not even US$1 so imagine how a dollar would help me for a meal! So every penny helps and nothing's too little to donate! And.. I need some money to fix my teeth as well. :( Chipped tooth and sensitive teeth, not fun. I can't bite anything at all!

Find out more about me

I have a blog and couchsurfing profile to find out more about me! :)

http://footstepsleadastray.wordpress.com/

https://www.couchsurfing.org/profile.html?id=5GXDA1F4A


I'm keeping my chin up! Being positive everyday about life and grateful and I'm still here today!

story:
Background

We are a group of Duke University students, student-athletes, volunteers, and professors that are devoted to working with the local Durham, NC latino community. Our passion for community development has led to the foundation of Soccer Sin Fronteras (Soccer Without Limits), a non-profit after school program that aims to develop high school students' leadership and academic achievement through soccer.

We conceived the idea of starting a free-to-play soccer league for local latino high school students in the summer of 2014 while enrolled in a 12-week long Intensive Spanish Language Program. This program was taught by Professor Liliana Paredes, who is well connected in the local Latino community and possesses a passion for service. Because of this passion, the program incorporated diverse Latino cultural education and involvement in the Durham community. At the end of the program Professor Paredes then recruited her former Duke students, many of whom are student-athletes, to set up Soccer Sin Fronteras! After a long semester of logistical preparation, we are finally ready to launch. All we need is your support!

The Impact

The goal is that the league will serve as a beneficial and productive way for students to spend their free time after school. Initially we wanted to start a program that just involved playing sports to have fun, but after a brief discussion our team decided to also incorporate leadership and academic achievement workshops. This way the program keeps kids active, while also developing their character and helping them achieve their goals. 

Why we need your support

Starting a soccer program has been much more expensive than our team originally thought. It may not seem like an expensive endeavor, but the costs certainly add up. However, if we reach our goal of $4,000, all of this year's expenses will be covered. 

  • Reserving Playing Fields
  • Renting Vans for Travel
  • Registration Fees
  • Equipment
  • Storage
Specifically, our team needs to reserve fields for practices, scrimmages, and games. Many participants do not have access to transportation, therefore we will need to provide additional transportation in order to be a competitive organization beyond the Durham community. To do this, registering for tournaments and official club titles can be surprisingly expensive. Lastly, any good team needs good gear and somewhere to put it!

Looking Forward

We are in the process of making Soccer Sin Fronteras an officially recognized student group, which will allow us to apply for Duke student group funding and be able to recruit new members. Professor Paredes is also incorporating Soccer Sin Fronteras into her upcoming classes, therefore involving more Spanish-speaking students that are passionate for service. Professor Hidalgo, associate director of Soccer Sin Fronteras, is also pitching administrators and recruiting students for a Soccer Sin Fronteras class next semester. We are confident that we will overcome any challenges set forth and will persevere in making Soccer Sin Fronteras a sustainable and successful after school program!

Our Team

The Soccer Sin Fronteras team is comprised of dedicated social entrepreneurs who are passionate about helping the Durham community!

  • Executive Director - Liliana Paredes, PhD, Duke University Professor 
  • President - AJ Wolf, Varsity Student-Athlete 
  • Vice-President - Erich Schneider, Varisty Student-Athlete 
  • Treasurer - Grant Hall, Varsity Student-Athlete
  • Associate Director - Fernando Campos, High School Professor 
  • Associate Director - Ivan Almonte, High School Counselor 
  • Associate Director - Jesus Hildalgo, Duke University Professor 
  • Assistant Director - Austin Davis, Varsity Student-Athlete 
  • Assistant Director - Drew Cutshaw, Student 
  • Assistant Director - Gabe Brander, Varsity Student-Athlete 
  • Assistant Director - Melissa Klein, Student
  • Assistant Director - Michael Mann, (Video Director) Varsity Student-Athlete 
  • Assistant Director - Natasha Catrakilis, Student

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page! The more exposure Soccer Sin Fronteras gets the more widespread we can impact the Durham Community.
  • Get involved! Our goal is to make Soccer Sin Fronteras a sustainable after school program. To do that, as mentioned above, we will need more team members every semester. If you have a passion for soccer or Hispanic culture, please do not hesitate to contact us about joining the team!
  • Volunteer! Since we are a non-profit program, we recommend anyone that can speak spanish or that has played soccer to reach out about getting involved with the program.
  • If you would like to know more about our program, please contact us at soccersinfronteras@gmail.com. Thanks!

story:
Amazing Air Conditioner is the personal and portable air conditioner with an energy bill of less than 3 cents a month. This personalized air conditioner was designed to focus its cooling effect on the area around the user thereby using a minimal amount of energy compared to traditional air conditioners or electric fans. 



Amazing Air Conditioner only requires an electrical power consumption of 1.5W and therefore can run on a micro 5 pin charger. That is nearly 1/30th the power consumption of an electric fan and 1/1000th the power consumption of even a basic air conditioner. 

This microscopic level of power consumption makes Amazing Air Conditioner incredibly cost-effective. Less energy consumption means more money saved on your energy bill. Even if used 8 hours a day for a whole month, the energy used by Amazing Air Conditioner will only cost you 3 cents. 


Amazing Air Conditioner is a personal air conditioner. Designed with a flexible neck, cool air flow can be directed to a targeted area. Unlike wasteful standard air conditioners that flow through the whole room, often to cool a single person, Amazing Air Conditioner offers personalized cooling.  


Amazing Air Conditioner is light weight so you can take it with you from room to room. Powered by a micro 5-pin charger, you can even run Amazing Air Conditioner with a portable cell phone charger. Use Amazing Air Conditioner indoors or outdoors for clean and fresh air wherever you go .


TIP: When you sleep, direct Amazing Air Conditioner's airflow beneath your blanket for a cool and comfortable rest. Standard air conditioners, if left on all night, can make you catch a cold or dry out your skin. Beyond that, if kept on for prolonged periods of time, you'll face a scary energy bill. Avoid the annoying ritual of waking up to turn off the air conditioner in the middle of the night with Amazing Air Conditioner.

Amazing Air Conditioner also has an LED light in its neck to act as an energy efficient night light. Get fresh air and add ambiance with Amazing Air Conditioner's soft glowing light. 



We often don't think about it but electricity is derived from natural resources including natural gas and coal. These resources are limited and therefore it is important to conserve electricity not just for money concerns but also for environmental reasons.  


Amazing Air Conditioner is capable of incredibly low power usage because it doesn't just derive its cooling power from electricity but also from ice! By using the natural cold of ice, Amazing Air Conditioner is the most eco-friendly air conditioner in the world. When equipped with a frozen ice chamber, Amazing Air Conditioner can keep you cool for up to 8 hours. With three chambers, you can stay cool all day long! Personal, portable and environmentally friendly Amazing Air Conditioner is the only A.C. you need to fight the heat. 


With its simple one-touch button, Amazing Air Conditioner can be turned OFF, increase air flow strength, and switch to air purifier mode.  


It is important to consider the air we breathe. Over exposure to the cold blast of a standard air conditioner can cause colds and respiratory diseases. When not cleaned properly, Air conditioners build up bacteria and germs that are re-circulated through out the room. Especially for children, the elderly, and those with conditions such as asthma, standard air conditioners can pose a health risk.   

Unlike standard air conditioners, Amazing Air Conditioner also acts as an air purifier to remove harmful airborne particles as small as 0.3 um. With its wound filter design, Amazing Air Conditioner has an expansive surface area to catch countless pollutants with no need for frequent replacement. Just clean the filter once a month with water. Amazing Air Conditioner has been proven to filter airborne particles and chemicals including: Micro-dust, CO2, Gas Fumes, Pollen, Mold, Viruses, Allergens, Germs, Bacteria, Formaldehyde, Toluene and Benzene.



Amazing Grace was founded on the principle of service to both humanity and the world. We believe that products are a reflection of the developers that create them. In Amazing Air Conditioner, we were inspired by Earth Hour where the world joins together to turn off the lights in order to combat climate change. We thought how could we offer a positive change to the world? For three years we developed Amazing Air Conditioner in the hope that it can create a small but meaningful push in the fight to conserve electricity.
story_txt:
Amazing Air Conditioner is the personal and portable air conditioner with an energy bill of less than 3 cents a month. This personalized air conditioner was designed to focus its cooling effect on the area around the user thereby using a minimal amount of energy compared to traditional air conditioners or electric fans. 



Amazing Air Conditioner only requires an electrical power consumption of 1.5W and therefore can run on a micro 5 pin charger. That is nearly 1/30th the power consumption of an electric fan and 1/1000th the power consumption of even a basic air conditioner. 
This microscopic level of power consumption makes Amazing Air Conditioner incredibly cost-effective. Less energy consumption means more money saved on your energy bill. Even if used 8 hours a day for a whole month, the energy used by Amazing Air Conditioner will only cost you 3 cents. 












Amazing Air Conditioner is a personal air conditioner. Designed with a flexible neck, cool air flow can be directed to a targeted area. Unlike wasteful standard air conditioners that flow through the whole room, often to cool a single person, Amazing Air Conditioner offers personalized cooling.  




Amazing Air Conditioner is light weight so you can take it with you from room to room. Powered by a micro 5-pin charger, you can even run Amazing Air Conditioner with a portable cell phone charger. Use Amazing Air Conditioner indoors or outdoors for clean and fresh air wherever you go .








TIP: When you sleep, direct Amazing Air Conditioner's airflow beneath your blanket for a cool and comfortable rest. Standard air conditioners, if left on all night, can make you catch a cold or dry out your skin. Beyond that, if kept on for prolonged periods of time, you'll face a scary energy bill. Avoid the annoying ritual of waking up to turn off the air conditioner in the middle of the night with Amazing Air Conditioner.


Amazing Air Conditioner also has an LED light in its neck to act as an energy efficient night light. Get fresh air and add ambiance with Amazing Air Conditioner's soft glowing light. 



We often don't think about it but electricity is derived from natural resources including natural gas and coal. These resources are limited and therefore it is important to conserve electricity not just for money concerns but also for environmental reasons.  



Amazing Air Conditioner is capable of incredibly low power usage because it doesn't just derive its cooling power from electricity but also from ice! By using the natural cold of ice, Amazing Air Conditioner is the most eco-friendly air conditioner in the world. When equipped with a frozen ice chamber, Amazing Air Conditioner can keep you cool for up to 8 hours. With three chambers, you can stay cool all day long! Personal, portable and environmentally friendly Amazing Air Conditioner is the only A.C. you need to fight the heat. 








With its simple one-touch button, Amazing Air Conditioner can be turned OFF, increase air flow strength, and switch to air purifier mode.  












It is important to consider the air we breathe. Over exposure to the cold blast of a standard air conditioner can cause colds and respiratory diseases. When not cleaned properly, Air conditioners build up bacteria and germs that are re-circulated through out the room. Especially for children, the elderly, and those with conditions such as asthma, standard air conditioners can pose a health risk.   
Unlike standard air conditioners, Amazing Air Conditioner also acts as an air purifier to remove harmful airborne particles as small as 0.3 um. With its wound filter design, Amazing Air Conditioner has an expansive surface area to catch countless pollutants with no need for frequent replacement. Just clean the filter once a month with water. Amazing Air Conditioner has been proven to filter airborne particles and chemicals including: Micro-dust, CO2, Gas Fumes, Pollen, Mold, Viruses, Allergens, Germs, Bacteria, Formaldehyde, Toluene and Benzene.




Amazing Grace was founded on the principle of service to both humanity and the world. We believe that products are a reflection of the developers that create them. In Amazing Air Conditioner, we were inspired by Earth Hour where the world joins together to turn off the lights in order to combat climate change. We thought how could we offer a positive change to the world? For three years we developed Amazing Air Conditioner in the hope that it can create a small but meaningful push in the fight to conserve electricity.

story:
DEADLINE EXTENDED TO THURSDAY, 1/5/12

My Story

Hello.  I am a 3 1/2 year survivor of breast cancer and a widow with a child still at home.  In 2008, I had to have a double masectomy and lymph nodes removed from both sides.  The next day, they had to do another lymph node dissection because they found cancer in the lymph nodes they removed.  No one had ever informed me about lymphedema risks and the fact that 35% of breast cancer patients get it to some degree. When the lymph nodes are removed due to breast cancer, fluid builds up in the affected area which for me is my arms, chest, ribs, underarms, and back.  I have severe lymphedema in my torso area and lighter lymphedema in my arms.  I have bought and tried many, many different compression garmets and devices but none work.  


I lived in a large city before moving back to rural Louisiana where I grew up.  In the large cities, there are doctors that can manually drain the fluid that accumulates.  In rural America, not so much, in fact, not at all.  My insurance company has finally preauthorized the purchase and certified the medical necessity of the lymph jacket and pump.  Unfortunately, I my co-pay is quite expensive.  


The medical supply company ordered the jacket and pump and dated the sale 12/30.  I do not have to actually give them the funds until Thursday when they deliver and customize it for me.  Keeping my fingers crossed...


The Impact

This lymph jacket will be used by me several times a week for the rest of my life.  It will keep the fluid from accumulating in my torso which limits my daily life as well as the things I can do with my child.  The pain that occurs from the fluid accumulation is so bad that it becomes so overwhelming.  Driving for any distance longer than an hour and flying in a plane both cause the lymphedema to get worse so my travel is limited.   Constant pain changes who you are - something I learned from my late husband through all of his illness and disability after the Vietnam War.  I do not want to live with pain any longer and this device is a simple, though expensive, way to eliminate this pain and this problem.  It will allow me to live a normal life, just hook up to this machine for 30 minutes a day and I'll be good as new.  You can read info on this medical device at the URL below.   

http://www.lymphcompression.com/docs/jacket.pdf


What We Need & What You Get

This will truly be the gift that keeps on giving.  It will be used for the rest of my life.  Thanks to the generous donations I have raised $300 so far and only need $600 to meet my portion of the copay for January.  I have to pay a total of $1,800 but the medical supply company has generously agreed to break it into 2 payments.

You can call the medical supply company directly that I am buying the jacket from at (337) 893-0181, contact name is Shauna, company is Patients Care Medical Supply in Abbeville, who can take you donation if you prefer.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please reach out to anyone who has been affected by breast cancer that could help. You can view my YouTube video at:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2tcA41xbOyY

story:
OUR CAMPAIGN

In partnership with the Canadian Cancer Society and Lupus Ontario, Pharma Security Group has launched a campaign to deliver at least 5,000 PharmaClocks to patients living in Canada. For every $18 contributed, we will send a patient our PharmaClock pill container with built-in alarm reminder system. By helping them to better manage their medication, this product will not only help to make their lives less stressful, but will provide them with the peace of mind that they truly deserve. 

 

ABOUT THE PHARMACLOCK

The PharmaClock is an all-in-one pill container with a built-in alarm reminder system. The unit includes up to 4 daily sound and light alarms that alert the user to take their medication at specific times throughout the day. If the user is not present when the alarm goes off, the alarm will automatically shutoff after 1 minute to conserve battery power, while still indicating (on the screen) that the user did not acknowledge the alarm. The unit also includes 7 large snap-shut storage compartments which correspond to each day of the week and the unit is made from food grade plastic, is recyclable, and accepts 2 AAA batteries.

 

AS SEEN ON THE SHOPPING CHANNEL:

 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

As we would like to donate at least 5,000 PharmaClocks to patients across Canada, we require $90,000 in order to make this dream come true. We also plan to donate a portion of any left over funds back to the Canadian Cancer Society and Lupus Ontario to help support their causes, and make lupus and cancer a thing of the past. 

Although you may never know the patient you are about to help, you will receive the joy and satisfaction of knowing that your contribution was used to make a difference in that patient's life.

... Alternatively, you can also request to receive a PharmaClock to use for yourself or to give away as a gift to someone else who is on a regimen of pills.

 

THE IMPACT

It's unfortunate that cancer and lupus patients must endure so much in their lifetime, but worrying if they remembered to take their medication can now be a thing of the past, thanks to donors like yourself.

Our product will not only bring peace of mind to each patient and their families, but will help to ensure that these patients do not become part of the 125,000 people who die annually due to medication management and compliance errors (according to the Center for Disease Control & Prevention). 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you cannot afford to send a PharmaClock to a patient in need, please help us get the word out about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools! By sharing this campaign with your friends and family, you can help us make a difference in the lives of people suffering from cancer and lupus!

story:
[click here to view pictures of perks]

Eric Valor - ALS Patient Activist & SRG President

(picture courtesy of San Jose Mercury News)

This is Eric Valor. He is one of 30,000+ people in the US currently trying to survive ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis or "Lou Gehrig's Disease"). Since his diagnosis, ALS has taken a very heavy toll on him and his family; a toll that is personal, financial, and emotional. Even though Eric gradually became quadriplegic, losing all personal independence, and is now being kept alive only through the use of a mechanical ventilator, his mind has stayed sharp.

Instead of giving up, Eric decided to fight ALS. Though he is past his last natural breath, he took control of his situation. Through the use of a computer system which tracks the movement of his right eye (very similar to the technology used by another well known ALS patient - Stephen Hawking), he used the Internet to train himself in neuroscience then built a coalition of fellow patient activists and biotech entrepreneurs. Along with partners Ryan Bethencourt, Andrew Gengos, and Joseph Jackson, Eric founded SciOpen Research Group. SRG is a non-profit biotech with the sole purpose of developing J147 and other therapeutics for ALS, an orphan disease which has historically been neglected.

Eric and the SRG team created this crowdfunding campaign to fund the histopathology (microscopic tissue examination) lab work needed to better analyze the results of our already-ongoing study at the Salk Institute. Through this work, which will be published in a public Open-Access journal, SRG can bring J147 closer to the clinic for ALS patients.

This is SciOpen Research Group

6000 Americans Die From ALS Every Year

Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (aka ALS or "Lou Gehrig's Disease") is the most horrible neurodegenerative condition possible. It strikes in the prime of life, robbing the person of movement while keeping the mind sharp and all too aware of the prison of their increasingly-inert bodies. Because 90% of those afflicted die within two to five years of diagnosis, the number of patients living at any single moment is relatively low. Therefore, big pharmaceutical companies have deemed it unprofitable and research to bring treatments into the clinic has lagged. Lag equals lost lives.

Because ALS frequently hits in the prime of life, it creates a severe economic drag in terms of lost productivity. This extends beyond the patient to the family, bankrupting savings and destroying careers as they try to care for their loved one.

With the explosion in technology, advanced scientific tools are now available to citizen scientists. This has led to the formation of "hacker" biolabs and the emergence of a movement called "guerrilla biotech". SciOpen Research Group is the first fully operational guerrilla biotech. We are dedicated to doing the difficult science that for-profit pharmaceutical companies find too "risky". We can do novel and creative scientific experiments necessary to bring basic research discoveries, bridging the "Valley of Death" between lab bench to patient bedside. And we make the results of our work available to the public, not hidden behind paywalls.

There is of course risk. This is science. The SOD1 ALS mouse testing is currently ongoing and there is no guarantee that J147 will succeed in significantly prolonging the lives of those mice. However, as outlined in a recent publication on J147, we believe the data is promising. We would appreciate any help you can provide through donations, spreading the word to others who can help support the campaign, or providing other publicity for this campaign.

Why SciOpen Research Group Is Important



What Is SRG's Plan?



The Wrap

SciOpen Research Group needs your help! Our experiment is already underway. We will generate good data for sure. But to generate GREAT data, we need to do microscopic tissue examination. Help us bring this project home. Together we can change the research landscape and provide hope for those afflicted with ALS.

[click here to view pictures of the perks]
