story:
English version follows - scroll down please :-)...

Résumé

Nous avons beson de votre aide pour boucler nos frais de voyage et de production d'un zine sur l'attention somatique au travail sur ordinateur.

Anne Goldenberg est une artiste chercheuse qui aime l'univers hacker sous un jour poétique et féministe. Karine Rathle est une danseuse et éducatrice somatique qui s'intéresse au bien-être dans toute sorte de condition. Nous travaillons depuis un an sur les rapports d'intimités de créativité et de libertés vis-à-vis de l'informatique et sur l'attention à soi dans le travail sur ordinateur.
 
En juin, nous partons pour Hobart, en Australie, pour participer au festival NAF:TMC
(Networked Art Forms: Tactical Magick Faerie Circuits) ou Tactical Magick pour les intimes. Ce fantastique festival rassemblera des artistes, des théoricien.ne,s, des techno-chamans, des fées électriques et d'autres magicien.ne.s qui viendront du monde entier pour partager leurs imaginaires, leurs secrets et leurs explorations dans le domaine des arts médiatiques, de l'art réseau et de la performance multimédia. Il est présenté par le hackerspace feministe Miss Desponia. 
 
Nous allons donner une performance  (White Magic | Black Magic), qui confronte le sentiment de pouvoir dans  les univers Macintosh et Linux, une des réalisation du projet ERSE qui s'intéresse à l'Esthétique Relationnelle des Systémes d'Exploitation. 
 
Nous avons aussi été invitées à profiter d'une résidence à la galerie Constance ARI pendant 10 jours pour donner des ateliers d'Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics. 
Ces ateliers s'inscrivent dans le projet Working Still-Still Working, une recherche création qui s'intéresse aux problèmes de l'immobilité et de la durée du travail sur ordinateur.
Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics vise à réfléchir aux dimensions assujetisantes du travail sur ordinateur et à construire un corpus de propositions poétiques d'émancipation somatiques :
  • Un confessionnal somatique amène tout d'abord les participant.e.s à raconter, décrire ou subjuguer leurs routines relationnelles avec leur ordinateurs. 
  • Illes sont ensuite conduit.es à explorer des avenues d’émancipation par des exercices et des improvisations somatiques.
  • Finalement, les participant.e.s seront convié.e.s à réaliser des propositions tactiques et poétiques d'émancipation somatique pour travail à l'ordinateur.
Les résultats des ateliers seront présentés sous la forme d'une installation à la fin du festival NAF:TMFC. Nous produirons aussi un zine bilingue français et anglais qui sera distribué à notre retour d'Australie, dans différents centres d'artistes, médialab et autres lieux de travail intéréssés par ces formes d'émancipation...et à vous, si vous nous soutenez.
 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez


Nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour entrer dans nos frais de voyage et de production.
Le billet coute 2100 dollars chacune environ.
Jusqu'alors, nous avons réussi à financer 65 % de nos frais de transport (avec une bourse de  LOJIQ et une autre du Conseil des Arts du Canada). Il nous manquerait en gros 700x2, soit 1400 dollars.
 
Nous partons fin mai, et pour un mois. Nous serons logées par les amies là-bas, mais aurons besoin de manger, boire quelques cafés, et d'acheter un peu de matériel pour la tenue des ateliers et la constitution des zines. Pour cela nous avons besoin d'un autre petit 1000 dollars au moins. D'ou cette demande de soutien, 2500, pour qu'on ne se ruinent pas (plus) en route :-).
 

L'impact

Notre participation à ce festival, la tenue des ateliers et l'exposition subséquente consistuent un moment majeur pour l'avancée du projet ERSE et WorkingStill/StillWorking. 

Dans un premier temps, les ateliers alimenteront le site WorkingStill/StillWorking et constituera le contenu du zine.
 
Une présentation publique des résultats de l'atelier et une distribution du zine aura lieu à l'automne 2013 au Lab NT2, à Montréal (Un très chouette laboratoire de littérature numérique qui soutient techniquement ce projet).
 
A long terme, les ateliers Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics contribueront à nourrir une plateforme multimédia d'émancipation collective pour le bien-être au travail sur ordinateur. L'utopie en bout de ligne étant de nous soutenir, poétiquement et somatiquement, dans notre quotidien de travail à l'ordinateur. Est-ce que cela vous fait aussi rêver ?

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne voulez pas utiliser le web pour déposer de l'argent, nous pouvons nous arranger. Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez aider autrement.

  • Passez le mot et faites de la publicité autour de ce projet.
  • Aidez-nous a confectionner le zine.
  • Donnez-nous des psst de financements.
  • Envoyez-nous de bonnes idées.
Merci à vous 
on espère que cela vous inspire comme cela nous enthousiasme...
au plaisir,
 
Som(t)a(t)icquement votre, 
Anne et Karine
 
***********************************

ENGLISH

 

Summary

 

We need you help to finance a trip and  the production fees for a zine on somatic education on computer mediated work.
 
Anne Goldenberg is an artist researcher who loves the hacker world with a feminist and poetic touch. Karine Rathle  is a dancer and somatic educator interested in well-being for all kinds of conditions. We have been working together for more then a year now on the intimite relation of creativity and liberty of technology and the well-being of the body and mind when working on computers. 
 
 In June, we are going to Hobart in Australia for the  NAF:TMC ( Networked Art Forms: Tactical Magick Faerie Circuits) festival or Tactile Magic for friends. 
The amazing festival brings together artists, theorist, techno-chamans and other magiciens from around the world to share their creativity, their secrets and explorations in the fields of mediatic arts, network art and multimedia performance. It is presented by the feminist hackerspace Miss Desponia.
 
We  will be performing at the begining of the festival (White Magic Black  Magic) a piece that confrontes the power struggle between the universes of Macintosh and Linux, a further exploration under the ERSE project  (acronim from the french title : Esthétique Relationnelle des Systémes  d'Exploitation)
 
We have also been invited for a residency at Constance ARI for 10 days to give Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics workshops.
These workshops are part of  the Working Still-Still Working, a research and developpement project  looking through a poetic lense at the implication of immobility and at  the length of time spent in front of a computer. 
Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)icsaims to reflect upon the wider dimension of working with computers and  exploring emancipatory propositions through somatic explorations and  liberating exercises. 
 
  • First the participants will  have the freedom to explore a somatic confessional where they will  brought to tell us their tales, write or subjugate their relational  routines with their personal computer.
  • Then the participants are guided to explore creative emancipatory avenues through techno-humanist improvised suggestions. 
  • Finally, the participants will be conveyed to create tactic and poetic propositions of somatic emancipation for computer work. 
 
The results of the workshops  will be presented through an installation at the end of the festival  NAF:TMFC and a bilingual Zine will be distributed at our return of  Australia in different artist centers, medialabs and other venues  interested in these forms of emancipation... and to you if you support  our project. 
 
 

Impact

 

Our  participation at this festival, through workshops, performances and an  exhibition, constitutes a major advancement for the project ERSE and WorkingStill | StillWorking. In the first instance the workshops will feed the website of WorkingStill/StillWorking and will constitute the content of the Zine.

Another public presentation has been scheduled in Automn 2013 at Lab NT2, UQAM, Montreal. 
In the long term, the workshops  Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics will contribute to build a collective multimedia emancipatory plateform for the well-being of computer work. The ultimate utopia is that we would be self-supported poetically and somatically while working daily on computers. Does that make you dream as well?

What we need and what you get

We need your support to help with the cost of travelling and production. The plane tickets cost 2100 CAN$ each, and for now we are financed at 65% of our transport fees through LOJIC and the Canada Council for the Arts. We are still missing 700X2 for the plane tickets and since we are leaving for a month, although we will be living with friends there, we still need to eat and buy some material for the workshops and the creation of the Zines. Roughly another 1000 CAN$, which explains this support request of 2500 CAN$. This will help us not get ruined in the process of this amazing project :-)
 

 

Other ways to help us

If you don't want to use the web to deposit money, we can make arrangements. If you can't contribute financially, you can help us in other ways.

  • Spread the word and make some publicity around this project.
  • Help us build the Zine.
  • Give us hints on how to finance it.
  • Send us good ideas.
 
Thank you so so much! 
We hope that this inspires you as much as us!
 
Soma(t)!cally yours,
Anne & Karine
story_txt:
English version follows - scroll down please :-)...
Résumé
Nous avons beson de votre aide pour boucler nos frais de voyage et de production d'un zine sur l'attention somatique au travail sur ordinateur.

Anne Goldenberg est une artiste chercheuse qui aime l'univers hacker sous un jour poétique et féministe. Karine Rathle est une danseuse et éducatrice somatique qui s'intéresse au bien-être dans toute sorte de condition. Nous travaillons depuis un an sur les rapports d'intimités de créativité et de libertés vis-à-vis de l'informatique et sur l'attention à soi dans le travail sur ordinateur.

 

En juin, nous partons pour Hobart, en Australie, pour participer au festival NAF:TMC


(Networked Art Forms: Tactical Magick Faerie Circuits) ou Tactical Magick pour les intimes. Ce fantastique festival rassemblera des artistes, des théoricien.ne,s, des techno-chamans, des fées électriques et d'autres magicien.ne.s qui viendront du monde entier pour partager leurs imaginaires, leurs secrets et leurs explorations dans le domaine des arts médiatiques, de l'art réseau et de la performance multimédia. Il est présenté par le hackerspace feministe Miss Desponia. 

 

Nous allons donner une performance  (White Magic | Black Magic), qui confronte le sentiment de pouvoir dans  les univers Macintosh et Linux, une des réalisation du projet ERSE qui s'intéresse à l'Esthétique Relationnelle des Systémes d'Exploitation. 

 

Nous avons aussi été invitées à profiter d'une résidence à la galerie Constance ARI pendant 10 jours pour donner des ateliers d'Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics.  


Ces ateliers s'inscrivent dans le projet Working Still-Still Working, une recherche création qui s'intéresse aux problèmes de l'immobilité et de la durée du travail sur ordinateur.


Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics vise à réfléchir aux dimensions assujetisantes du travail sur ordinateur et à construire un corpus de propositions poétiques d'émancipation somatiques : 


Un confessionnal somatique amène tout d'abord les participant.e.s à raconter, décrire ou subjuguer leurs routines relationnelles avec leur ordinateurs. 


Illes sont ensuite conduit.es à explorer des avenues d’émancipation par des exercices et des improvisations somatiques.

Finalement, les participant.e.s seront convié.e.s à réaliser des propositions tactiques et poétiques d'émancipation somatique pour travail à l'ordinateur.


Les résultats des ateliers seront présentés sous la forme d'une installation à la fin du festival NAF:TMFC. Nous produirons aussi un zine bilingue français et anglais qui sera distribué à notre retour d'Australie, dans différents centres d'artistes, médialab et autres lieux de travail intéréssés par ces formes d'émancipation...et à vous, si vous nous soutenez.


 


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez
Nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour entrer dans nos frais de voyage et de production.
Le billet coute 2100 dollars chacune environ.
Jusqu'alors, nous avons réussi à financer 65 % de nos frais de transport (avec une bourse de  LOJIQ et une autre du Conseil des Arts du Canada). Il nous manquerait en gros 700x2, soit 1400 dollars. 
 
Nous partons fin mai, et pour un mois. Nous serons logées par les amies là-bas, mais aurons besoin de manger, boire quelques cafés, et d'acheter un peu de matériel pour la tenue des ateliers et la constitution des zines. Pour cela nous avons besoin d'un autre petit 1000 dollars au moins. D'ou cette demande de soutien, 2500, pour qu'on ne se ruinent pas (plus) en route :-).
 


L'impact
Notre participation à ce festival, la tenue des ateliers et l'exposition subséquente consistuent un moment majeur pour l'avancée du projet ERSE et WorkingStill/StillWorking. 
Dans un premier temps, les ateliers alimenteront le site WorkingStill/StillWorking et constituera le contenu du zine.
 
Une présentation publique des résultats de l'atelier et une distribution du zine aura lieu à l'automne 2013 au Lab NT2, à Montréal (Un très chouette laboratoire de littérature numérique qui soutient techniquement ce projet).
 

A long terme, les ateliers Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics contribueront à nourrir une plateforme multimédia d'émancipation collective pour le bien-être au travail sur ordinateur. L'utopie en bout de ligne étant de nous soutenir, poétiquement et somatiquement, dans notre quotidien de travail à l'ordinateur. Est-ce que cela vous fait aussi rêver ?




D'autres façons d'aider
Si vous ne voulez pas utiliser le web pour déposer de l'argent, nous pouvons nous arranger. Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez aider autrement.

Passez le mot et faites de la publicité autour de ce projet.
Aidez-nous a confectionner le zine.
Donnez-nous des psst de financements.
Envoyez-nous de bonnes idées.


Merci à vous 
on espère que cela vous inspire comme cela nous enthousiasme...
au plaisir,
 
Som(t)a(t)icquement votre, 
Anne et Karine
 
***********************************
ENGLISH
 
Summary
 

We need you help to finance a trip and  the production fees for a zine on somatic education on computer mediated work.
 

Anne Goldenberg is an artist researcher who loves the hacker world with a feminist and poetic touch. Karine Rathle  is a dancer and somatic educator interested in well-being for all kinds of conditions. We have been working together for more then a year now on the intimite relation of creativity and liberty of technology and the well-being of the body and mind when working on computers. 

 

 In June, we are going to Hobart in Australia for the  NAF:TMC ( Networked Art Forms: Tactical Magick Faerie Circuits) festival or Tactile Magic for friends. 

The amazing festival brings together artists, theorist, techno-chamans and other magiciens from around the world to share their creativity, their secrets and explorations in the fields of mediatic arts, network art and multimedia performance. It is presented by the feminist hackerspace Miss Desponia.
 
We  will be performing at the begining of the festival (White Magic Black  Magic) a piece that confrontes the power struggle between the universes of Macintosh and Linux, a further exploration under the ERSE project  (acronim from the french title : Esthétique Relationnelle des Systémes  d'Exploitation)
 

We have also been invited for a residency at Constance ARI for 10 days to give Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics workshops.

These workshops are part of  the Working Still-Still Working, a research and developpement project  looking through a poetic lense at the implication of immobility and at  the length of time spent in front of a computer. 

Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)icsaims to reflect upon the wider dimension of working with computers and  exploring emancipatory propositions through somatic explorations and  liberating exercises. 

 


First the participants will  have the freedom to explore a somatic confessional where they will  brought to tell us their tales, write or subjugate their relational  routines with their personal computer.




Then the participants are guided to explore creative emancipatory avenues through techno-humanist improvised suggestions. 




Finally, the participants will be conveyed to create tactic and poetic propositions of somatic emancipation for computer work. 


 
The results of the workshops  will be presented through an installation at the end of the festival  NAF:TMFC and a bilingual Zine will be distributed at our return of  Australia in different artist centers, medialabs and other venues  interested in these forms of emancipation... and to you if you support  our project. 
 
 

Impact
 
Our  participation at this festival, through workshops, performances and an  exhibition, constitutes a major advancement for the project ERSE and WorkingStill | StillWorking. In the first instance the workshops will feed the website of WorkingStill/StillWorking and will constitute the content of the Zine. 
Another public presentation has been scheduled in Automn 2013 at Lab NT2, UQAM, Montreal. 

In the long term, the workshops  Attent!on Som(T)ac(t)ics will contribute to build a collective multimedia emancipatory plateform for the well-being of computer work. The ultimate utopia is that we would be self-supported poetically and somatically while working daily on computers. Does that make you dream as well?



What we need and what you get

We need your support to help with the cost of travelling and production. The plane tickets cost 2100 CAN$ each, and for now we are financed at 65% of our transport fees through LOJIC and the Canada Council for the Arts. We are still missing 700X2 for the plane tickets and since we are leaving for a month, although we will be living with friends there, we still need to eat and buy some material for the workshops and the creation of the Zines. Roughly another 1000 CAN$, which explains this support request of 2500 CAN$. This will help us not get ruined in the process of this amazing project :-)
 
 


Other ways to help us
If you don't want to use the web to deposit money, we can make arrangements. If you can't contribute financially, you can help us in other ways.

Spread the word and make some publicity around this project.
Help us build the Zine.
Give us hints on how to finance it.
Send us good ideas.


 
Thank you so so much! 
We hope that this inspires you as much as us!

 
Soma(t)!cally yours,
Anne & Karine

story:
Hello.... my name is Kate and I'm the mother of Jake, 8 years old and Brook, 19 months. Brook has been diagnosed with a rare, neurological disorder. She was born perfectly healthy until the age of 6 months.... she then lost the ability to do anything. She has never spoken, she has never walked, she is fed 100% by a feeding tube... she has no purposeful hand use, she can't bare any weight on her legs, she can't hold her own head up due to severe hypotonia and, just two weeks ago, we were informed that she has lost her sight due to a storage disorder that has destroyed both optic nerves and both retina's. Brook was diagnosed with Tay-Sachs Disease on July 23rd, 2012. This is fatal. Most children do not live past the age of 4 years old.

This campaign is very important to our family for many reasons but the most important reason is to keep Brook as comfortable as possible while she is with us. Part of this horrible disease is atrophy of the muscles. They become stiff and eventually, unable to be moved at all. This is already happening to Brook and we need to keep her as comfortable as possible.... we only have one bathroom in our house and the tub is very small. I am hoping to raise enough fund to re-construct our downstairs bathroom into a full bath with a whirlpool rub that has a chair lift attached. 


I attached a picture of Brook when she was still able to sit in her bumbo chair and take a bath in the sink. She is in pure BLISS in this picture. Water changes her... it helps her.... it relieves the pain she has in her muscles and it's become almost impossible to bath her in our small bathtub.

The funds from this campaign will go towards the contractor, the electrician and the plumber as well as all of the materials needed. She will also need a special chair lift to put her in and take her out of the tub.

My goal is to raise enough money to complete this project and perhaps have additional funds to take my son, with Brook, on a trip. Jake, my 8 year old, does not yet know that what Brook has is fatal and she, most likely, will not live past the age of 4 years old. I want to be able to have a memory that we can all remember together before she is taken from us. Until then, my goal is to keep her as happy and as comfortable as possible.

I can't tell you how much any donation will mean to us and to learm more about Tay-Sachs Disease, please go to: www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov

Sincerely, Kate, Jake and especially, Brook

story:
UPDATE!
==================================

We have attained enough to reach the $1,000 retainer fee and have hired a attorney. We are working toward a resolve and will reveal more info once it comes available.


Thank you all, very very much!!!


--------------------------------------------------------------
Why We Are Asking For Your Help? 

We are being unfairly attacked in the most cruel way. Non-supportive family members have made false allegations in a ploy to cause lasting damage to our family.  The state we live in is notoriously judgmental about gender diversity. We are desperate to right this wrong and need funds before our court date to get legal counsel. We would be very grateful for any amount you can afford to donate.

 

Don't let this small town bigotry destroy our loving family.


What Funds Are Needed:

Attorney Cost: A retainer fee of $1,000 up front and a total of ($5,000) to continue and complete our case.

 

Perks For Donating:

Perk #1 Donate ($25.00) or more and recieve this T-Shirt along with perk selected.

 

 

Perk #2 Donate $100.00 or more and recieve a personal heartfelt thank you letter along with perk selected to the right.

Perk #3 Donate $500.00 or more and recieve a personal heartfelt thank you letter along with perk selected to the right.

 

You Can Make A Difference ( BY SHARING )

Don't have a dollar to your name? That's okay! You can help by sharing this story with your friends.

Share Our Campaign @ http://www.indiegogo.com/StopBigotry

Tweet Our Campaign: Stop Bigotry From Destroying Our Family on @indiegogo http://igg.me/p/227356?a=474104&i=twtr

story:
Greenlite Meals is the change towards a healthy lifestyle like no other change you will ever make! We offer ready-to-eat, plant-based meals made with all natural, organic, and non-GMO ingredients.  Our team of health & nutrition experts works one-on-one with our clients to help them live the healthy life they deserve, all the while keeping it super simple and easy. We provide the food, the counseling, and the fitness advice necessary to help them reach their goals on the road to better health. Our mission is to be by our clients’ side with the tools they need from start to finish throughout their journey!

The average diet consumed today is highly caloric with very little nutritional value. As a result, rates of heart disease, cancer, diabetes, obesity, and other chronic illnesses have skyrocketed to nearly epidemic proportions in the US. Numerous studies over the last few decades have clearly shown that people whose diets focus on plant-based, whole foods tend to have a lower risk of chronic disease.

At the age of 22, Matt Lenzi, founder of Greenlite Meals, found himself overweight with borderline high blood pressure and cholesterol. With a family history of diabetes, he knew he was well on his way to developing the disease if he didn’t change his unhealthy habits immediately. After much research, Matt began to change his diet to one based on plants and grains and began exercising daily. Through his journey, Matt was able to drop over 60 pounds! This change in weight as well as his improved overall health has inspired him to share everything he learned about fitness and plant-based diets.

In April of 2013, Matt’s father passed away and that’s when he decided he wanted to be more proactive in helping people get the tools they need to live a healthier life.  He uprooted himself from Boston where he was practicing law and moved to the West Coast to make Greenlite Meals a reality!

HOW YOU WILL HELP!

With your donations, Greenlite Meals will be able to expand its operations and staff to provide more nutritional meals to larger food desserts throughout the US. Currently, we are not able to fill all the orders we receive due to the size of our kitchen and staff as well as the equipment we need to perform on a much larger scale. With your help, we can make Greenlite Meals the healthy alternative to processed food Americans are craving for and need to help them get healthy, and reverse the trend of chronic diseases plaguing America!

story:
Friends, family and whomever else may have stumbled on this page: I always knew I didn't fit in this body, and in my late teens, I started transitioning. I've been on testosterone for 5.5 years now. 

One of the most important changes I needed to make for myself was chest surgery, a double mastectomy with contouring. It would give me a masculine chest and is not the same as a mastectomy. It's commonly referred to as Top Surgery.

April 1st, Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness announced that MSI would fund SRS, sexual reassignment surgeries. On their list of procedures covered, mastectomies are listed but contouring is NOT covered. They do not fund this necessary part of the procedure because they don't understand that it isn't just the flatness that matters in the end, it's the fact that I want to identify with that piece of my body. It's the difference between doing it for other people's comfort, so they aren't confused about my gender and doing it for me, so I can enjoy my life.

You may have come across my name in the news a few times in the past few years. I had a hysterectomy in 2010 and was forced to leave the hospital just 24 hours after the hysto began. Adding insult to injury, MSI claimed that the hysto was part of my transition and they would not pay for it, or the hospital care, despite the fact that it was a medically necessary surgery.
Since then I've been working with a great lawyer on the Human Rights case I filed against MSI. I won the Raymond Taavel Media Award from Nova Scotia Rainbow Action Project in 2012. I played a part in the amending of Nova Scotia's Human Rights Act to include protections for gender expression and gender identity. In the last few months, I started a non profit organization, Nova Scotia Trans* Justice. It has great Directors who all care as much as i do about leveling the playing field for Trans folks in NS.

12000$ is a lot of money and for the longest time I didn't want to ask for help. I figured this was my cross to bear and everyone else has their own problems to deal with. But I haven't come close to that on my own.
No, I'm not working at the moment. The unemployment rate in Pictou County is sky high and I also have a criminal record which makes it even harder to find work. I pled Guilty to Production of Cannabis in 2013. I was growing pot to try to make enough money to get Top Surgery. I didn't know what I was doing, I hated it, I hate plants in general. By the time i was arrested in February of last year, i had been at it for 8 months or so and had hardly made enough money to feed myself and my two cats. We spent a month with no running water. Most of the plants died. They'd be fine when they got there and die before they made anyone money.
Desperation makes us do things we wouldn't normally do. Like indoor gardening. If the province funded SRS I wouldn't have a criminal record today.

If I don't reach my goal, there are other options. The quote I have is for The Landings Surgical Centre in Halifax, but there are other surgeons outside of NS that do this procedure often enough that they charge less for it. 
Please check back for new perks and update!

Every little bit helps! Thank you so much!

story:
Here's the deal:

Life is stressful. Emma, Katya, and Morgan are here to help. As three girls experiencing the pressures of high school, we know our peers need something to destress and we have the skills to make it.

 

We wanted to find a way to support our classmates before big presentations or difficult tests when we couldn’t physically be there. Talking with everyone from friends with social anxiety to friends who fidget, we developed Unwind, a product to help put pauses in your day and allow you to recenter yourself. With a vibrating, pulse-like rhythm, you can alleviate built-up anxiousness and sync your breathing to a brightening and dimming light.

Our Prototype

Currently, our prototype contains a circuit board, induction charging coil, and battery inside of a soft silicone shell with an additional induction charging pad. The object is openable via an acrylic ring in the center so the electronics are accessible. As we move towards manufacturing, we are looking to size down the electronics by fabricating our own circuit board. 

What We Need & What You Get

Moving forward, we need your help to begin manufacturing. With your generous contributions, we will start production using injection silicone molding combined with a custom circuit board. We will likely need $5,000 for injection molding, $3,000 for materials, and $2,000 for the overall assembly. And what better way to thank you for your support than branded tchotchkes! In our ‘perks’ section you will see everything from stickers to t-shirts that show our gratitude for investing both money and faith in Unwind.

The Big Picture

From fifth graders with restless hands to businesspeople preparing for an important meeting, Unwind can comfort any age on any stage. Although Unwind was originally designed to alleviate social anxiety, its calming nature serves to combat many common stressors of daily life.

With Unwind, mindfulness becomes tangible.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge in the manufacturing and production process is that we have never done it before. But that isn’t going to stop us. With an awesome network of resources, we are confident that we can find our way to a well-designed, well-produced, and well-received final product. However, that might take a little more time than your average startup given we have a full 8-class course load to complete alongside managing this project. But don’t worry, once you get to know us, you will know we can do it.

Who We Are

From left to right, we are Emma, Morgan, and Katya. We began working as a team last year and have been crushing the engineering game ever since. Emma serves as the team lead and designer, Morgan as the electrician, and Katya as the programmer. That said, we have all contributed to every element of this project, meaning we are just as excited when something works in the code as we are when the mold turns out well.  

If you have contacts with expertise in manufacturing, please reach out! Email emmduls@nuevaschool.org

Other Ways You Can Help

Funding or no funding we would love it if you could help us spread the word! Follow our Instagram, post on Facebook, and share the campaign link!
story_txt:
Here's the deal:
Life is stressful. Emma, Katya, and Morgan are here to help. As three girls experiencing the pressures of high school, we know our peers need something to destress and we have the skills to make it. We wanted to find a way to support our classmates before big presentations or difficult tests when we couldn’t physically be there. Talking with everyone from friends with social anxiety to friends who fidget, we developed Unwind, a product to help put pauses in your day and allow you to recenter yourself. With a vibrating, pulse-like rhythm, you can alleviate built-up anxiousness and sync your breathing to a brightening and dimming light.

Our Prototype
Currently, our prototype contains a circuit board, induction charging coil, and battery inside of a soft silicone shell with an additional induction charging pad. The object is openable via an acrylic ring in the center so the electronics are accessible. As we move towards manufacturing, we are looking to size down the electronics by fabricating our own circuit board. 

What We Need & What You Get
Moving forward, we need your help to begin manufacturing. With your generous contributions, we will start production using injection silicone molding combined with a custom circuit board. We will likely need $5,000 for injection molding, $3,000 for materials, and $2,000 for the overall assembly. And what better way to thank you for your support than branded tchotchkes! In our ‘perks’ section you will see everything from stickers to t-shirts that show our gratitude for investing both money and faith in Unwind.

The Big Picture
From fifth graders with restless hands to businesspeople preparing for an important meeting, Unwind can comfort any age on any stage. Although Unwind was originally designed to alleviate social anxiety, its calming nature serves to combat many common stressors of daily life.
With Unwind, mindfulness becomes tangible.

Risks & Challenges
The main challenge in the manufacturing and production process is that we have never done it before. But that isn’t going to stop us. With an awesome network of resources, we are confident that we can find our way to a well-designed, well-produced, and well-received final product. However, that might take a little more time than your average startup given we have a full 8-class course load to complete alongside managing this project. But don’t worry, once you get to know us, you will know we can do it.

Who We Are

From left to right, we are Emma, Morgan, and Katya. We began working as a team last year and have been crushing the engineering game ever since. Emma serves as the team lead and designer, Morgan as the electrician, and Katya as the programmer. That said, we have all contributed to every element of this project, meaning we are just as excited when something works in the code as we are when the mold turns out well.  
If you have contacts with expertise in manufacturing, please reach out! Email emmduls@nuevaschool.org

story:
With this very quesion, I set out to reinvent the ultimate bag from the ground up...with collapsible wheels and a pushbar, of course.

My name is Thinh Tran from Elk Grove, California. And I invented the Transrover. My search for the elusive solution began on March 2010. It soon became my obsession. I worked on it every chance I got. Usually late at night...in my garage or backyard, hacking out concepts and prototypes with whatever random scraps I could get my hands on. Finally, after nearly 9 years of inventing and perfecting, my vision for Transrover has been realized. We are all set for mass production. I hope you enjoy learning about this incredible product as much as I did inventing it. More importantly, I hope to have your support as a backer and join me on my journey to bring Transrover to life.

 

We are excited to be on Indiegogo. To all of you who believe in Transrover, from the bottom of our hearts, thank you for your support. As we are gearing up for tooling and mass production, there is a small window of time between now and placing our final PO. We want to bring Transrover to the INDIEGOGO community so more golfer can benefit from this great invention. Additional funding raised from this campaign will help us place a larger PO which, in turn, will lower the unit costs. It will be a huge boost for us. We will be able to order additional units for our awaiting wholesalers and retailers. We hope to have your support and join our incredible journey. Indiegogo Special Discounts are offered to all backers. Be one of the very first to own a Transrover at these introductory rates. The next time you see a Transrover out on the course, take pride knowing you lent a helping hand in bringing it to life!

 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

International Customs, Duties, and Tax Implications
   Transrover cannot mark orders as gifts. This is illegal and therefore, it will not be done. Our prices DO NOT include VAT, GST or other country taxes. Our terms of sale for international orders are FOB destination. This means that you pay all freight and customs, duties, taxes. As we are shipping these products in various parts of the world, it is not feasible for us to build in the various rates. For international customers who are required to pay customs, you will be contacted by the shipping carrier, or your local customs authorities. A payment from you will be requested in order for your order to clear customs. Unfortunately, there is no short cut or legal way to bypass customs. Once payment is arranged, your order will be processed for final delivery. 

Shipping procedure
   Within 24 hours of your order being shipped, you will receive an email with a tracking containing your shipping details. We use UPS and USPS for shipping and handling.

Shipping policy
   If our shipping carrier attempts delivery to you and you don’t get it because you’re not there, wrong address, moved without notifying us, and the package returns back to our warehouse, it will be your responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. 

Return Policy
   Products may be returned within 7 days of receipt in new, unused condition. Simply send it back and we will refund you, no questions asked. But don’t worry, we know you are going to love it! Returns will be credited for the product only and are subject to a 15% restocking fee, as well as the cost of returned shipping.

Warranty
   Transrover Inc. warrants the Tranrover to be free from manufacturing, workmanship, or material defects for one year from the date of purchase. This warranty does not cover abnormal wear or damage that occurs through abuse, accident, neglect or failure to follow the instructions or warnings contained in the user guide. The wear and tear are only covered for warranty if the product is damaged in these respects before initial use. Transrover Inc is sole judge of any and all warranty claims. Proof of purchase is required for all warranty inquiries. Our warranty policy DOES NOT cover any freight/shipping charges. Please note that a repair issue will NOT be covered by this warranty if: 

1. The warranty issue is caused by misuse or poor maintenance. Please refer to the instruction booklet for guidance on Transrover use and maintenance. 

2. Damage to Transrover due to general wear and tear, which is the result of everyday use or negligence. 

3. Repairs or modifications are carried out by you or a third party. 

4. Transrover is purchased from an unauthorized retailer. 

5. Transrover is purchased used or second-hand. 

6. Transrover is damaged as a result of an accident by you or third party. Please note that while the warranty may not be honored, replacement parts will be available for purchased to repair your Transrover. 

The above warranty specifications apply only to Transrovers purchased in the USA.

 

Risks & Challenges

Every project comes with its own unique risks and challenges. We have strong relationships with our vendors. Sourcing, manufacturing, and logistics have all been sorted out. We hold our suppliers to our strict quality assurance and production schedule. Despite our best effort, there could still be unforeseen glitches in tooling, assembling, and producing Transrover. We are all prepared and determined to tackle any challenges. Transrover Inc is a small company, operating out of our home offices and on the road. It is the same foundation and dedication that got us this far. Revenue generated from this campaign will be used towards production, not for large overhead expenses or salaries. We’re passionate about Transrover and delivering on our promises above all else. Once you become a Backer, we’ll keep you informed with our progress every step of the way. We look forward to sharing our journey with you.

 

Please help us spread the word

The best compliment is your personal referral. Please share our project with any golfer you know. They’ll love you for it. Our success depends on fans like you.
Thank you for your support!

story:
ÓGRA Skincare is a unique skincare range using peat as the primary ingredient which is DNA tested to be 9,100 years old. ÓGRA Skincare is a small Irish owned company based in the midlands of Ireland. Our Irish peat has the highest organic content in the world and has anti-ageing, rejuvenating and therapeutic properties.

We are passionate about developing the product to produce a skincare range that will be suitable for all skin types, in particular problem skin such as psoriasis, eczema or acne. We have many customers who advise us that they love using our products on their problem skin as it has been hugely beneficial to them in reducing the symptoms of their particular skin condition be it blemishes, dryness or itchy skin associated with psoriasis, eczema or acne.

As a young company we are passionate about the research we are completing and are excited about the future benefits this scientific research will provide in developing our products to help everyone have the best skin possible. We need to raise funds to complete this ground breaking research into the properties of our peat. All of your contributions to our campaign are hugely appreciated and we thank you. In return for your generous contribution you can chose from the range of perks which include our fabulous peat.

Please pledge your support today to help us with our goal of providing a skincare range that will provide healthy, youthful and vibrant skin for all.


Power of Peat - A story:

This is the story of Padraig, a twenty eight year old Down Syndrome male from Ireland. Padraig suffers from a severe form of Eczema on his back and neck. Being Down Syndrome, he was unable to take prescription medication as it usually has some impact elsewhere on his body. This condition had a big impact on his life causing him to feel down and frustrated by the irritation from the flakiness and itchiness. Two years ago he was introduced to ÓGRA Skincare where he has a peat treatment consisting of a layering of peat onto his back where it was left on for a period of 20 minutes. This was performed on him twice weekly for a period of six weeks. The result looked like this!

Before:

After:


ÓGRA harnesses the power of pure Irish peat, the most powerfully curative black peat proven to enrich and energize your skin at the cellular level, for healthier, more beautiful skin.


"Since time immemorial, nature has held the secrets to youth, beauty and vitality. Deep in the valleys of Ireland, we have uncovered this secret. At ÓGRA Skincare, we have discovered a revolutionary, all-natural ingredient that promotes healthier, more beautiful skin that has been 10,000 years in the making. ÓGRA comes from one of the most perfectly designed natural ecosystems on the planet; a 9,000-year old plant- and vegetation-rich, oxygen-free bog in Ireland. Peat is extracted from deep within the bog, Ireland’s perfect ecosystem. Here, the ideal conditions of climate have created a lush environment where Irish plants and flowers have thrived for thousands of years" Take a look at our ÓGRA's Interactive Story Book:


Our Research to date:

Our 2 year scientific research and development has validated that the therapeutic and preservative qualities allows this product to penetrate the skin barrier and therefore promote cell regeneration internally.

This essential gift of nature, which the land has given, and the responsible harvest that ÓGRA is embarking on, is our WHY of raising funds. We chose Indiegogo, to share our Story. We feel it is a story that is unending and we look to share our tale as we bring the peat into the world for others to experience.

To bring Ireland's rich history of this land and earth into the world, we need to raise $20,000. The only way we look to raise funds is through sharing the peat mask with the people who would like to back us. We know this is the best gift we could ever provide.

By pledging your funds, we ask for you to consider sharing our Irish curative peat with your friends, family and others you believe would also appreciate this energetic living formula.

Through this sharing, our intention is that we can connect with others around the world through educating about the beauty properties the peat delivers within skin care and the reverence we feel in our connection and responsibility with nature as caretakers.

Watch Ógra being applied:


ÓGRA  Peat Products are an innovative skincare solution formulated using natural peat. This powerhouse product contains dynamic phyto power evolved over thousands of years.

The effectiveness of peat lies in its ability to help activate the skin’s natural regeneration process boosting the skin’s appearance resulting in skin that looks radiant and young and feels incredibly smooth to the touch. In addition the peat has superior anti- oxidant and moisturising properties helping maintain the health and youthfulness of the skin.  

Peat is nature's most powerful preserving product which has evolved over millennia with more than 1000 herbs, plants, grasses and flowers having decomposed into the waters forming a nutritious mud compound. Peat is one of the most powerful & potent substances, containing a multitude of minerals, phyto nutrients and phyto chemicals. These are the driving force behind it's preserving abilities. Of particular importance are the virtually unknown humic & fulvic acids. These are natural acids that penetrate the skin & influence the enzymatic activity of the body.


Your Help!

Please pledge your support today to help us with our goal of providing a skincare range that will provide healthy, youthful and vibrant skin for all.

“To bring Ireland's rich history of this land and earth into the world, we need to raise $20,000”.


Ireland's Pre-historic Royalty Preserved For a Millenia: Take a look.


We look forward to your support. This is a really exciting time for us. We'll be updating the campaign and keeping you posted throughout. Thanks, from the ÓGRA team. 

Reviews of ÓGRA's peatmask and the incredible story behind it:
CosmeticDesign-Europe

Suzanne Jackson - SOSUEME

story:
Basketball Revolution!

We are a multi-disciplinary team creating a viable, professional internet basketball league that is owned by regular (non-rich) people. The experience will be similar to the billion-dollar ownership experience in that our owners will draft, pay, trade, cut and merchandise their players.

With the internet as our sole source of audience, we lose the need for in-person attendance and related expenses such as security, parking, increased insurance. And, we make pro sports team ownership affordable; we create a new class of professional athletes; we make jobs; we offer league-wide profit sharing so advertising dollars flow back to our owner-partners. Owners can have fun and have the potential to make money if they manage their team in the right way.

We almost sold this idea to a venture capitalist for $500,000 but the terms were terrible for us. Crowdfunding gives us the best chance to do it right.

                                   What We Need the Money For

Once up and running, our team-owner fees will cover most of our operating costs, including paying players, building construction. Our goal of a league with 4,000 owners per team with 15 teams and total fees of $125 per person builds an operating fund of $7.5 million. Ongoing advertising partnerships and fees are projected to cover additional costs.

We are asking for $25,000 as a downpayment to buy land on which we will build our league-specific building. The asking price is $90,000 and we will make the payments and raise the remaining funds to complete our building within a year. The site is located near Chicago, which has a high population of young men and women who play basketball, and it is easily accessible by all forms of transportation.

Our website is in the avanced design phase; our marketing/sales is further along than that. We have met with Fortune 500 clients to show them how their ad dollars would be effectively spent with us. Our missing link is a building specifically for this league and sport.

If we fall short of our goal, this money will go to either a cheaper tract of land or into marketing the idea with more angelic investors that will keep the idea in its current form.

                                What We Will Give You, Our Funder

* Want to be a pro athlete? This is your chance! From $1 to $5 you will get an automatic invitation for you or the player of your choice to participate in our invite-only play-in. Only play-in winners are drafted into the league.

 * From $5 to $10 you will also get a league pass to watch five games for free.

 * From $10 to $25 you get all of this and an autographed mini-basketball.

 * From $25 to $50 you get all of this and a commemorative T-shirt.

 * From $50 to $100 you get all of this plus a full-season pass to view all games.

 * For $1,000 you get all this and you get to name one of our 15 teams! Name it after your dog, your school, yourself or a loved one!

                         Why We Love the Idea and Think You Will, Too

This project not only creates jobs, it can be an investment – just as it is now is for wealthy pro sports owners. Pro sports is a still a top-down industry. But, with the internet, the consumer can become the producer. This puts billions of dollars, which now remain in the hands of millionaires and billionaires, back in play and in your pocket. Share in the fun, the risk, the profit. It's a sure bet the NBA doesn't want to share any money with you.

                                             Spread the Word

So, please help us with funding OR by telling as many people as you can about it – especially men and women who are between 18 and 35, or your favorite gaming fanatics.

 * From $5 to $10 you will also get a league pass to watch five games for free.
 * From $10 to $25 you get all of this and an autographed mini-basketball.
 * From $25 to $50 you get all of this and a commemorative T-shirt.
 * From $50 to $100 you get all of this plus a full-season pass to view all games.
 * For $1,000 you get all this and you get to name one of our 15 teams! Name it after your dog, your school, yourself or a loved one!
                         Why We Love the Idea and Think You Will, Too
This project not only creates jobs, it can be an investment – just as it is now is for wealthy pro sports owners. Pro sports is a still a top-down industry. But, with the internet, the consumer can become the producer. This puts billions of dollars, which now remain in the hands of millionaires and billionaires, back in play and in your pocket. Share in the fun, the risk, the profit. It's a sure bet the NBA doesn't want to share any money with you.
                                             Spread the Word
So, please help us with funding OR by telling as many people as you can about it – especially men and women who are between 18 and 35, or your favorite gaming fanatics.

story:
Campaign has continued:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/liv-cheng-go...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/liv-cheng-go...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/liv-cheng-go...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/liv-cheng-go...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/liv-cheng-go...



Check out 

http://www.livcheng.com 




Name:  Liv Cheng 
DOB:  16th June 1993
Ethnicity:  Taiwanese
Nationality:  New Zealand
Instagram:  @livycheng
Twitter:  @livycheng
LinkedIn:  Liv Cheng
Email: livcheng93@gmail.com
Represent:  Manukau Golf Club, 
                        Auckland Province
                        New Zealand
Education:  Macleans 
                        Pepperdine University (2014) Malibu, Califonia

My story:

I was born in Taipei, Taiwan and moved to New Zealand with my family at the age of four. I grew up in New Zealand and started playing golf around 10 years old. 
In 2009, I traveled to the United States to play golf tournaments. One of which was the Under Armour College Combines where I won both the stroke play event and skills challenge. This international exposure proved rewarding. I was offered a full four year golf scholarship to attend Pepperdine University and compete in NCAA Division I college golf beginning the following year in August 2010. Before I left for the states I competed for the New Zealand Junior Team in the Trans Tasman Cup where we were victorious over Australia for the first time in 27 years. It has been a great four years playing for a top ranked NCAA Division I University where I had the chance to travel to many different states and meet people from all walks of life.

Here are some of my accomplishments these past four years:

--Women’s Golf Coaches Association All-American Scholar (2011, 2013, 2014)
--Four time All-West Coast Conference first team (2011, 2012, 2013, 2014)
--Member of four West Coast Conference championship-winning teams (2011, 2012, 2013, 2014)
--Competed at NCAA Regionals all four years (2011, 2012, 2013, 2014)
--Part of 2012 NCAA Championship squad that finished 21st
--2012 WGCA All-West Regional team 
--Won 2013 U.S. Women’s Amateur Qualifying at Glendora
--Competed at the 2013 U.S. Women’s Amateur advancing to match play
--118 career rounds played (#10 all-time at Pepperdine)
--Career totals of 75.55 scoring average, 11 top-10 finishes, 16 top-20 finishes
--Tied for second place at 2014 WCC Championships
--In the team lineup for 10 team tournament titles in four years
--Pepperdine Athletics nominee for NCAA Woman of the Year
--West Coast Conference nominee for NCAA Woman of the Year
--Qualified for 2014 U.S. Women's Amateur
--Competed at 2014 U.S. Women's Amateur advancing to Round of 16 in match play
--LPGA Qualifying School Stage I finished T31 (+3)
--LPGA Qualifying School Stage II finished T22 (Even)

I completed my undergraduate degree this past April graduating Pepperdine with honors with an economics major and marketing minor. My game has vastly improved over the last four years playing college golf and I’m excited to start this new chapter in my life of pursing golf as a career.


Goal: 

My goal is to gain full status on the LPGA tour for 2015.

LPGA Qualifying School:

LPGA Qualifying School involves three stages where I aim to progress through each stage and ultimately gain my full tour card for 2015. Stage I is in August 26th-29th where Top 100 advances to Stage II after 72 holes. Stage II is in September 30th-October 3rd where Top 80 advances to Stage III after 72 holes. Stage III is in December 3rd-7th where top players earn status after 90 holes.

The Plan:

I am currently in California where the sunny and seventy five degree weather has permitted me to play all year round. I will be traveling to Daytona Florida for the third and final stage of LPGA Qualifying School first week of December. I will then be traveling to the southern hemisphere for three months and play on the Australian Ladies Professional Golf Tour in early 2015 and return in February to play in the USA.

Funding for Golf:

LPGA Qualifying School

Stage I                                                                                                               $2500

Stage II                                                                                                              $3000

Stage III                                                                                                             $0

Australian Ladies Professional Golf (ALPG) Membership fee       $913

2015 ALPG Entry Fees (~10 events)                                                       $1500

Attorney Fees (Professional Athlete Visa to play in USA)               $2800

Flights                                                                                                                $5000

Total:                                                                                                                  $15,713

Funding:

Becoming a professional golfer requires a large investment due to the costly entry fees and the process of going through qualifying school. That’s where you come in! I’m seeking your help to fund this journey of mine to live my dream of playing golf at the highest level. All the money raised will go towards funding for qualifying school, tournaments and flights. I've learnt over the years that sometimes its okay to ask for help and that life is more enjoyable when you share your experiences with others. I invite you on my journey on making golf my career. I greatly appreciate any support!

Many thanks,
Liv Cheng

Progress report: 
At Stage I Top 100 and ties progress on to Stage II. 
I made it through Qualifying School Stage I, finished (+3) T31 with rounds of 72, 75, 72, 72. Florida bound for Stage II in Venice, Florida.

 

Progress report: October 3rd 2014
At Stage II Top 80 and ties progress on to the third and final stage of Qualifying school.
I made it through Q School Stage II, finished even par T22 with rounds of 75, 73, 72, 68. I will be traveling back to Florida first week of December for Stage III of LPGA Qualifying School!

story:
Thank you to everyone who supported us.

We have shipped the GAME GOLF Digital Tracking System to all of you who contributed to our campaign.

Now that our campaign has ended, to ORDER visit our website www.gamegolf.com

 ------------------------------------------------------------

 

As featured in:

 

 

 

With our wearable technology and our available everywhere software you will change the way golf is experienced. This will be the most fun you've ever had on and off the golf course. GAME GOLF allows you to see your game, share your game, compare your game and compete like never before. 

 

 

Your support here will enable us to get into production and into the market. The more we raise here the quicker we can get our product into your hands.

SEE Your Game 

  • GAME records every club used, swing made and yard covered in each round, without interrupting you or your playing partners.
  • GAME calculates the key statistics for every game that you play—scoring, number of putts, greens in regulation, driving accuracy, etc.

      

SHARE Your Game

  • GAME is social—share with friends and boast about your performance on Facebook or Twitter.
  • Connect with other golfers on the GAME network and follow their progress, so you know what's happening even when you're not on the course.

COMPARE Your Game

  • Play on a whole new level by competing against peers and pros with unique game challenges, and earn achievements by setting course records, beating personal bests and playing for Game Golf medals. 
  • Dynamic graphics and useful statistics help gauge your skill and show how you compare.

IMPROVE Your Game

  • Get tips from other GAME users about course conditions and other information to make sure you’re in the know before you hit the green.
  • GAME automatically archives and calculates your data to track your progress over time, allowing you to learn your strengths and weaknesses in detail.

How does it work?

GAME is designed to be easy. Really easy. With the GAME product, you receive a GYG device and a set of club tags, one for each club in your bag. 

Setup is simple—pop a tag onto each of your clubs and you are ready to go. When you're ready to play, put the GYG device on your belt and hit the course. Whenever you take a shot you just "tag" the club against the GYG on your hip and go.

With that, your game is completely recorded. Every shot. Seamlessly.

The GYG device is loaded with a combination of the latest sensor technology—GPS, NFC, compass, accelerometer, and a gyrometer—to capture all the important data in your game. Data is then uploaded via low power wireless or USB to the GAME platform.

 

Seamless data capture opens up a world of possibilities

The exciting thing about GAME GOLF is that once it is made easy for you to capture your golf game, and we have done that, a world of possibilities is opened up for you to extend and enhance how you experience your game of golf.

  • Compare your game performance and all of your statistics to the pros, to other players all over the world, to players at your home course and to players anywhere like you. 
  • GAME GOLF knows what club you used, how far you hit each shot with that club and where you hit it. You can learn how far you really hit your 3 wood. How accurate you are with each club and what club you should really be hitting for any shot on the course. 

All of this and much, much more is possible with GAME GOLF.

Why support us?

GAME is the beginning of a movement—one that will completely change the golf experience for everyone. Plus, with your support, you will be one of the very first to get your hands on the GAME product.

Working with Yves Behar and his award-winning design firm fuseproject, we have made a lot of progress. Our final device prototypes have been tested hundreds of times by our team and pros Lee Westwood and Graeme McDowell. We are ready to start manufacturing the product and are in development for our software platform.

We want to incorporate product feedback from golfers and demonstrate the demand for the product that we believe is there. Our campaign on Indiegogo will allow us to take our final step, going from prototype to production and getting into the market, and your hands, faster.

We want you to be part of our process of making GAME GOLF a reality.

Our Team

GAME GOLF was started in Galway, Ireland by John McGuire and a small team of engineers. They had an idea and John moved to San Francisco two years ago to realize that idea. We now have our team in Galway and our team in San Francisco.

We are a technology team with a great idea, a love of sport (particularly golf) and a passion for developing new products. As a team we have many years of experience developing software and hardware.

In developing GAME GOLF, we have worked closely with one of the world's top designers in Yves Behar and his team at fuseproject. We are bringing a completely new and different design perspective to the golf world.  


                    The San Francisco team

 


    The Galway team on the Galway Bay golf course

 

Media coverage

Some of the press coverage on today's Indiegogo campaign

USA Today
http://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/personal/2013/03/05/game-golf-tracks-rounds/1963047/

Fast Company 
http://www.fastcodesign.com/1672038/with-data-viz-and-gps-fuseproject-remakes-the-game-of-golf#1

Pando Daily
http://pandodaily.com/2013/03/05/game-golf-a-wearable-performance-tracking-system-from-jambox-designer-yves-behar-and-pro-golfers-graeme-mcdowell-and-lee-westwood/

Venture Beat
http://venturebeat.com/2013/03/05/game-golf-uses-wearable-technology-to-let-you-track-your-drives-iron-shots-and-putts/

Engadget
http://www.engadget.com/2013/03/05/game-golf-system-indiegogo/

T3
http://www.t3.com/news/game-golf-specs-unveiled

Business Insider
http://www.businessinsider.com/crowd-funded-game-golf-system-2013-3


FAQ

We have summarized here the most common questions you have been asking us. Keep the questions coming, its great to hear from you.


How many tags come with the product?

18 tags come with the purchase of the GYG device.  14 club specific tags (Driver, Putter, 4-9 Irons, 3 Wood, 5 Wood, Pitching Wedge, Sand Wedge, Hybrid 1 and Hybrid 2) plus 4 extra tags for any additional clubs you may have in your bag.

Is the battery rechargeable, and what is the battery life?

The GYG battery is rechargeable via USB cable which is included with the purchase of the GYG device. The average battery life will last two rounds of golf or approximately 9 hours.

Will my home course be mapped?  How many courses will be available?

Upon release, we will have all the US courses mapped, over 20,000 courses.  We will be adding additional courses outside the US continuously to bring GAME GOLF into the global market.

Do I need to have an iPhone or iPad to view my game?

You do not need an iPhone or iPad to view your round. You can also view all of your data via our web app.

When will the GAME GOLF app be available on Android?

We are working very hard to progress our Android development to bring its release in parallel with iOS.


Questions

We'd love to hear from you. Just send us an email at info@gameyourgame.com.

Thanks!

THe GAME GOLF Team

story:
Help people find holistic ways to heal from pain and experience good health.

Why?

People have become distrustful of the pharmaceutical industry. And they are frustrated with the type of care their typical medical doctor can offer.

At the same time, they've heard about more natural options through alternative medicine and holistic health. They're curious. But figuring out what to try, and how and where to start is difficult!

 

What?

WholesomeOne.com is a Guide to Holistic Health.

WholesomeOne helps people find holistic ways to heal from pain and experience good health. Find holistic therapies according to your specific health condition. Shop for holistic health and natural products to promote your personal wellness.

Holistic health, also know as complimentary and alternative medicine, includes the practices of Acupuncture, Applied Kinesiology, Aromatherapy, Ayurveda, Biofeedback, Chinese Medicine, Chiropractic, Craniosacral, Detoxification, Diet, Environmental Medicine, Enzyme Therapy, Flower Essences, Guided Imagery, Herbal Medicine, Homeopathy, Hydrotherapy, Juicing, Light Therapy, Magnetic Field Therapy, Magnetic Therapy, Massage, Meditation, Naturopathic Medicine, Oxygen Therapy, Reflexology, Reiki, Sound Therapy, Supplements, Tai Chi & QiGong, Vitamins and Yoga.

A short sampling of conditions that holistic health can help includes: Acid reflux, Adhd, Allergies, Anxiety, Arthritis, Back Pain, Cancer, Carpal tunnel, Cholesterol, Diabetes, Gout, Headaches, Insect bites, Insomnia, Menopause, Migraines, Motion Sickness, Neuropathy, Plantar Warts, Psoriasis, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Stress, Snoring, Tendinitis, Tinnitus, Whooping cough, etc.

 

 

 



Who?

I'm Kevin Burke, and I believe WholesomeOne.com can help you and millions of people heal from pain and experience good health like never imagined possible.

This is my full-time job now. I believe I am uniquely qualified to build this. As a husband, dad, and entrepreneur having run my own business for 14-years, I've learned a lot by being involved in the startups and the operations of many different companies including eHarmony, Meridian Health, Boiron USA, Disney, AOL, and P&G.

Personal (yoga has changed my life due to my disease ankylosing spondylitis) and business experience has led me to this place and new journey. I am passionately committed to seeing WholesomeOne be a success.

 

When?

If the funding goal is reached, the web site will be ready to go live by December 2012, if not sooner.

 

How?

Many of the necessary people and resources for the development work, that I do not have the personal skills for, have been lined-up. It takes a team, and it is a matter of being able to pay them – thus the need for this request. All funds will go towards web site design, programming, mobile technology, legal work, and most for content on the site and health experts. If the funding goal is exceeded, even more content about therapies and conditions will be included. That would be awesome!

This initial funding will launch the site, and product sales from the shop will support the ongoing maintenance and growth.

Please help me build WholesomeOne.com by purchasing a Perk and/or by telling your friends about this project on Facebook, Email, Twitter, Google+ and Indiegogo share tools.

 

Closing Thought

Imagine you or someone close to you has an illness and the doctors have run out of options. You need a holistic alternative. 

Where online are you going to go to get started?

 

Thanks!

Thank you for your attention and interest.
story_txt:
Help people find holistic ways to heal from pain and experience good health.
Why?
People have become distrustful of the pharmaceutical industry. And they are frustrated with the type of care their typical medical doctor can offer.
At the same time, they've heard about more natural options through alternative medicine and holistic health. They're curious. But figuring out what to try, and how and where to start is difficult!
 
What?
WholesomeOne.com is a Guide to Holistic Health.
WholesomeOne helps people find holistic ways to heal from pain and experience good health. Find holistic therapies according to your specific health condition. Shop for holistic health and natural products to promote your personal wellness.
Holistic health, also know as complimentary and alternative medicine, includes the practices of Acupuncture, Applied Kinesiology, Aromatherapy, Ayurveda, Biofeedback, Chinese Medicine, Chiropractic, Craniosacral, Detoxification, Diet, Environmental Medicine, Enzyme Therapy, Flower Essences, Guided Imagery, Herbal Medicine, Homeopathy, Hydrotherapy, Juicing, Light Therapy, Magnetic Field Therapy, Magnetic Therapy, Massage, Meditation, Naturopathic Medicine, Oxygen Therapy, Reflexology, Reiki, Sound Therapy, Supplements, Tai Chi & QiGong, Vitamins and Yoga.
A short sampling of conditions that holistic health can help includes: Acid reflux, Adhd, Allergies, Anxiety, Arthritis, Back Pain, Cancer, Carpal tunnel, Cholesterol, Diabetes, Gout, Headaches, Insect bites, Insomnia, Menopause, Migraines, Motion Sickness, Neuropathy, Plantar Warts, Psoriasis, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Stress, Snoring, Tendinitis, Tinnitus, Whooping cough, etc.

story:
I am running this campaign to help my good friend Byron Macias fund a medical procedure to have a colon tumor removed. His surgery is scheduled for December 2012; the operation and recovery is going to drain the family, and I am hoping to help them raise enough money to get by in this tough time. Byron is from Ecuador where healthcare is limited and has to be completely funded by the patient. Although they have been told that the 17mm tumor is benign, it needs to be removed immediately to prevent gastrointestinal problems and eliminate future cancer worries.

From 2003-2004, I spent 4 months living in Ecuador with Byron and his family. They graciously hosted me, independent of a program, and without expecting anything in return. The head of the house (Byron's mother-in-law) is a certified nurse who works tirelessly for $100 a month, standard wages in Ecuador. This operation is expensive and will cause severe hardship for Byron and his family.

Byron runs an electronics store with his wife and 2 children. Byron's brother-in-law is a fisherman - he lives up stairs with his wife, his 3 children and his mother-in-law. The entire Macias family lives in one household, and they are bonding together to raise money for this operation. Let's bond together in support of the Macias family and help them meet the goal of $1500 to pay for this operation. Even a $5 contribution makes a world of difference in Ecuador. Please help me repay this family for all that they have done for me, and all the kindness they have offered others. For all the people who have been greeted with open arms while traveling abroad, now is the time to pay it back.

story:
Currently due to injuries I am sidelined.

In 2009 I was injured and taken away from my passion and career of ski instructing.While wroking on becoming well from this extensive knee injury and dealing with chronic pain I lost my health insurance plan. I need to receive surgery to both of my hips in order to get back on the slopes and pursue my career to support myself. I unfortunately do not have medical insurance and am seeking the assistance of you to get me through these hard times. All monetary donations would go towards medical and living expenses while I’m rehabbing and unable to work.

I will be working with the Stedman Clinic to get me well and back to my career, and out of chronic pain. 

With your assistance I will be able to get back on my feet and back to my career as a ski instructor and my passion of competing with my horses. 

I am a ski instructor by profession who needs help with medical bills to have both of my hips repaired and rehabbed. I currently do not have any health insurance and will be out of work for some time with surgeries and extensive physical therapy. I so desire to get back to my professional career as a ski instructor. While working as a professional in the ski industry, I strived to share my passion and love for the sport with all those who surrounded me. By showing my clients that the “fun meter” must always remain high, I feel like I helped them instill this same love and passion that I have.  I had a lot of inspiring mentors throughout my career, and I am motivated to be a positive role model to others the same way my mentors were to me.  I strive to share my love for the great outdoors and my love for skiing to my clients and co-workers.  I also try to share my knowledge of how to transfer the skills from these sports to other areas in their lives.  I make every effort to be a positive role model, showing the public and coworkers that being a ski instructor is a valid professional career.  I try to be a positive role model, leading by example by being professional and presenting myself in the best way possible.

My other passions are my horses with which I compete in endurance riding and competitive trail riding. Obie and I have archived national level honor in competitive trail riding. It is my dream to bring along my younger horses along in both sports and some day to compete in the Tevis cup which is known to be one of the hardest 100 mile endurance rides in the county. I also have dreams and plans to compete in many multi day rides.

I am seeking your assistance in getting me thru these hard times. Any financial contribution is greatly appreciated and know that it is being used to help me get my life back that I lost when I became injured and uninssured. No matter how big or small, any help is greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your support! Please share my story with anyone you know.

story:
Million Mask March Transport Squad

 Because Freedom of speech shouldn't just be for those with money.

  • Hi my name is Ryan and I am an activist and have been to quite a few protests and recognize that the most effective protests are the ones where people that want to come can.
  • I constantly see and talk to people who wish they could come and have their voices be heard but financially are not able. I got the idea to get a transportation team started when I saw how effective it was used for the NATO protests in Chicago in May of 2012 where the Nurses Union paid for charter buses to help people who wanted to come but were financially unable to come. They were able to come and express themselves and in the United States the ability to stand up for what you believe in shouldn't be just for those with money.
  • Your donation no matter how big or small will be incredibly appreciated and unbelievably helpful to those willing to go and stand up against a government that no longer has the best interest of the people in mind. Instead they are funded and run by corporations with unlimited money and power. 

What We Need & How it Helps

  • We are looking for enough money to fund some charter buses from a few major cities and assist some fellow trusted activists who are carpooling from less concentrated states and cities.
  • You will be able to follow the progress and and updates from our twitter @MMMtransSQUAD or contact us through email at MMMtransportSQUAD@gmail.com
  • If we do not reach our entire goal and cannot fund all the buses we want to then the money will go to funding as many as we can and/or helping as many people get to DC as we can as well as media costs. If you would like your funds to go to something specific if we cannot spend it on buses i.e. food/water for protesters shoot us an email and specify. We will tweet pics and shout outs with what your funds are going to. You will be kept in the loop every step of the way via twitter so rest assured your money will be put to good use.

The Impact

  • After seeing the effectiveness of transport coordination at the NATO summit and from contributors to the OCCUPY movement which led to occupiers being able to attend the DNC and RNC conventions we see it as essential to coordinate transport to give the maximum amount of people the chance to exercise their first amendment right as possible.
  • If we do not exercise our right to address our grievances with our government we will loose it.
  • Even if you are not able to make it to the march you are still able to help other people get there and your support is incredibly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you are unable to donate money but still would like to donate something thats great also. Supplies are always needed for actions such as this. i.e. Water, Medical supplies, Masks, Clothes, etc then feel free to contact MMMtransportSQUAD@gmail.com to set up how to send your donations.
  • You can also help by sharing this page with as many people as you can. Literally any and all donations are extremely appreciated even if its a dollar it shows your support and it means the world to us.

Solidarity and Love to you all and see you in the Streets
