story:
WHY YOU SHOULD GIVE ME MONEY 

I bought my house last June knowing full well that home repairs would come up, and that they'd sometimes be expensive or come at inopportune times. I did not expect to find out that my crawlspace floods during heavy rains. I bought during a drought, nothing was amiss at either of the home inspections (mine or the bank's), and houses on hills aren't supposed to have these problems. But mine does, and in the past 6 months, I've spent about $4,500 dealing with both the immediate aftermath (Shop Vac, utility pump, visit from restoration company), long-term prevention (sump pump, French drain system, gutter diversion, dehumidifier), and collateral issues straight out of Revelation (the most recent was an invasion of cave crickets, which are like two Biblical plagues -- frogs and locusts -- wrapped up into one). All of that was paid for with my own money; homeowner's insurance does not cover water damage, and I don't live in a flood plain, so I don't qualify for flood insurance. And it's not over yet. Having a dirt-floor crawlspace with no vapor barrier or insulation means mildew...and enough of it that when I turn on the A/C, the whole house smells like a load of wet laundry that was left in the washer for a week. With my furnace, air conditioner, water heater, and electrical panel all overdue for replacement, I'm not sure how or when I will be able to replenish my depleted savings account. So in exchange for a little help from my friends, I'm offering...hugs. Maybe three people care about a new Orgy album, but everyone likes hugs!

WHERE THAT MONEY WOULD GO

$400
Mildew/mold remediation. Already have a written estimate and an appointment for early November.

$200
Installation of polyethylene crawlspace vapor barrier. Already have a written estimate and an appointment for mid-November.

$350
Enough double-reflective polyethylene radiant-barrier insulation to cover approximately 800 square feet for an R-value of 16 (installation guide shown here), plus tools, supplies, and beer and pizza for whomever I can sucker into helping me install it. In addition to being more DIY-friendly than that itchy pink fiberglass, this type of insulation also serves as a second vapor barrier that will prevent moisture from attacking the floor joists and coming into the house . 

$250
HVAC duct cleaning. The real deal, not just some dude with a bigger vacuum than me. Ballpark estimate based on a rough average of the "Big Deals" currently on Angie's List.

$0
New album. New record label. All those other things Orgy won't be getting with 8 Gs. 

WHAT IT WOULD TAKE TO BE MORE SUCCESSFUL THAN ORGY

With 29 hours to go in their much-ballyhooed campaign, Orgy has raised $7,694 of their $100,000 goal. My thoroughly mediocre math skills tell me that's 7.694 percent. In order to have a more successful campaign, all I need is $92.34. Really, I'd be grateful for any help anyone gave, and I certainly don't expect or feel entitled to anything at all. But it would be kinda cool to do better than a band I didn't even like back in the day.

story:
Help me get back to Haiti!

My name is Dawn Garzon and I am a pediatric nurse practitioner,. I made medical mission to Haiti in 2101 (two months after the earthquake) and fall of 2011. While there I help care for the children of Haiti. Haiti is the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere, yet her people are full of hope and joy. I travel with a non-profit group called Mission Haiti. When there, our team of doctors, nurses and pharmacists sees hundreds of people over a one week period and provides medical care and medication for people who would otherwise have no access to healthcare. Due to personal reasons, I have been unable to visit Haiti since October, 2011. I will return in October of 2013.
 
I hope to riase $2100 to fund my daughter's (who is 16) and my return trip to Jubilee Haiti this Fall. Children often respond the best to other young people, so having my daughter at my side has the potential to pu many of these little ones at ease. I am committed to returning even if I don't make my fundraising goals. I will fund our own airfare and travel. The funds requested here cover the cost of our medical supplies, travel and lodging in Haiti, and employment of Haitian support staff. The cost of the trip is $1300 per person plus airfare, and additional supplies.

The Impact

Each time I have visited Haiti, our team averaged 100+ patients each day. We provide medical care, medications and we bring reading glasses if we can get them. These are beautiful children and thier families have limited access to healthcare. Many have never seen a medical professional in thier life. Many children we see have extreme skin infections and intestinal parasites. Others have breathign problems, or acute infections that are commonplace in the US but can cause severe outcomes when antibiotics and "routine" are not readily available.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help now, I ask for your prayers and positive thoughts. Pray for the team, but more importantly, pray for the people of Haiti. My life is more rich and more grounded becuase fo the people I know in Haiti. I am humbeled and honored to serve such a joyful population.

story:
About Hairy Jayne

Hello! I'm a hairdresser who makes her own natural hair care range. My name is Jayne but I'm not actually hairy.

I've dealt with many a head of hair over about 12 years, tending to tresses of all shapes and sizes. I began experimenting with making natural hand made products after taking a few short courses in soap, candle and perfume making, and then realising I was becoming sensitive to an ingredient in black hair dye.

I brew, mix and package the products all by hand in my studio in Brixton – not in a factory – and the illustrated labels that embellish the bottles are also designed and created by me. (Once upon a time I was a graphic designer).

As well as being natural, the products have a certain nostalgic feel. All the ingredients have been chosen for their hair-friendly qualities. The shampoos are sulfate free as these are milder for dry scalps – perfect for sensitive souls – and the mildness is also colour protecting. Ingredients such as parabens and sulfates (SLS), which have been linked to allergies and skin irritations, have been left out just to be on the safe side. Production is eco-conscious, and all bottles and packaging can be easily recycled.

The range has been kept deliberately simple and is designed to be used in any combination with a choice of three unique, natural fragrances.

At the moment, there are two shampoos, three conditioners and three hair perfumes. I hope to develop and launch more products in the future.

Why am I doing this?

This campaign is important to me because so far I have managed to fund all of the research, development and prototyping myself – but have now hit a few new bigger obstacles at this stage of the game.

There are changes to the cosmetic legislation framework in Europe which will be fully implemented by July 2013, so all of my formulations need to be retested by an approved cosmetic chemist before then for the products to be legally sold. 

As the labels will need to be changed and re-printed, this is the perfect time for me to address a few issues with the packaging of the products. After testing the waters and listening to customer suggestions and focus groups, I have come up with some new designs which look much smarter and more suitable for gracing the shelves of salons and shops!

What Hairy Jayne needs 

So my costs are:

retesting     1200

relabelling   700

bulk buying   800

(bottles & ingredients)

branding     500

= £3200

If you can help me raise this funding, you'll get a 'perk' in return! 

If the goal isn't reached, all money is refunded. And sadly I go back to the drawing board!

What are Perks?

As well as the chance to buy Hairy Jayne products in shops, have happy hair that you love and that loves you back and get a HUGE thank you from me – your contributions will earn perks or rewards. They're listed in the panel on the right.

If the perks aren't quite up your street, they make excellent gifts for someone else. The PAGEBOY and QUIFF can be sent overseas, so if you're not in the UK I'd recommend those. All contributions from within the UK will include shipping for the perks.

If you like you can just contribute to the campaign without the perks, knowing that you've helped an independent British enterprise get off the ground.

Any contributions to this growing obsession of mine would make me so unbelievably happy and leave me feeling so incredibly grateful forever and ever. Anyone who has spoken with me at all in the past year or so will tell you how much work I've put in to this product range and how much this all means to me! (It's pretty much all I ever talk about). My aim is to create a brand of good quality natural hair care which is professional but not overly expensive. More like everyday luxury – and you can get yourself a piece of that!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just stretch to contributing, that doesn’t mean you can’t help out!

Please get the word out and make some noise if you can. Tweet, share and forward to as many people as you wish, especially if the video amuses you. Thanks so much!
story_txt:
About Hairy Jayne
Hello! I'm a hairdresser who makes her own natural hair care range. My name is Jayne but I'm not actually hairy.
I've dealt with many a head of hair over about 12 years, tending to tresses of all shapes and sizes. I began experimenting with making natural hand made products after taking a few short courses in soap, candle and perfume making, and then realising I was becoming sensitive to an ingredient in black hair dye.
I brew, mix and package the products all by hand in my studio in Brixton – not in a factory – and the illustrated labels that embellish the bottles are also designed and created by me. (Once upon a time I was a graphic designer).
As well as being natural, the products have a certain nostalgic feel. All the ingredients have been chosen for their hair-friendly qualities. The shampoos are sulfate free as these are milder for dry scalps – perfect for sensitive souls – and the mildness is also colour protecting. Ingredients such as parabens and sulfates (SLS), which have been linked to allergies and skin irritations, have been left out just to be on the safe side. Production is eco-conscious, and all bottles and packaging can be easily recycled.
The range has been kept deliberately simple and is designed to be used in any combination with a choice of three unique, natural fragrances.
At the moment, there are two shampoos, three conditioners and three hair perfumes. I hope to develop and launch more products in the future.
Why am I doing this?
This campaign is important to me because so far I have managed to fund all of the research, development and prototyping myself – but have now hit a few new bigger obstacles at this stage of the game.
There are changes to the cosmetic legislation framework in Europe which will be fully implemented by July 2013, so all of my formulations need to be retested by an approved cosmetic chemist before then for the products to be legally sold. 
As the labels will need to be changed and re-printed, this is the perfect time for me to address a few issues with the packaging of the products. After testing the waters and listening to customer suggestions and focus groups, I have come up with some new designs which look much smarter and more suitable for gracing the shelves of salons and shops!
What Hairy Jayne needs 
So my costs are:
retesting     1200relabelling   700
bulk buying   800
(bottles & ingredients)
branding     500
= £3200
If you can help me raise this funding, you'll get a 'perk' in return! 
If the goal isn't reached, all money is refunded. And sadly I go back to the drawing board!
What are Perks?
As well as the chance to buy Hairy Jayne products in shops, have happy hair that you love and that loves you back and get a HUGE thank you from me – your contributions will earn perks or rewards. They're listed in the panel on the right.
If the perks aren't quite up your street, they make excellent gifts for someone else. The PAGEBOY and QUIFF can be sent overseas, so if you're not in the UK I'd recommend those. All contributions from within the UK will include shipping for the perks.
If you like you can just contribute to the campaign without the perks, knowing that you've helped an independent British enterprise get off the ground.
Any contributions to this growing obsession of mine would make me so unbelievably happy and leave me feeling so incredibly grateful forever and ever. Anyone who has spoken with me at all in the past year or so will tell you how much work I've put in to this product range and how much this all means to me! (It's pretty much all I ever talk about). My aim is to create a brand of good quality natural hair care which is professional but not overly expensive. More like everyday luxury – and you can get yourself a piece of that!
Other Ways You Can Help
If you just stretch to contributing, that doesn’t mean you can’t help out!
Please get the word out and make some noise if you can. Tweet, share and forward to as many people as you wish, especially if the video amuses you. Thanks so much!

story:
Help to raise £40,000 for Kayode Ariran's Sponsored Parachute jump on 18th August in Reading.

Funds raised will help to give a donation to the children in foster care, as well as support his community efforts aimed at making a real difference in his local community - starting with the youth!

 

Introduction

Kayode Ariran ( AKA "Kay Bizzy" - as he is known to his friends because he is always busy ), is a key figure in his local community.  

It was a youngster asking him "so what have you given back to your community" that really made Kayode think, and then decide that he would make "giving back" to the community that shaped him, his main objective in life..... 

.....So he started a movement and called it: The Give Back Family.

Give Back Family 

Kayode intends to make "Giving Back" the new buzz word, and intends to spread the world via the Give Back Family website.

Being an ex gang member and coming so close to choosing the wrong path in life, with the odds stacked against him,  Kayode managed to somehow turn his life around. He now aims to do all that he can to help to ensure that the local youth learn from his mistakes instead of making their own.

Kayode's background means that local youngsters, and even current gang members can identify with him and where he has come from - much better than they could a "pencil pushing" guy in a suit!

Still being a key figure in his local community, kayode also takes the time to give back by talking to and mentoring current young gang members and trying to help them to distance themselves from gangs and a life of crime.

The initials of the Give Back Family ( GBF ) also stand as an acronym for the Great Brixton Fc.

The Parachute Jump 

On the 18th of August 2013, Kayode Ariran will travel to Reading in the United Kingdom to take part in a sponsored Parachute jump. The jump aims to raise funds for 3 main purposes:

1. Children in foster care.

2. For the Give Back Family Foundation ( Founded by Kayode Ariran )

3. Start Great Brixton FC ( football club for the youth and local residents of Brixton )

The total target for funds to raise is a modest £40,000. Although of course this will not be enough to acheive all of our objectives, it will be enough to at least get the ball rolling, and make a make a substancial donation to his charity. 

Why funds are required

Fnding received from this campaign will be split between Kays chosen charity and his community projects.

The allocation of funds will be as follows:

  • 25% to FA oster care charity ( chosen by Kay )
  • 40% to Give Back Family community projects
  • 35% to Start Great Brixton Football club

 

More about Kayode....

After successfully turning his life around, Kayode is now a serieal Entrepreneur and founder of the Give Back Family Foundation ( aimed at giving back to the community especially youngsters).

Kayode is also founder of the SOON TO BE LAUNCHED Ballers CV www.BallersCV.com - a website to help find and support talented young football players ( with a view to keeping them away from a life of crime). 

Kayode has managed to meet with several well known footballers as well as celebrities. They love his ideas and what he is trying to do within his cummunity:

Me and the one and only Didier Drogba
Me and Ashley Cole
 

Kayode is really passionate about helping youngsters to dream and acheive - and intends to "single-handedly" re-shape the community around him. 

 

In the press

As local press get behind what Kayode is trying to do for the youth in his community.

Give Back Founder Kayode Ariran features in the Voice online Read Full Article

 

The Impact

With your contributions, for the first time, Kayode would now have the funds behind him that will enable him to donate a substancial amount to his chosen charity as well as enabling him to move his community charity projects forward.

Main objectives that can be acheived:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

We abolutely need you to get behind both Kayode's Charity Parachute jump and his community movement.

Even if you are unable to make a financial contribution, be sure to like this campaign on facebook, tweet about it as well as Google +1. You can find these buttons right under the campaign buttons above.

 

Kayode's closing thought......

It's time for us to stop judging our youth; Only noticing them when they have done something bad or wrong. 

We need to get behind them and give them so many positive options, experiences and role models, that joining a gang or hanging on street corners just does not seem so attractive any more.

Its about more than just setting up youth clubs, or giving them activities to keep them occupied. We need to give them a purpose, and make them truely beleive in themselves and their ability to acheive absolutely anything that they set teir minds to. That is the Give Back Family ethos.

I want Give Back to be the FAMILY that youngsters rely on - instead of getting involved in a gang, they turn to us for help support, guidance and mentoring. 

You may not even know me, but I ask you to support me and my Give Back Family.

Everyone who supports us becomes part of our family!  

.....Lets make this happen - and make a real difference!

Thank you

Kayode B Ariran

story:
Carmen was involved in a head-on collision on Airport Road in Martinsburg, WV at 8pm on Wednesday, May 16, 2012. Her injuries were so severe that she was airlifted to the trauma center at Inova Fairfax Hospital for children, 2 hours away.

Carmen arrived at the hospital with a fractured cheek bone, a fractured spine, and severe internal abdominal injuries. She was rushed into emergency surgery, and also received a blood transfusion due to the extent of internal bleeding. Over the next four weeks, she underwent six abdominal surgeries to remove damaged intestines and repair a badly damaged pancreas.  During that same time period she had one spinal surgery, at which time additional damage was discovered.  In addition to the broken bones, she had two badly damaged ligaments and spinal fluid was discovered to be leaking. She was moved from Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU) about a week after her arrival, only to be rushed back to PICU a day later, with doctors working frantically to keep her alive as her body was unable to fight off the infection that had set in. The additional surgery that was needed had to wait until her fragile little body was up to it. When she became stable enough, they removed additional sections of her intestines severely damaged from the infection, and she remained on a ventilator for several days. She began physical therapy during her third week, and was able to walk short distances with a walker when she was released from the hospital on Thursday, June 14th. However, on June 18th, her home health care nurse advised Carmen’s mother that she believed the incision on her back had become infected. This meant a trip back to Inova Fairfax Hospital for Children, where Carmen underwent the second surgery on her back, making a total of 8 surgeries. At the time of starting this campaign, Carmen remains at the hospital.  Cultures have determined that the infection is a staph infection.  She had a PICC line inserted and has begun I.V antibiotic treatment, but cannot be released until they have determined that the level being administered is strong enough to treat the infection, while not too strong, which would cause additional problems.

 Because of the severe internal injuries, numerous surgeries and subsequent infection, Carmen was unable to eat for the first three weeks of her hospital stay.  The badly damaged pancreas resulted in a severe case of pancreatitis, which still persists, causing her great pain after only a couple of bites of anything.  The surgery for the internal injuries delayed any surgery on her spinal injury, which required that she wear a neck collar until she could receive the spinal surgery.  The additional damage found when she finally had her spinal surgery required a “patch” to repair the area where the spinal fluid was leaking and required that she lay flat on her back for two weeks to allow the patch to heal and hold.  When she was finally able to wear the back brace she was fitted for, it proved to be a very painful ordeal.  Now, the infection that has developed in her back (which has reached the bones), will delay her physical therapy further and require that she remain on bed rest for several more weeks.

Through all of this, Carmen has remained in good spirits and the only time she has really complained or cried was when she had to wear the back brace, which we have learned actually contributed to the spread of the infection, and was causing intense pain on her incision.  She has been a source of inspiration to all who have come in contact with her.

During this entire time, Carmen’s mother, Niki, has not left Carmen’s side any longer than it takes her to shower and grab a bit to eat.  This has caused a great financial burden to their family, as their largest source of income has come to an abrupt halt.  In addition, the hospital is two hours away, which has increased the expenses (gas and meals) so that Carmen’s step-father can continue to work, yet visit as often as possible.  Carmen also has a little sister, 3-year old Calissa, who Carmen misses greatly. 

As the day approached for Carmen to be released from the hospital initially, family and friends worked frantically to move the household from a two-story rental home to a single-level home, required for Carmen’s mobility in her wheelchair and walker.  This, too, has placed an additional financial burden on the family.

We are hoping to help Carmen and her family receive the financial assistance they need during this very difficult time.  The money raised will be used for many purposes – Carmen’s enormous medical bills, her extended therapy and medical care which will require a home healthcare nurse and physical therapist, travel expenses back and forth to Fairfax for follow up visits, household expenses (utilities, groceries, gas, etc.) which have all increased as the family’s income has decreased.

Please help us raise funds to assist Carmen and her family throughout her road to recovery. A donation in any amount, no matter how big or how small, would be greatly appreciated! Please help spread the word! We are sincerely grateful for your support!!!

story:
Short Summary

Not one to stand by and let great things fail I see an opportunity to bring jobs and revenue to my struggling city while also resurrecting a piece of Americana that should not be left to die.

  • My name's John Patterson. I am a social media professional born and raised in MI. I love craft beer and snack cakes. You can help me save something I love!
  • Combining these two failing entities can really drive spirit into a area that has known nothing but worst of lists and fleeing jobs. Not to mention with the right marketing strategy and operational touch Twinkie can be made viable again.
  • You can be part of a revitalization of a city and a way of life. You can also help save a part of America's past and a reminder of simpler, better times. Not to mention spur a movement of deliciousness in Detroit.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Honestly we need deep pockets for this to succeed. We have to buy the rights and recipe and then secure and remodel appropriate manufacturing facilities
  • You want perks? We got em. Free Twinkies duh! Not to mention the feeling of being part of soemthing epic and useful and making real change.

If we don't quite make our goal all the proceeds will go to enriching life within Detroit. Free movies in the park with free food, free concerts, startup funding to create jobs for our city's citizens. It's all going back to the city.

The Impact

Your contributions make a real difference!

  • Impact is what we're all about. People haven't made things in Detroit in years and we're going to change that. Also, food is happiness and can make people smile. Smiles are what change attitudes. Attitudes can move mountains or even revive cities.
  • I've been part of large marketing and PR campaigns with Fortune 500 companies that can help me steer the course of thie project correctly. Finding the right partners will be key to success and I have the network to do that.

I am a Michigan boy trying to do something awesome right here at home. Give me a hand will ya?

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Can't spare a buck? No worries! Help us spread the word. Your social media networks are your voice shout our cause from the rooftops. 
  • Do you have a skill? Event planner, marketer, baker, construction worker? We're going to need boots on the ground if you've got more time than money we'll take it! You'll likely get at least some pizza out of the deal!

Don't forget to use all of the awesome tools here to share this campaign with your friends!

story:
Last month we raised almost $4000 for Naing Lin Oo to have heart surgery in Burma. Now we're asking for help with post-surgery recovery, which is every bit as critical. 

  • Please note, the amount requested is the minimum of what we need. Should we reach our goal we will keep accepting donations for Naing Lin Oo's continuing medical care, which will surely be needed in the future!

My name is Karen Zusman and last month i launched a campaign to help me raise funds for a boy in Burma who i became friends with last Fall. Naing Lin Oo is a villager from the ancient, sacred city of Bagan. He was born with a heart defect that required a procedure called a VSD. Without the procedure he would probably not make it past his 20th birthday.

The good news is that we raised the money and organized the surgery for him! The surgery was performed on February 20, from 9am-2 pm and it was considered a success. While we are thrilled and relieved to say the least, we are not out of the woods yet. Which is why i am asking once again for help.

Unfortunately, we underestimated the amount of money we needed because in Burma there is no fixed price and patients are at the mercy of the doctors, staff and government as Yangon General, where the surgery was performed, is a state-run hospital. Poor conditions and unconventional payment structures to say the least.

The money we raised went to doctor's visits, blood, x-rays, an expensive and invasive assessment in Mandalay prior to surgery to confirm surgery was still an option, transportation from yangon to mandalay to get this assessment and back to yangon for the confirmation and procedure itself. once the payment for the actual surgery was needed we were several hundred dollars short. Luckily a friend in Burma fronted the money. We need to reimburse her and we need to pay for reccovery ($700 in each case).

Currently, Naing Lin Oo is in intensive care unit. The campaign photo was taken 2 days after surgery and as you can see, the conditions in ICU are not what you would expect. He has no mattress, no blanket, not a proper pillow, and only a cloth cushion to rest over his chest to prevent infection. But most importantly, the hospital in general is a very risky place to recover.

Naing Lin Oo's immunity is severly compromised from the surgery and we need to secure a safe, clean place near the hospital for him and his parents to stay in for the next few weeks while he recovers. We also need to pay for subsequent medical follow-up treatment, including doctor's visits and medicines and anything else he should need during this time. 

Please donate whatever you can no matter how small. it all adds up. Thanks to your generosity we were able to secure heart surgery for Naing Lin Oo. He is a very brave boy to have gone through that and we can't turn our back on him now! 

Please view the following link to learn more about Naing Lin Oo from the first part of our launch.

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/heart-for-nai...

Our heartfelt thanks.

Karen, Naing Lin Oo and Kyaw Myint Oo (NLO's father)

 

To 

 

Hi,

My name is Karen Zusman and I'm a multi-media journalist and for many years I have been covering issues related to the people of Burma (www.pleasedontsaymyname.org).

Recently I returned to Burma to see for myself what changes were underway since Aung San Suu Kyi was elected to parliament. During my stay, I met a lovely man named Kyaw Myint and his family in Bagan, the ancient, sacred city. I spent the day riding in his horsecart accompanied by his 13-year old son, Naing Lin Oo. And this is the reason why I'm writing to you.

Naing Lin needs heart surgery. He has a condition that essentially means one of the valves of his heart does not close properly and as a result he coughs up blood and on occasion, blood fills his lungs. This condition will get worse as he grows older. And surgery will also be more difficult and dangerous for him with each passing year. Now is the time for Naing Lin to have his procedure. 

I promised Naing Lin's father i would do what i could to make sure they can keep their appointment for surgery on Februrary 7. I will be sending the money directly to the hospital--Yangon General--in Burma. I have friends in Yangon who will check on Naing Lin after the surgery, and I will be visiting later in the year to check on him as well. 

We need $3500 in total to cover all immediate costs associated with the surgery. About half that amount funds the procedure itself and the other half will be used to buy 9 bottles of blood and all the necessary medicines--in Burma, patients must pay for these things themselves--as well as pay for a shared room with 3 other patients for Naing Lin and his father for one month after the surgery. Because conditions in Burma are difficult, it is absolutely necessary that Naing Lin stay in hospital care for this time to ensure a healthy recovery.

The procedure will be performed in the Cardiac unit by a team that includes one Burmese surgeon and one visiting foreign surgeon--we were told this doctor will be from either Korea or New Zealand. 

If the money does not reach the hospital by the day before the surgery, Naing Lin will lose his spot and have to wait another year--providing they can raise the money. This has already happened to them once. I do not want this boy to be turned away a second time! 

Any amount over our goal will be saved in a fund to support further medical care for Naing Lin post-surgery.

I have chosen the Indigogo account that allows me to keep whatever I raise minus 9% should we not reach our goal. If we reach our goal, I will be charged only 4%. 

I have already raised !,000 from a few lovely friends and now I am reaching out to a wider circle of friends and friends of friends. Or anyone with a heart for Burma. 

Many of you who know me know i am connected with a few other, larger projects related to Burma and Burmese refugees. But this one touches me greatly because it is so readily do-able and will have such a great impact on one very special boy who i had the joy of getting to know during my time in Bagan. 

Any amount will help us reach our goal. It all adds up! But if you are able to give a bit more I have organized a few gifts of appreciation in the "perks" section. And if you live in the NYC area, i will be hosting a private house concert with legendary jazz guitarist, Gene Bertoncini, jazz guitar virtuoso Paul Meyers, and tabla extraordinaire Bill Buchen. This party will be a benefit to raise money for the surgery and post-surgery as well. Since it is in my home, space is quite limited, but if you are interested in joining us for a night of exquisite music one evening toward the end of January, please read about it in the "perks" section. 

I know times are hard and it seems whenever we check email someone is asking us for something. If you are not able to help monetarily but feel so moved, please pass this campaign link on to a friend who may be interested and able to help one of the most lovely boys in the world. We thank you.
story_txt:
Last month we raised almost $4000 for Naing Lin Oo to have heart surgery in Burma. Now we're asking for help with post-surgery recovery, which is every bit as critical. 

Please note, the amount requested is the minimum of what we need. Should we reach our goal we will keep accepting donations for Naing Lin Oo's continuing medical care, which will surely be needed in the future!

My name is Karen Zusman and last month i launched a campaign to help me raise funds for a boy in Burma who i became friends with last Fall. Naing Lin Oo is a villager from the ancient, sacred city of Bagan. He was born with a heart defect that required a procedure called a VSD. Without the procedure he would probably not make it past his 20th birthday.
The good news is that we raised the money and organized the surgery for him! The surgery was performed on February 20, from 9am-2 pm and it was considered a success. While we are thrilled and relieved to say the least, we are not out of the woods yet. Which is why i am asking once again for help.
Unfortunately, we underestimated the amount of money we needed because in Burma there is no fixed price and patients are at the mercy of the doctors, staff and government as Yangon General, where the surgery was performed, is a state-run hospital. Poor conditions and unconventional payment structures to say the least.
The money we raised went to doctor's visits, blood, x-rays, an expensive and invasive assessment in Mandalay prior to surgery to confirm surgery was still an option, transportation from yangon to mandalay to get this assessment and back to yangon for the confirmation and procedure itself. once the payment for the actual surgery was needed we were several hundred dollars short. Luckily a friend in Burma fronted the money. We need to reimburse her and we need to pay for reccovery ($700 in each case).
Currently, Naing Lin Oo is in intensive care unit. The campaign photo was taken 2 days after surgery and as you can see, the conditions in ICU are not what you would expect. He has no mattress, no blanket, not a proper pillow, and only a cloth cushion to rest over his chest to prevent infection. But most importantly, the hospital in general is a very risky place to recover.
Naing Lin Oo's immunity is severly compromised from the surgery and we need to secure a safe, clean place near the hospital for him and his parents to stay in for the next few weeks while he recovers. We also need to pay for subsequent medical follow-up treatment, including doctor's visits and medicines and anything else he should need during this time. 
Please donate whatever you can no matter how small. it all adds up. Thanks to your generosity we were able to secure heart surgery for Naing Lin Oo. He is a very brave boy to have gone through that and we can't turn our back on him now! 
Please view the following link to learn more about Naing Lin Oo from the first part of our launch.
http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/heart-for-nai...
Our heartfelt thanks.
Karen, Naing Lin Oo and Kyaw Myint Oo (NLO's father)

story:
Short Summary

The Johns Hopkins Quidditch team was formed the spring of 2010. Since then we've become a campus-wide presence, competing in and hosting multiple tournaments. Our annual tournament, the Charm City Classic, has been held two years in a row - with the home team coming in first place both years. For the past two years we have traveled to NYC for World Cups 4 and 5 to compete at a national level. The University of Maryland has hosted frequent tournaments, at which we have routinely placed highly. We also competed at the Fred Weasley Memorial Tournament at Franklin and Marshall in April 2012 where we took first place. This year we placed 5th in our regional tournament in Virginia which put us among the top 8 teams in our region which qualified for the World Cup in Kissimmee Florida. We are working hard to fundraise and save money to fly to Florida--but we need your help to achieve our goal of getting there!

What We Need & What You Get

This money will help us cover the travel costs for the World Cup. We're flying 15 players to Florida and back as well as paying the registration fees.

To thank you for your generosity you will receive a gift from us. You can get a signed team photo, a fan t-shirt (signed or unsigned), or a hanging ornament. Also if there's some form of JHUQ swag that you don't see listed but that you would like let us know! If the donation is appropriate and we think we can pull it off we'll get it to you.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially but still would like to help, spread the word! Let your friends and family know about our campaign. You can reach us on our facebook page, our website, or our email (jhuquidditch@gmail.com).

story:
XERSOFT - Help us help you!

How Does It Work?

It is actually pretty simple

  1. Sign Up
  2. Create a new workout, or use an Xersoft workout
  3. Assign workout to be completed on specific days
  4. Print out workout and take to gym - fill out details (reps and weight); or use tablet or cell phone at gym to fill out details
  5. View Workout History anytime anywhere. See improvements from day to day.

Xersoft Background

As life long athletes and fitness enthusiasts, we know very well how the organization around today's training programs leave much to be desired. Sure we work hard and tried to be dutiful in recording our training results. But carrying our notebooks and recording workouts daily just wasn't fun. In fact, it became annoying. What do you have after months of tedious record keeping? Pages and pages of useless numbers with no way to analyze their content and find your training program's strengths and weaknesses. This is the exact reason why we have decided to improve an industry that affects millions of people daily.

Features

We have set out to create an easy-to-use, intuitive, 100% customizable, and user friendly solution to managing workouts.
 
MVP=Minimum Viable Product
V1.0=Version 1.0
FFI=Future Feature Integration
  • MVP Create Workouts
  • MVP Schedule Workouts
  • MVP Workout History
  • V1.0 Analytics
  • V1.0 Instructional Videos
  • V1.0 Certified Virtual Personal Trainers
  • V1.0 Professional Workouts
  • V1.0 Social Layer
  • FFI iOS Apps
  • FFI Android Apps
  • FFI Gym Accounts

*We have a handful of future features that will be developed after the MVP, some of which have patent pending status and many are trade secrets and not disclosed below

What We Need & What You Get

We Need:

  • We are $15,000 short on funds to develop our MVP
  • Supporters and TREND SETTERS; people willing to take their fitness and fitness training seriously; people not afraid to try something new.
  • Piloters for our new web app
What You Get:
  • Online database of your complete workout history
  • See Packages to the right
  • Free accounts for life
  • Satisfaction of being with a company from the ground up
If We Don't Reach Our Goal:
  • We will continue to raise funds through traditional avenues
  • Of course, we will still begin development, but it will take much longer

The Impact

Market Size: There are over 50,000,000 gym memberships in the US.

On average, each workout contains 10 exercises, with 3 sets each. 30 pieces of data for one day. Workout out 3 x week equals 90 pieces of data. If we extrapolate that for a year, you have 4,680 pieces of data. This needs to be organized and analyzed before it's useful, and that is exactly what Xersoft will do.

Future features will allow you to share and compare with your friends, creating a competitive landscape.

Other Ways You Can Help

We can use any type of help. If you can't contribute, but like the project, please use the Indiegogo share tools. Next time you go to the gym and see someone carrying around a notebook, tell them about Xersoft.

*Feel free to contact us about investing opportunities. We are currently in the final stages of our opening round of financing, yet there is still room if you want to be in on the ground floor.

**IF INTERESTED IN INVESTING FOR AN EQUITY STAKE, PLEASE CONTACT ChrisBrush@xersoft.com

story:
Lucas' Story

Lucas Hiram Massman was born 6 weeks prematurely on July 21, 2011. Lucas' mother, Teresa Veltkamp, died the next day due to a brain aneurysm. Lucas' father Jake is now caring for his newborn son without his partner who so very much wanted a child. 


Teresa and Jake married a year ago, but have known each other almost their whole lives. They dated for several years when they were younger and then separated, but remained very close. As life moved on for both for both of them, they realized that they were made for each other. They began to plan a wedding and a family and life was just as it should have been. 


Seven months into Teresa's pregnancy things took a terrible turn. Now Teresa has left us and Jake will have to learn how to balance they joy of Lucas with the sadness of losing Teresa. 


Anyone who knows Jake and Teresa can tell you that they are two of the kindest, most loving people you would ever meet. Lots of people say that about lots of people...but it's true for them. The two of them have shown time and time again that they are people of incredible character and integrity. They have amassed an incredible amount of goodwill individually and together. 


A fund has been set up at a Montana local bank for Lucas and Jake to help with the incredible costs of hospital care for both Teresa and Lucas, as well as Jake's need to be with Lucas, Teresa's funeral and estate as well as the Veltkamp-Massman family relying now on only one income. This Indiegogo site is intended to make it as easy as possible for people who wish to do so to help support Jake and Lucas as they get on their feet. Anyone with a credit card or a paypal account or a checkbook can use Indiegogo to donate. Indiegogo take a small percentage to administrate but more than 90% of the funds raised go directly to Jake and Lucas. 


UPDATE for LUCAS:

Lucas is still in the NICU as of 8/2/11 but is doing very well and should be able to be moved to the regular nursery in the hospital soon. Jake is there for Lucas' feedings and the two are bonding beautifully. Jake and Lucas are blessed with an incredibly strong support system of family and friends and there is no shortage of vistors and well-wishers for both of them. 


Other Ways You Can Help


Your help in spreading the word about this fund is greatly appreciated. Social marketing sites like Facebook and Twitter as well as personal email lists will help make sure that our goal is met and hopefully, exceeded.

Thank you, 

Friends and Family of Jake Massman, Teresa Veltkamp and Lucas Massman

Teresa's Obituary

HELENA - Teresa Raye Veltkamp, 39, of Helena, died of a brain aneurism Friday, July 22, at St. Patrick's Hospital in Missoula.

A memorial service honoring Teresa's life is 2 p.m. Tuesday at Spring Meadow Lake in Helena. Cremation and Burial Society of the Rockies is handling arrangements.

Teresa was born on June 27, 1972, in Bozeman. She spent her childhood in Manhattan, Mont., and her later years in Missoula, Ovando, Polson and, most recently, Helena. Teresa graduated from Manhattan High School in 1990, and earned her BA in elementary education from the University of Montana in 2003. She taught at Ovando Elementary School and Cherry Valley Elementary in Polson before joining the Montana Office of Public Instruction's Indian Education Division as an Indian Education for All implementation specialist in 2008. Teresa was passionate about her work, and her life. She married Jake Massman on Nov. 12, 2010, and their son, Lucas, was born six weeks prematurely just prior to her death. 

Teresa gave generously of her time, took care of her loved ones, and she was a loyal and loving friend. She was so proud when she became an auntie to Caleb and Lucy, and everyone knew she would be a wonderful mother. Teresa was cherished by her mother and sisters who were, in turn, nourished by her strength and pragmatism. Her students and families in Ovando and Polson can attest to her exceptional skill as a teacher, and her love for all of her pupils. She was passionate about educating Montanans about the history, culture and diversity of Montana's Native people, and was loved, honored and respected throughout Indian Country. 

Teresa was perpetually late, disorganized and infuriatingly bossy. She loved to travel Montana and the world, to hike and backpack, cook and bake. She helped her niece, Lucy, enter this world, and was at her sister's bedside after nephew Caleb's complicated birth. Teresa was an integral part of every important event in the lives of her loved ones. She and her mother Karen raised each other up, taught each other how to live, and were bonded by a love that transcends this life. When Teresa and her husband Jake found each other for the second time, they knew they were meant to spend their lives together, and wasted no time marrying and beginning the family Teresa always wanted. Teresa had never been happier-married to the love of her life, living in her beautiful new home, anticipating the birth of her first child and working in a job where she had an impact on thousands of people.

Teresa loved and was loved by her family and friends, who are too numerous to name. 

Survivors include her husband, Jake Massman; newborn son Lucas Massman; mothers and fathers Karen and Ken Manley and Glenn and SeAnne Veltkamp; grandmothers Carol Morris and Dolly Swank; grandfather Donald Swank; sisters Rita Manley and Amy Veltkamp; brothers Jacob and Leonard Veltkamp; nephew and niece Caleb and Lucy Liszak, brother-in-law Taj Liszak; mother-in-law Claudia Massman; sister-in-law Tasha Massman; sister of her heart Erin Lipkind, goddaughter Ariana Lipkind; and pets Simone, Kitinka and Buster the fish.

Our hearts are heavy as we learn how to live without our beloved Teresa.

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Laura Richard. Im a mother of three children ages 11, 8 and 4. Im also a wife to my husband Chris of 12yrs. Our story begins when I was 15 years old. I found out I had a rare bone problem in each of my feet called Tarsal Colition. Basically 3 main bones in my feet were fused together, this happens in utero. However I had surgery to correct this dis order. Since then the surgery was successful in my right, but not for my left. I've been having serial castings done to help ease the pain. Now 15 years later, I was told I need another surgery in my left foot to help with pain and correct the new problem. The surgery is called a Triple Arthrodesis. It consist of many screws and bone staples. However we have one set back. I do not have insurance. My husband makes too much money for any state help. I was denied Private/Independant insurance due to a pre exsisting condition and my height to weight proportion was too bad. My husband's work insurance will insure me but that makes our monthly payment jump from 120.00 every two weeks to 665.00 every two weeks. Unfortunately that is just way too much money to have taken out. We fall into the "middle" class catergory, just the way it is I suppose.


The Impact

If I do not receive this surgery, I will continue to be in major pain. As it is I can not play with my kids, grocery shop or even stand to do the dinner dishes without being in massive pain. Without correction my knee, hip and back will also continue to deteriorate. There is a high chance from my ankle down could be amputated. Im only 30yrs old and want to be there more for my kids. I already feel like im lacking. They always want to do this or that and I just can't, no matter how hard I push myself. Im tired of my kids having to see their Mommy in pain. It also takes a toll on personal health as well as a marriage.


What We Need & What You Get

I need 3500.00 dollars to use as the down payment to Arrowhead Regional Medical Center in Colton, CA. They agreed to make payment arrangements with me after that down payment. They will not even schedule the surgery until they receive that money. You will be making a dream come true for me and a big weight off of my family shoulders. A chance for a family to be a family again.


Other Ways You Can Help

If times are hard for you as they are for me, no need to worry you can always share this on facebook, myspace or any other site you are on. You can even email to friends and family. I/we thank you for any help. Thank you for your time and help.
story_txt:
Our Story
Hello, my name is Laura Richard. Im a mother of three children ages 11, 8 and 4. Im also a wife to my husband Chris of 12yrs. Our story begins when I was 15 years old. I found out I had a rare bone problem in each of my feet called Tarsal Colition. Basically 3 main bones in my feet were fused together, this happens in utero. However I had surgery to correct this dis order. Since then the surgery was successful in my right, but not for my left. I've been having serial castings done to help ease the pain. Now 15 years later, I was told I need another surgery in my left foot to help with pain and correct the new problem. The surgery is called a Triple Arthrodesis. It consist of many screws and bone staples. However we have one set back. I do not have insurance. My husband makes too much money for any state help. I was denied Private/Independant insurance due to a pre exsisting condition and my height to weight proportion was too bad. My husband's work insurance will insure me but that makes our monthly payment jump from 120.00 every two weeks to 665.00 every two weeks. Unfortunately that is just way too much money to have taken out. We fall into the "middle" class catergory, just the way it is I suppose.


The Impact
If I do not receive this surgery, I will continue to be in major pain. As it is I can not play with my kids, grocery shop or even stand to do the dinner dishes without being in massive pain. Without correction my knee, hip and back will also continue to deteriorate. There is a high chance from my ankle down could be amputated. Im only 30yrs old and want to be there more for my kids. I already feel like im lacking. They always want to do this or that and I just can't, no matter how hard I push myself. Im tired of my kids having to see their Mommy in pain. It also takes a toll on personal health as well as a marriage.


What We Need & What You Get
I need 3500.00 dollars to use as the down payment to Arrowhead Regional Medical Center in Colton, CA. They agreed to make payment arrangements with me after that down payment. They will not even schedule the surgery until they receive that money. You will be making a dream come true for me and a big weight off of my family shoulders. A chance for a family to be a family again.

story:
The Scoop

Wild Seed Wellness (WSW) offers affordable massage therapy for queer and trans people of color in Oakland. Massage therapy services at Wild Seed Wellness are sliding scale so that clients are able to afford to make healing a priority and a routine. The 1st and 3rd Tuesday of the month are donation based days. In order to expand and offer more appointments, WSW is moving to the Living Room Project, an accessible healing justice practice/community space for queer and trans people of color, in West Oakland. Yay! Right now, it's necessary for WSW to raise $3500 dollars by June 2 to pay for 6 months rent.

 

SERVICES

Massage therapy services at Wild Seed Wellness are sliding scale. WSW wants people to be able to make bodywork a regular part of their wellness routine. Every 1st and 3rd Tuesdays of the month, WSW provides donation-based massage.

 

CURRENT CLIENTS

As of April 1, Wild Seed Wellness has taken over 125 appointments since Ana María Agüero Jahannes, C.M.T. moved to Oakland in the fall. Of those, 24% are returning clients, 16% received their first massage ever and another 16% had only received 1 before.


The Impact

WHY QUEER AND TRANS PEOPLE OF COLOR?

“Consider that there are three kinds of stress – acute, episodic and chronic – which can negatively impact your physical, emotional and mental wellbeing. How are your identities linked to stress and your wellbeing?”

Taijhet Nyobi, a client at WSW, has definitely begun processing these connections and said, “Uncomplimentary and/or incongruent realities, ideas, or perceptions of my physical body affect the way I walk, literally, in the world. I have had to become aware of my slouching to appear more masculine. Slouching makes my chest less visible. This, along with binding, has caused serious tension in my neck, shoulders, and lower back.” There are very real and direct connections of how we are perceived and treated to how we carry ourselves and what physical pains we feel.

They continue, “As a gender-nonconforming person of color there are few places where this is celebrated and validated. Confidence is a struggle and feelings of isolation are frequent. Institutions that are beneficial to healthy lifestyles are often avoided, specifically Medical Institutions because of [their] lack of awareness.” This is essentially what Ana explained to her mother when she asked if she was limiting her business. There are a lot of us.


What We Need

RENT MONEY

$500 x 6 + $500 = $3500

$500 rent for 6 months plus a $500 security deposit

Indiegogo will take about $250 in fees. If we exceed the goal, the money will go to supplies like unscented massage oil, laundry, printing and also future rent payments.

  

Other Ways You Can Help

MAKE AN APPOINTMENT!

If you want to support, by all means, get a massage! Schedule online at wildseedwellness.com and look for the Schedule Now link.

USE THE SHARE BUTTONS BELOW!

story:
To find out more about Concept Life have a look at our About Us page. 



                              

Bluetooth Body Fat Scale

•  LCD display: 90X39MM

•  Capacity: 180kg/396lb Division:0.1kg/0.2lb

•  Body Fat, Body Water, Bone, Muscle, Daily Caloric

•  Tempered glass platform:230x300x6mm

•  Battery:1xCR2032 (included)

•  Weight (unit):1.8kgs

•  Bluetooth 4.0

•  Moible operation system:

    - IOS5.0 or above

    - Android 4.3 or above


APP Platform

•  Collect body information from the electronic pounds by Bluetooth.

•  Change the data from number to chart. The record will be saving within 1 year.

•  Running map function (including Plan the map, save the running record and share to Facebook, twitter and etc.).

•  Save and check how much calories of food on each meal. Upload user's data to server.

•  Business version and Personal version (*If you want to know business version suitable for your company or not, please contact us by email conceptlifehk@gmail.com and let us know more about your idea. Thank you!) 










 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our project but you can't contribute, please consider sharing it using the share buttons under the video with your friends and family. This will help us a lot to spread the word!

Thank you, cheers!


Agents

If you like our product and want to bring it in your business, we are welcome you to be our country agents or area agents. Hope to hear your news and please email us by conceptlifehk@gmail.com for your idea. Thank you!


         

I-Health is getting integrated around our life and home. Concept Life Bluetooth Scale with App is our first step. Next will be Blood Pressure and Blood Glucose Meter with app. We want these products enable useful and help people (especially the elderly) easy to record physical condition or plan kit fit way, so that doctor will be faster to grasp their health history.

Maybe you will say you already have those products and apps for health management. Yes! You are right. However, we don't agree it is convenience and the cost will be high for handle on one topic. We combine those function coz we want to be real convenience and reduce the cost. Our app combined multi-function coz we want to be real convenience and reduce the cost to handle health management.

We need support to start the first project "Concept Life Bluetooth scale with App" go into mass production. That's why we post it on Indiegogo to let more people know and support us to become reality by pre-order with us.

We want to make these fantastic technologies to everyone. We want everyone will get rewards when they are supporting us.


Risks and Challenges

We know what the next steps are for manufacturing and fulfillment. However, we know that before mass production begins, we may encounter some problems. We would like to open and share with you coz it is your right.

Manufacturing: We need to create the tooling to manufacture different parts of the product. This process is complex and requires time, money and hit the order MOQ. Complications could potentially emerge and delay the manufacturing schedule. To tackle this risk, we've selected partners that can work closely with us through the whole process.

Enhancements in production: When in production there are a couple of parameters that can be improved during the process such as the design, click feeling, function and etc... Making such enhancements during the process will be in order to improve your experience with Concept Life. We will do everything we can to ensure that scale ships with superior quality.

Shipping and customs: When we start shipping there's always a risk of the product getting stuck in customs.  However, we are hard to check shipment rules of all countries. If we find out problem about this, we will contact you before shipment. We have prepared as well as we can and hopefully there won't be any delays.


Questions?

Does the cost already including shipping cost?

Yes! We've decided on a flat rate to cover shipping for everyone all over the world! This includes customs as well. However, we are hard to check the tax of all countries. If we find out problem or need to add costing about this, we will contact you asap.

Where the money goes? 

We need your help to finalize our software and hardware development to go into mass production.

Here is how we will invest the funding we receive:

1) Software and Hardware Development: We have started the IOS, Android software development but the majority of the funding requested will be applied to complete final software coding, testing, UI design, scale design and etc…

2) Mass Production: We need your support to secure procurement of the long lead components and meet the minimum order quantities required by the EMS factories. 

DATA + SERVICE

We take a great deal of care into protecting your personal information. The data are private, with state of the art encryption (We might use your data to improve research and benefit science).

Please contact us by email (conceptlifehk@gmail.com) if you have any suggestion or question. Thank you!

story:
Those who know Josh, know that he is an up-beat, loud and funny guy who loves to rough house with his two boys. Josh never fails to give a helping hand to those around him and has one of the biggest hearts that I know of.

On September 10, Josh suffered a brain hemmorage and is currently in the ICU and will be for a couple of weeks after until he starts to make progress.

I am trying to raise money to help Josh and Alisa with their current and future medical bills. Spending weeks in the hospital and Josh's surgery is a tough pill to swallow all at once.

I know we can all come together as a community, friends, family and loved-ones to help make a donation

*Please help spread the word of this campaign by copy and pasting the URL into e-mails, facebook feeds, twitter feeds etc. Anything will help*

story:
I am a Nationally Certified Massage Therapist - Licensed by the States of Missouri & California.

My specialty is Geriatric Massage. I am currently performing massage in several senior facilities in the St. Louis County area.

Although, I charge $1 per minute for a seated massage, there are so many seniors that cannot afford to pay for a massage or their families are not in a position to pay.  I want to reach the people that still want and deserve healthy massage.  A short 5 minute massage can do so much to lift their spirits and help them feel loved aside from all the health benefits of massage.

I offer fully clothed, customized massage which includes a choice of the face, head, neck, shoulders, back, arms, hands, legs and/or feet.  I am comfortable performing massage in the comfort of their chair, wheelchair or massage chair, in the privacy of their room or an activity room for 5, 10 or 15 minutes with an appointment for longer sessions.

My goal is to help them relax, rejuvenate and heal.

 

I have had a love of massage since I was a small child and believe that all beings are born with a craving for healthy touch and attention. Seniors respond very well to healthy massage.  When I work with a person that leaves with a smile on their face, my heart opens even more.

 

BENEFITS OF MASSAGE

  • Improvement in lymphatic flow, which increases the excretion of toxic substances from the body
  • Alleviation of headache and pain
  • Deepens breathing
  • Speeds up healing from injury and illness
  • Relieves joint pain
  • Stimulates bowels
  • Releases endorphins
  • Mental and physical relaxation
  • Improvement in length and quality of sleep
  • Relief of stress, anxiety, depression and loneliness
  • Improvement of the patient’s quality of life and self-esteem
  • Decreases isolation

 

More benefits of geriatric massage therapy

Like all massages, this one too helps with improving blood circulation and posture.

This in itself has many related health benefits, and because of this a geriatric

massage once a week is an effective preventive therapy. For those citizens

who suffer from age-related ailments like arthritis, diabetes or Parkinson,

massage can improve the circulation of lymphatic fluid, providing some relief

from these problems.

 

My fee of $1 per minute covers my supplies and transportation.

Thank you for anything you can give.  You will be helping seniors feel healthier and more alive.

All donations go towards helping the seniors.

 

If you have a friend, loved one or know someone that has a friend or loved one residing in an independent living, assisted living or skilled nursing facility in St. Louis county that would enjoy massage, please let me know and I will be happy to meet with them to give them massage.

Please ask your friends to contribute to this cause today to help make a senior happy!

story:
This is a fundraiser for the birth of Mauricio and Chrystal’s baby boy Ari. We are trying to raise $4,000 by mid July to pay for Ari’s delivery at the natural birth center in Whittier, Ca.( SMALL DONATIONS WILL HELP!!)

Our midwife is very caring and present and will be the one to help deliver. Ari will be born in a quiet room in water with only mom, dad, and the midwife. He will get to be held immediately by mama Chrystal and daddy Mauricio. He will stay with us the whole time and will be cared for by us. 

If you have any questions at all or would like to speak with us about any of this please feel free to contact us! Donations can be small. We know that funds are sparse these days. But, if you think about spending money on something temporary like a cell phone, that pack of beer, or eating out it seems frivolous if you can do something so important and more permanent. We appreciate your help very much! 

Chrystal will be giving anyone who donates $100 or more an original piece of art of their requested content and medium(please contact her with adress ect. for this). Everyone who donates will be given an art print to show our gratitude. Again thank you so much for taking time to consider and donate to this very special event. Help us make this happen!!!!

story:
Cupcakes are just a fad, right? 

HA! Never!! Bakery classics, like a cupcake, never go out of style. Think about it…yummy bites of cake and icing that will just make your day better. What’s not to love?  

 

We have a delicious product and let us personally guarantee this: they. are. amazing!  Soft, moist cake and icing with just the right amount of sweetness.

We currently rent commercial bakery space at The Cookery (insert supreme level of awesomeness here) in Durham, NC where we have access to any and all equipment we need to make these tasty treats. (thank you to the fine people at The Cookery!)

 

The only problem we have is that we don’t have a way to sell them individually to you, our favorite customers. Right now, we only take orders of 1 dozen or more cupcakes. We find this isn't really practical for someone that wants a try more than one flavor or they can’t control themselves around a dozen cupcakes.  And who could, really?

 

We considered opening a retail location right away but the capital and risk involved was too much for our husbands (read: panic, acid reflux, heart palpitations, loss of hair, etc.) 

Enter the food truck revolution! It’s big. It’s bold. It’s perfect! We tried to go big...that didn't work out as well.  On to Plan B and she's a beaut!  

Picture This: Retired. Mail. Jeep. We plan to upfit the inside with air conditioning and shelving plus put graphics on the outside.  And, well, the day after we got her the brakes went.  I mean, we COULD have lived with it but we didn't think you would respond well to catching cupcakes from a moving vehicle.  It's for you, really.

 

This is where we need YOUR help. 

 

To fund this project and help to get our cupcakes into more mouths in the Raleigh/Durham/Chapel Hill area (over 3,000 square miles) we are asking to raise $4150 to cover the cost of the graphic design and installation, the brake job, air conditioning and some shelving.

I know, I know...we've been here before.  Listen, we are willing to forego birthday and Christmas gifts for a really long time if you help us out.

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for taking a look at this Indiegogo project.  Please consider becoming one of our backers at any level.  Every single dollar helps us to reach this goal.  

 

 

Please feel free to share this project with your friends, family and cupcake lovers through Facebook, Twitter, sandwich boards, sign flippers, etc.
story_txt:
Cupcakes are just a fad, right? 
HA! Never!! Bakery classics, like a cupcake, never go out of style. Think about it…yummy bites of cake and icing that will just make your day better. What’s not to love?  
 
We have a delicious product and let us personally guarantee this: they. are. amazing!  Soft, moist cake and icing with just the right amount of sweetness.
We currently rent commercial bakery space at The Cookery (insert supreme level of awesomeness here) in Durham, NC where we have access to any and all equipment we need to make these tasty treats. (thank you to the fine people at The Cookery!)
 
The only problem we have is that we don’t have a way to sell them individually to you, our favorite customers. Right now, we only take orders of 1 dozen or more cupcakes. We find this isn't really practical for someone that wants a try more than one flavor or they can’t control themselves around a dozen cupcakes.  And who could, really?
 
We considered opening a retail location right away but the capital and risk involved was too much for our husbands (read: panic, acid reflux, heart palpitations, loss of hair, etc.) 
Enter the food truck revolution! It’s big. It’s bold. It’s perfect! We tried to go big...that didn't work out as well.  On to Plan B and she's a beaut!  
Picture This: Retired. Mail. Jeep. We plan to upfit the inside with air conditioning and shelving plus put graphics on the outside.  And, well, the day after we got her the brakes went.  I mean, we COULD have lived with it but we didn't think you would respond well to catching cupcakes from a moving vehicle.  It's for you, really.
 

This is where we need YOUR help. 
 
To fund this project and help to get our cupcakes into more mouths in the Raleigh/Durham/Chapel Hill area (over 3,000 square miles) we are asking to raise $4150 to cover the cost of the graphic design and installation, the brake job, air conditioning and some shelving.
I know, I know...we've been here before.  Listen, we are willing to forego birthday and Christmas gifts for a really long time if you help us out.
We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for taking a look at this Indiegogo project.  Please consider becoming one of our backers at any level.  Every single dollar helps us to reach this goal.  

 
 
Please feel free to share this project with your friends, family and cupcake lovers through Facebook, Twitter, sandwich boards, sign flippers, etc.

story:
My name is Charlene Montague.  I am an adult disabled retiree of the state of Florida.  Three days a week, I have hemo-dialysis at the Mayo Clinic in Jacksonville, Florida.  In 2002 I had a kidney transplant but it failed two years later.  Since I was the only parent to my young son, I waited for him to graduate high school before again activating my name on the transplant list.  He graduated high school this year and has a scholarship to college.  I feel I did right by him.

 Now it’s time to activate my name on the transplant list.  My primary insurance is Medicare and my secondary insurance Is AVMED.   I have been on Mayo’s transplant list for eight years.  The major holdback in activating my name is that Mayo transplant unit wants me to have money saved up in the bank for medications and emergencies. The minimum amount of money needed is $10,000, this money I do not have.

The transplant social worker asked me to have a close relative to come and take care of me for three months after the operation.  Both my sisters are sicker than I am, and my brother has Parkinson’s disease.  There has been a couple who I have been friends with for fifteen years who are willing to move in for the three months of care.  She was a registered nurse and would take care of my food and medications while her husband would take care of the house repairs, lawn, and car repairs. 

My hopes are to get the transplant, get my strength back, and get my color back.  As the economy comes back, I will be coming back too.

Enough money may not be raised before the time this listing runs out, but every generous donation will help.  My address is 2934 Stonehurst Rd W, Jacksonville, Florida 32277.  Thank you.

story:
Who is Nitin?

I first met Asha, Nitin’s mother, when visiting my father in India twenty years ago. She was working in the building where my father lives and was always positive and smiling.

Asha lives with her two sons in one room in south Mumbai. She works for several different families, twelve hours a day, seven days a week, rushing from one building to another, preparing meals, cleaning floors, washing clothes and ironing. Even when suffering from a fever or, once, from a knee so badly swollen she could hardly walk, still she kept working and smiling.

‘I want a better life for my sons,’ she told me.  Unable to read and write herself, she has managed to pay for both her sons to attend private schools and then get them into one of the oldest and most reputable colleges in Mumbai.

Asha earns about Rs.20,000 (£200) a month. She hoards every penny to pay for her sons’ education, and with no social benefits, free health care or pension to look forward to, saves a little for her old age.  She buys gold, a bangle here, a bangle there, the age old insurance policy of the poor.

No one with such a mother could fail to be inspired by her selflessness and as soon as he was old enough, Nitin, her older boy, got a job in a gym to help out with his college fees. After studying long hours and getting an excellent degree in Economics, Nitin landed a job in a bank. When he told Asha, whose health was suffering from her relentless hard labour, he said, ‘Now you no longer need to work so hard. Now you can rest.’ 

Shortly after starting work Nitin began to have pains in his chest. Four months later, after extensive tests, including several very expensive scans and a biopsy, he was diagnosed with Hodgkins lymphoma. He is 23.

Asha cried as she told me, ‘Poor boy, I never let him rest. I was always saying, “You must work, you must study.” He never had a chance to enjoy himself. And what was it all for? Now I say to Deepak (her younger son who is also in college), don’t work so hard, enjoy yourself.’

What Nitin Needs

The doctors say Nitin has a 95% chance of recovery provided he can have the prescribed treatment of eighteen sessions of chemotherapy. But each session averages around Rs. 20,000 (£200). Nitin has undergone six so far and has had a severe reaction to them, losing his hair, feeling extreme nausea and being unable to eat, despite Asha buying and cooking special food for him. The doctors have said a port in his chest to feed the chemo directly to the cancer site would cost Rs 50,000 (£500), which Asha cannot afford. The hospital has also said that he should be kept in hospital in a separate room after each chemo session as his immune system is so weak he is prone to infection, but Asha cannot afford to pay for a room so Nitin has to return to their one room in a crowded tenement.

Asha has already used all her savings and has now sold her gold jewellery, her last defence against destitution. Money has run out for Nitin’s remaining treatment.

How You Can Help

I have donated £1300, which is all I can afford at the moment.

The additional sum of money that Asha needs to find to cover Nitin’s treatment, the port into his chest and the recovery room – is about Rs 350,000 rupees. An enormous sum in India, well beyond the reach of all but the wealthy, in English money it is equivalent to £3500 - not a lot to save someone’s life.

If you can afford and you are moved to give something to help Asha and Nitin, even a small amount - £5 or £10 - can go a long way in India. It would pay for several taxi trips to hospital or special food that he can stomach when nauseous to help him keep his strength up. It would also allow Asha to spend more time looking after him, instead of being out working all day. You can adjust the default amount (set by Indiegogo) in the box by deleting and typing in your own amount.

£3500 is the minimum that Nitin needs. All money raised will go to cover the full cost of his treatment. Any extra money raised will go towards further treatment if required, or to help others in India in a similar position.

Please help if you can. If you can’t afford to donate, sharing our campaign on Twitter or Facebook could help us reach our goal.

Here’s the link to a Facebook page where you can follow Nitin’s progress.

https://www.facebook.com/savenitinslife

Thank you for doing something that will genuinely make a difference between life and death for a young man with a bright future and make all his mother’s sacrifices worthwhile.

Umi Stoughton (Sinha)
