Within a few seconds and requiring no tools SCUBAJET turns every stock board into a powerful e-SUP-board. On top of that, SCUBAJET can be used for other water sports, like canoeing, dinghies and even for snorkeling and diving.While conventional diving scooters are often big and bulky and weight between 10 and 25 kg (22 to 55 lbs.), the SCUBAJET has a streamlined appearance with only 3 kg (6.6 lbs.) including the Dive Adapter. Additionally underwater scooters are most often unwieldy, whereas the SCUBAJET allows to decide even during the dive whether to be used or not. If the SCUBAJET is not needed at the moment, it can simply be fixed to the buoyancy compensator – without any compromises. This simple solution is unique, there's nothing like it on the market. The SCUBAJET is constructed for max. pressure of 6 bar/87psi. We use a special shaft seal that can handle this amount of pressure. The theoretical depth limit based on the pressure is max. 50m/196ft. We give a warranty up to 45m/147ft.One of the big advantages is the innovative adapter system that provides various possibilities to use SCUBAJET on any imaginable water sports equipment. No technical skills are needed at any point. The plug&play system and the water resistant remote control make it easy to start, stop and select different speeds while using it on the water.adapter systems and SCUBAJET Take your existing board or equipment and extend it with SCUBAJET easily. Select the appropiate adpater and you are ready to go in a few seconds. We provide adapters for SUP, kanu, dinghi boats and dive. Many of the adapters use standardized finplugs for maximum convenience. By now we support and provide adapters for more than 20 different manufactures and many of them use standardized finplugs. So it's easy for us to provide compatible adapters. 

 
  


 




 



 

 
 One of these Finbox Adapter is included with every SCUBAJET: - Future Fin System- O'Fish'l Fin System- LokBox Fin System- ProBox Fin System- US Finbox System- Sevylor Fin System- FCS II Fin System Special Adapter (available as pledges) - Dive Adapter (speed and motor activation can be controlled directly on the adapter)- Dinghi Adapter (will be delivered with a trim function and pivot up/down)- Kayacat Adapter (can be pivot up/down – for sailing for example)- Universal Adapter Boats/Kayak/Kanu (Tilt/Trim, steering with original rudder or with the Scubajet Adapter, self-supporting swivel arm, adapater will be fixed with 4 screws)Until now we support the following manufactures. We continuously extend the list. If you can't find the right adapter, please inform us about the desired manufacturer and we'll get in touch to put it on our adapter request list.manufacturers Upcoming Adapter in the next months:- Hobie Adapter that fits into the MirageDrive box- ONAK Adapter- Universal Adapter for SUP- Universal Adapter for KANU/KAYAKS- DIY Adapter Templates Our electric motor allows you to go further to find your perfect spot to enjoy. You are able to stay on the water longer and tackle bigger trips with your water buddies. SCUBAJET brings you back to the shore safely and is made for active people and sports enthusiasts as well as families. the handy dive adapterSCUBAJET on SUP-board with kids in a dinghi on the waterperfect for snorkelingSCUBAJET offers various engine mappings for scuba diving (slow speed and long battery lifetime), power mode (short high speed sprints), SUP (paddling support or surfing without paddle) or freehand. Measuring only 58 cm (~22 inch) length and a diameter of 7,2cm (~2,8 inch) and weighing just 3kg (~6,6 lbs), SCUBAJET is easy to transport and fits in every backpack.You can control the SCUBAJET easily with the included remote control. Three buttons control all the functions, for increasing/decreasing speed, as well as to spot the engine. The auto-shut off system stops the engine immediately if you fall into the water and it will also be used for initial power on SCUBAJET over magnetic switch. SCUBAJET is also safe for kids as well since we use jet-power instead of regular propeller motors.  Due to the latest safety and security regulations for batteries, there is a limit of two spare batteries per person for the larger lithium ion batteries (up to 160 wh per battery). But as we know traveling is particulary important of many water sports fans, it was very important to us to meet your expectations and so we now provide a travel battery pack that consists of 2x160 wh batteries, that is allowed on airplanes! We have tested and implemented a bunch of great features like the SmartPower Technology. It offers long battery time up to 240 minutes with the internal battery and up to 720 minutes with the external battery pack. The external battery pack will be available with beginning of 2017.   Every SCUBAJET has a high tech LED light in the front with 500 Lumen.It's not only super practical while staying on the water during your canoe-, dinghi- or SUP trip for underwater lighting, its also possible to use the lamp without the engine unit. The lamp alone is also proofed for a depth of 45m.And that's not all! If you need more Lumen for diving as example you will be able to upgrade the lamp to 1.500 Lumen or add it as accessory. 
 
 

 





 

During the entire development process, SCUBAJET was used by a lot of different people to get their opinion and as much feedback as possible. We've started to create a jet-engine for different applications two years ago and we already started the serial production, so it's a great opportunity for you to get the best price ever for the SCUBAJET.  Scope of delivery: SCUBAJET, charger, remote control, finbox adapterAfter we receive your order you can choose between different adapters for SUP (FCS II Fin System, Future Fin System, O'Fish'l Fin System, LokBox Fin System, ProBox Fin Systems, US Finbox System) or kanu (Sevylor, universal adapter). Patrizia has always been a sporting ace and a real water lover. She grew up in Italy near Lake Constance and pursued her water hobbies ever since. Three years ago, her daughter was born and she was confronted with reconciling family life and her beloved hobby. She didn't want to give up water sports but she felt insecure about taking her daughter on the SUP board. "What if there is a thunderstorm coming up?", was one of the thoughts fostering her tentativeness. In addition, she wanted to take the whole family to the water without buying a motorboat to enjoy the beautiful summer in Carinthia.Out of these thoughts the idea of creating a flexible motor for water sports emerged. Consequently, her boyfriend Armin and his father Gert developed the SCUBAJET. Nowadays, Patrizia enjoys standing on her SUP board together with her daughter to escape the crowds at Lake Wörth's beaches.Patrizia has a strong background in marketing in the sea freight industry. With SCUBAJET she turns her hobby into profession.Please help us to make our dreams come true, share our amazing project and follow us on Facebook and Twitter for further news.

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Marvin Columbus and I am the creator of "Box Runners"! My passions are boxing, community, and kids! In 2006 I created an amateur boxing program for high school aged kids called,  "K.O. High Boxing" where local and regional high schools could compete against each other. The program was an absolute success which lasted 10  years and was an absolute hit within the schools, community and boxing world.  More than 1,000 kids were able to successfully raise their GPA's and graduate high school through my mentoring and athletic boxing program. 

 

K.O. High Boxing events grew to become the most successful amateur boxing show in California every year! K.O. High Boxing would draw in some of the the largest audiences, as well as many of the top celebrities in the world, such as Justin Bieber, Samuel L. Jackson, and the entire Muhammad Ali family and many more who were also huge fans of these unbelievably gifted kids!  

Within this past year, I just petitioned and received my professional promoters license in order to promote our first professional boxing show on October 15th, 2017.  Where we will announce and debut our Box Runners shoe.

The success of this crowdfunding campaign is extremely important to me as it will initiate the MASS PRODUCTION of Box Runners!  I have been working on this shoe for 4 years now.  I have done all of the "foot work" myself, from investing all of my money into the design, patent pending, and travel  across the world to find just the right manufacturer. This is the only cross-training shoe of its kind! Never before has a shoe like this existed! A boxing shoe where you can both train in the ring and run the street, track or treadmill, while still having full support along with superior design qualities. This shoe alone will change the game of boxing, combat sports, and running.

 I am extremely passionate about helping and mentoring our youth, particularly our Inner-City kids. Time and time again, I noticed that many kids could not afford to pay upwards of $100 - $150 for a good pair of boxing shoes and another $100 or so, for a good pair of running shoes. They would just have to pick one pair and make them work for both sports. There would be many times where the kids would have to spar, in running shoes; shoes that were too heavy for their feet and/or run in boxing shoes; shoes that didn't have support for feet or ankles for that part of the training. Often times these young athletes would roll their ankles as a result of not having proper footwear and ankle support. 

 I started wondering why there wasn't a boxing shoe that allowed you to cross-train?  I mean think about it, how many boxers do you know that also run?! It's practically the mainstay of a boxers training! So I did my research.  As it turns out, the reason there hadn't been a cross-training boxing shoe was simply due to fear of design flaws. Many manufacturers said,  "the shoes would be to heavy, they wouldn't last, and would simply fall apart due to the strenuous training, wear and tear that a boxer imparts on shoes in the ring alone not to mention the added stress, wear and tear of running on the street or track."  In 2013 , I decided to I pull my own design team together to find an affordable solution! Together, we  reverse engineered many different types of both running and boxing shoes. We were able to find and fix the flaws with a one of a kind design that had never been conceived of or done before. I then applied for and received the patent and invested all of my money into creating the prototypes hence BOX RUNNERS!

 

What can Box Runners prevent that a regular boxing shoe can't? 

For those who aren't familiar with boxing or combat sports training, the ankle is surrounded by soft tissue and many different ligaments and muscles which help give it not only it's range of motion but, also strength.  One minor mishap could ruin an athletes career as, these ligaments and muscles are very slow and tedious to heal.  A lot of fighters tend to typically have ankle and knee issues simply due to lack of support or from rolling their ankles numerous times during regular training seasons and athletic careers.  Although the standard  boxing shoe is light and flexible, it's usage is typically limited to the ring/gym. Box Runners allow fighters to "sit on their punches" - it gives them more balance, and is designed specifically to guard the ankle and shin allowing the foot a full range of motion yet fully stable and secure at the same time. 

 

What We Need & What You Shall Receive:

My goal is to raise $50,000 and all funds will go STRICTLY towards MASS PRODUCTION. I've done all of the "foot work" myself! I have completed all of the design and legal work up to this point, now the last step is simply manufacturing in MASS PRODUCTION.

Even if the full $50,000 goal isn't reached, what ever money is donated will still go strictly towards mass production. 

 

The Impact:

Your contribution towards this campaign  would would significantly help in playing a HUGE roll into helping manifest my dream for OUR kids and future athletes!  I've done all that I can to get these shoes up and "running"! I've trekked across the world from Canada to Pakistan, to finally finding the right manufacturing company for Box Runners in China. The company I have found is absolutely amazing, they were not only able to bring my vision to reality, but also implemented high quality material for these shoes to have greater durability and longevity.

I know that Box Runners will play a huge part in changing the standard of training safely and adding so much value to boxing and combat sports in general.  Box Runners represent FREEDOM to the cross-training athlete.  Each and every athlete that has trained in a pair of Box Runners, has told me that they feel "Free", they don't feel like there are any limitations to what they can do. Most importantly, no longer do they worry about the cost or space of juggling so many pair of shoes in one bag! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

 For those who can't donate financially however love our shoe, it's ok!! Spreading the word is just as effective and is still greatly appreciated!! Simply sharing on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook can make just as much of an impact. Thank you very much for even taking the time to share my vision, I hope the body of work I've presented to you proves how serious I am about this incredible shoe  and how passionate I am about completing this mission. The athletic arena needs Box Runners! 

 

Perks:

$ 1 – $ 149         A chance to win a free pair of Box Runners!

 

$ 150 - $ 299        - A chance to win a free  pair of  Box Runners also, 

                                  - 3 Pairs of Box Runners odor free/antibacterial socks

                                  - 2 General Admission tickets to a future KO High Event

 

$ 300 - $ 600       - 1 pair of Box Runners Shoes 

                                   - 3 Pairs of Box Runners odor free/antibacterial socks

                                    - 2 General Admission tickets to KO High Event

 

$ 700 - $ 1000       - 2  pair of Box Runners Shoes 

                                     - 6 pack of Box Runners odor free/antibacterial socks

                                     - 4 General Admission tickets to KO High Event

 

$ 1500 or above     - 2 pairs of Box Runners Shoes 

                                     - 12 pack of Box Runners odor free/antibacterial socks

                                     - 3 VIP passes for KO High Event

                                     - Autographed Memorabilia

 

$ 5000 or above    - 3 pairs of Box Runners Shoes 

                                     - 12 pack of Box Runners odor free/antibacterial socks

                                     - 3 VIP passes for KO High Event

                                     - Autographed Memorabilia

                                    - 2 free economy class, Hotel accommodations and airport transfers to the KO High Event show on 10/15/17.

story:
Note to my 3rd campaign:

Well I hope you are not getting tired of me and this campaign. Through the generosity of so many good people I raised more than half of what I need. But there is still the remaining amount so I can complete the treatments. Hopefully this will be the last time-frame that I will be asking for help. For those of you that already gave God bless you and I’m not asking for more from you, but if you know anyone that hasn’t given and might want to please pass this on to them. Once again thanks. Things are going great. Treatments are going great. I’m walking more and more and soon I will be back on my feet again and a whole lot of prayers will have been answered.  

My Story:

My name is Walter Olkewicz and I've had the good fortune to be an actor for the past 40 years. I've done some 50 movies and over a 100 TV shows. That ended about 15 years ago with my first knee surgery. Infections cropped up over and over again to the tune of, to date, 19 surgeries and my living in a wheel chair the past ten years. Recently I was introduced to a doctor from Mexico who'd had great results with the treatment of infections. The shots I was given have been working and according to my surgeon the infections have been subsiding. The prayers of friends and family were finally answered.

The only problem is the injections and the care I've needed to continue- none of this is covered by insurance. I've depleted all of my savings and I simply can not afford to continue without help. Before this treatment started my doctor spoke of the very real possibility of having my leg amputated. Needless to say, this scared the bejesus out of me. After so many surgeries and this most welcome recent success, I simply can not even imagine not continuing.

Please Help!

**** I'd like at this point to thank all who have helped. As most of you know this is the 2nd half of a campaign that started a couple of months ago. Although I only reached a bit less than 40% of my goal (explaining the need for this campaign), I have begun the treatments and have increased their frequency 200%!! The results are miraculous! Talk of amputation is at this point off the table. Though still a possibility it has gone from a 50/50 chance to less than a 5% chance. I can breathe easier. But now I need to complete the program which will reach into about a 6 month total. The shots both eradicate the infection AND (the more important part right now) build the cells and revive a leg that hasn't been used much in the past 12-15 years. Two months ago it was like trying to walk on a wet noodle. As my leg builds strength (currently at bread stick status), it will eventually- with a shipload of hard work- return to most of the strength I had in the leg 20 years ago. Part of my "Goal" calculations include work with a physical trainer. Luckily some of that IS covered by insurance. Insurance covers 8 times per 3-month period, I need work with a trainer 5+ times a week.Not an easy path, but one I can dedicate myself to. Thanks to all of you.

Over the first 30 years of my blessed career I was known for helping people (In the ten years that I ran my theater- The Jewel Box- over half of my students were there on "Scholarships" because they simply could not afford to come to class otherwise). I have coached fellow actors, people on the set, pretty much anybody I was lucky enough to work with for free, just trying to give back some of the good fortune I'd been lucky enough to receive.

Now I find it time to ask for help.

The estimated cost of these injections, the travel involved with obtaining them, and the personal care I need in the time until I am walking and "on my feet" again is about fifty thousand dollars (that figure might seem high until you consider that the hospital and doctor bills that were covered by insurance is nearly half a million)

True "Hope" is finally in my heart again. And being the creative animal that I am thoughts for a new theater keep me awake at night. I will make it happen! You can't imagine how frustrating something like persistent knee infections can be in blocking this dream. It would be like Picasso not being able to paint because he is in court fighting overdue traffic tickets. Okay, it's not exactly the same but you get the idea.

Over the past few years I have had lots of hospital time to read and study the great spiritual thinkers. I've come to understand that my ideas for an uplifting, inspiring theater are a direct result of me connecting with my Divine Purpose. I don't want that to sound egotistical or "highfalutin", you see each of us has a Divine Purpose. I've just been lucky enough to finally understand mine.

So anyone generous enough to contribute, I will gladly include you in our opening audience at "Up On Stage", my new theater.

Sooo....

Anybody who contributes $25 gets an autographed picture of me from whatever work of mine they most like (or a copy of my knee X-rays if you are goofy enough for that to be more appealing to you). I apologize for the levity, but I learned a while ago that if I can't laugh at all this I am in real trouble.

For $50 dollars you will get four tickets to my first weeks opening - copies of my knee X-rays will be distributed at the door.

And for a $100 dollars or more you will get an autograph picture, four tickets to opening week, and my son will come over and mow your lawn. Okay he is probably too busy to do that. If you call me I'll give you my advice on how to make your lawn greener by using paper machete mulch.

Thank you very much for even reading this request. Please understand that despite any frivolity this is a most serious situation. My life and future career depend on it.

Financial times being what they are, if you can't contribute yourself, I hope you will be willing to spread the word of my situation to your personal contacts. I believe we are all here on this planet to help each other. I hope you agree. And I hope you will consider my plight worthy of your generosity. If not my prayers are with you for wherever your generosity might flow.

Insurance covers 8 times per 3-month period, I need work with a trainer 5+ times a week.Not an easy path, but one I can dedicate myself to. Thanks to all of you.Over the first 30 years of my blessed career I was known for helping people (In the ten years that I ran my theater- The Jewel Box- over half of my students were there on "Scholarships" because they simply could not afford to come to class otherwise). I have coached fellow actors, people on the set, pretty much anybody I was lucky enough to work with for free, just trying to give back some of the good fortune I'd been lucky enough to receive. Now I find it time to ask for help. The estimated cost of these injections, the travel involved with obtaining them, and the personal care I need in the time until I am walking and "on my feet" again is about fifty thousand dollars (that figure might seem high until you consider that the hospital and doctor bills that were covered by insurance is nearly half a million)True "Hope" is finally in my heart again. And being the creative animal that I am thoughts for a new theater keep me awake at night. I will make it happen! You can't imagine how frustrating something like persistent knee infections can be in blocking this dream. It would be like Picasso not being able to paint because he is in court fighting overdue traffic tickets. Okay, it's not exactly the same but you get the idea. Over the past few years I have had lots of hospital time to read and study the great spiritual thinkers. I've come to understand that my ideas for an uplifting, inspiring theater are a direct result of me connecting with my Divine Purpose. I don't want that to sound egotistical or "highfalutin", you see each of us has a Divine Purpose. I've just been lucky enough to finally understand mine.  So anyone generous enough to contribute, I will gladly include you in our opening audience at "Up On Stage", my new theater. Sooo....Anybody who contributes $25  gets an autographed picture of me from whatever work of mine they most like (or a copy of my knee X-rays if you are goofy enough for that to be more appealing to you). I apologize for the levity, but I learned a while ago that if I can't laugh at all this I am in real trouble. For $50 dollars you will get four tickets to my first weeks opening - copies of my knee X-rays will be distributed at the door. And for a $100 dollars or more you will get an autograph picture, four tickets to opening week, and my son will come over and mow your lawn.  Okay he is probably too busy to do that. If you call me I'll give you my advice on how to make your lawn greener by using paper machete mulch. Thank you very much for even reading this request. Please understand that despite any frivolity this is a most serious situation. My life and future career depend on it. Financial times being what they are, if you can't contribute yourself, I hope you will be willing to spread the word of my situation to your personal contacts. I believe we are all here on this planet to help each other. I hope you agree. And I hope you will consider my plight worthy of your generosity. If not my prayers are with you for wherever your generosity might flow.

story:
USC Troy Camp is one of USC's oldest, and most diverse philanthropies.  

Each year, we raise money to send 3rd through 5th grade students in the South Los Angeles area to a week of camp. At camp, students engage in fun activities designed to foster personal growth and development. For many campers, this is the first time that they will spend the night away from their families and outside of Los Angeles. Camp is provided free of cost to every child, so we need your help in order to send as many children as possible to camp this year!

story:
As you know, my Mum is currently undergoing chemotherapy treatment for Acute Myeloid Leukaemia.

As a result of this treatment, Denise will lose all of her hair. As of the 28th November 2014, it has started coming out thick and fast.

It doesn't matter how well you know my Mum, you'll all know how much her hair means to her. I think she is more upset about losing her hair then she is about having cancer in the first place.

So the plan is to get her the *BEST* human hair wig that money can buy, but to do this, we are going to need a little help from friends and family. Unfortunately this page will only allow the campaign to run for a maximum of 60 days, so please act fast.

Please donate as much as you can, to keep my mum looking like the glamorous lady we all know and love xxx

story: Hello, My name is Janice Nahshal. Since 2006, I have been producing hair and skin products from my home. I have researched and invested long hours into producing quality products. Products I am proud of. My products include hair and skin moisturizers, lip balms and a tattoo glaze. My products are for all hair and skin types and made from all natural ingredients. They are expensive to produce because I use the very best ingredients. I love producing these products and I am excited with the responses I have gotten from individuals who use them. My goal is to sell my products in stores and online. I can achieve my goal with your help and support. I have a patent and a developing company is waiting to produce my products as soon as the needed funds are raised. Please help to get my products into stores, online and to you. All donations are appreciated and none are too small. Thank you.

story:
Why a Milk Bank in Yorkton?

Many mothers in our region are eager and willing to donate breast milk, but as of right now, there is no local depot for collection. By establishing The Milk Drop right here in Yorkton, we can dramatically increase the amount of milk that mothers in our region can donate. 

The Milk Drop will be located at Yorkton Regional Health Centre in the Sunrise Health Region and will collect donations of breast milk from Yorkton and area mothers. The donated milk will be sent to The Calgary Mothers’ Milk Bank for processing, testing, pasteurization and distribution by prescription. 

Who Benefits

Babies of course! Particularly babies who are premature or who are at a high risk for gastrointestinal issues. Breastmilk is one of the most effective, and cost effective, ways of caring for these little ones in need. 

Our donors are also not just women who have an excessive milk supply. Some women who donate have suffered the devastating loss their own child. When their bodies cruelly produce milk with no baby to feed, these women selflessly choose to pump and donate milk to help other parents' babies in need. 

What We Need

We need to raise at least $3,000 to bring a milk depot here to Yorkton. So far, thanks to the generosity of our community, we've raised just over $1,000. 

We're setting our campaign goal here for $2,500 to raise enough money to purchase the freezer we need for the depot. We are aiming to raise some extra funds to purchase the processed milk back for babies in need in the Sunrise Health Region.

Funds raised will go through the The Health Foundation and will be eligible for a tax receipt.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contact us at yapthemilkdrop@gmail.com if you would like to join our group by becoming a volunteer. 

Contact Heidi Russell, Lactation Consultant at Sunrise Health Region if you are interested in becoming a milk donor Heidi.Russell@shr.sk.ca

story:
Have you ever seen great time lapse photography ? 

These videos where you can see a long event in a few seconds like a blooming flower, a stadium filled with people in a matter of seconds, a construction project built from the ground to the sky or the sun rising, the clouds passing overhead and the sun setting over a panoramic vista.  

Enlaps is a unique, complete, plug-and-play time lapse solution, from initial photography to sharing over the web. Infinite battery energy, no memory card limit, for a professional quality result. 

For professionals photographers, photography lovers, or for fun.



Today, the three main concerns when shooting long periodic events are battery, storage and processing. Our product, Enlaps Tikee effectively  removes all three constraints.

  • Energy is provided by an integrated adjustable photovoltaïc solar cell, leading to long term timelapse capability. 
  • Once captured, photos are wirelessly transmitted to the cloud, so you never run out of storage space. 
  • Time lapses are automatically processed and can be directly edited or shared.




Enlaps offers a user friendly web application, reachable with any browser, on your laptop, tablet or smartphone. Easy setup and automatic timelapse creation for anybody, as well as powerful features for advanced users. 



Field of view sample :

Tikee field of view



Your are already a timelapser, so you can also :
 - Download a set of pictures and edit it with your favorite software
- Download your timelapse video directly, to insert it in a movie project
- Upload your existing timelapses to the web app



Enlaps is designed to achieve infinite timelapse with long term time lapse setting. 

Simply install it, adjust the solar panel to absord maximum sunlight, and Enlaps Tikee will take care of itself. By deploying a smart algorithm, Enlaps Tikee will decide what to do to keep shooting as long as possible. Basically it will prioritize shooting against wireless communication in case of critical battery level. 

 Without sun power, but with a full battery charge, the device can provide 10 min interval of continuous shooting during one full week. 


After a real work of brainstorming, hundred of sketchs and a dozen of 3D prototypes, Tikee was born. We designed our smart timelapse camera with a sleek aesthetic to keep it simple and user friendly, as our complete solution. 

In November 2015 , Enlaps was awarded with it timelapse solution at the CES Innovation Awards.

In December 2015, Tikee was awarded at Spark Design Awards from San Francisco in the product category.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Farah and I love kids. It took me 2 years to conceive my daughter Safiyyah. It was the greatest joy of my life and I had the most perfect pregnancy and delivery anyone can ask for. It were the incidents that followed that was devastating! Much to everyone's surprise, my daughter got menegitis after birth and due to A LOT of mistakes made by doctors as well, she consequently had severe brain damage after the bacteria ate her brain tissues. She just turned 3 on the 8th of April and she has global developmental delay, vision impairment (has vision to an extent) and cerebal palsy. She doesn't sit, or walk on her own, and doesn't talk. It's really difficult to carry her around as she is on the chubby end and weighs more than 40lbs. Looking at her you could never tell anything is wrong because she was a typical healthy child at birth without any abnormalities, but once you spend a little time with her you will start wondering why she's not doing A LOT or ANY of the things her age children would be doing :(. It kills me to not have to go through milestones with her and there is a constant thought of what if something I could have done differently or been more aware of what the doctors were doing. But now were keeping all that behind us and just focusing and putting all our energy on Safiyyah's well being...but we need help..

I want to raise a campaign for Safiyyah as we see so much potential in her. She was given just minutes to live and she has come so far with doctors in awe. She truly is a fighter! Her only medicine is intense therapy; vision therapy, speech therapy, occupational therapy and most important of them all-physiotherapy. Unfortunately, everything is so expensive. We as parents feel that with intense therapy sessions, she will soon enough be able to sit, stand, and walk on her own.

With contributors that may be able to fund money for her, it will substancially help us in giving Safiyyah the maximum support in achieving all the daily and basic functions of a normal human being, and I really hope that can happen sooner than later.

What We Need & What You Get

We wanted enough money to give Safiyyah therapy sessions every single day because her brain needs constant repition for it to remember the function and start giving out signals on it's own. Each therapy costs a minimum of $125-150.00 for 45mins-1hour. We don't want to start the intense daily sessions until we get enough money raised, because we don't want to have to stop halfway because of insufficient money, as everything upto then would just go to waste.

We've also heard from fellow parents who are going through similar situations with their child, tell us about a therapy session in Chili where it is a 5-week course of intense physiotherapy directly with the person who invented CME therapy (Ramon Cuevas) and it costs around $15, 000.00. Therefore, this is the reason for our goal amount because we would really appreciate and love it if we could try this out for Safiyyah also, as we've heard very remarkable outcomes!!!

If not in Chili we are lucky enough to have the next best right here in Downtown, Toronto. So in order to have at least 6 months, twice daily, 5 times a week we need $300/day, $1,500/week and $6,000/month! All this is only possible with funds raised!

The Impact

Each person who contributes anything will have a huge impact for my little girl Safiyyah. Hopefully with everyone's help and prayer, she will be able to become more independant and function like any other child her age. I feel she is "on her mark, get set, ready...and the GO" is just waiting to be given by her brain. Once she starts doing so, all of that reward goes back to every individual that helped her in any way in this process, and that's just priceless! How many people can tell others that they hepled a child to walk?! It never lets you take anything even as simple as being able to look at someone and smile for granted.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

If folks could get the word out and make some noise about this campaign that is still very rewarding!!!

(You can even use the Indiegogo share tools!)

PLEASE HELP MY LITTLE ANGEL, SAFIYYAH!! May you all who consider this campaign have the best of everything in life...God Bless!

DONT FORGET ABOUT THE DEADLINE -->

story:
Short Summary

Please visit our Facebook Group "Prayers for Aaron" at the following link:

https://www.facebook.com/#!/groups/488035234591653/

 

First and foremost, we want to say thank you for taking the time to read about our very loving son. Our names are Linnea and Richard Harding. We are a GOD loving Christian family with four children. I am disabled with four bulging discs and compression on my sciatic nerve along with other medical issues. I've been trying to get on disability now for two years. My husband, Richard, works as much overtime as he can to support our family. We are always trying to make ends meet from week to week.

Last Wednesday evening, March 20, our 20 year old son, Aaron Hardy, was hit by a car as he was crossing the road here in Cocoa, FL. The vehicle hit him so hard that it threw him several feet in the air and knocked his shoes off. He was airlifted by medical chopper to Health First Holmes Regional Medical Center in Melbourne, FL. After CT scans, it was determined he had multiple skull fractures and a broken pelvis. He has Intra-Cranial Pressure on the brain, which they have finally been able to reduce to 14 from 38. They are keeping him heavily sedated. He will not be able to work for at least two years if he is ever able to work again. We are just waiting to see if there has been any brain damage and what kind of rehabilitation and exactly how long the process will be.

The doctors have said he will probably be in the hospital for a few months and then many months of rehabilitation. The medical bills will be astronomical and he has no medical insurance. The driver of the car also had no car insurance to cover an incident such as this.

Any and all contributions will be greatly appreciated. As I have said, this is going to be a long process with astronomical medical expenses.

And last night, his girlfriend tells me she may be pregnant. He has no idea that he may be a father.

We also have a Facebook page called Prayers For Aaron. Please join the group and keep him in your prayers. He will survive physically and financially with your prayers. Thank You!

 

What We Need

In all honesty, he will need more than $100,000 to cover all of his medical expenses and rehabilitation. But, we are setting our goal on here for just $25,000 to hopefully reach that goal and have a lower fee since we will need every dollar possible to go towards his expenses. Every contribution will be helpful no matter how small.

Even if we do not reach the $25,000 goal, every penny of it will be for his medical bills and rehab.

The Impact

Your contributions will help my son get the best medical care and rehabilitation he can afford. It would show him that there are still very good and helpful people in this World. Even if they do not know you, they are willing to Pay It Forward to help out another human being.

I have never had to try and raise money like this. It breaks my heart that I must ask for this type of assistance, but I love my son very much and would do anything for him. He is my warrior. I will also try to raise money locally, but I thought this may be the best exposure to more loving individuals with an open heart. Thank you again for any contribution you are able and willing to give. GOD BLESS YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word on my son's story. The more people that see or hear about this, the more he will hopefully get contributions towards his recovery.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.

THANK YOU AGAIN

Linnea Harding

story:
About YChamp 

YChamp is an activity tracking app that selects ideal opponents for users in competitions, considering and comparing their capabilities. To become the champion, it is not necessary to be a professional athlete. It is enough to overcome distances daily and synchronize your results. 

We motivate people to be more active every day by engaging them in competitions.

Participate in competitions, win and get real money prizes.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to expand the existing functions within the app to raise the engagement and retention. To develop new features we need $20000.

User ratings

New functions will allow users to see the ratings of their achievements, compare them with other users and will give them an opportunity to get special prizes. For regular victories in competitions it will be possible not only to get game and real awards, but also to be at the top of the list of leaders of the application. The higher the position is, the more people see your profile.

Chats in competitions

Participants will have the opportunity to communicate in group chat of each competition. It will allow opponents to get acquainted, share their impressions and recharge their gambling mood.

Data synchronization

Now the application is synchronized with Apple Health & Google Fit. In the future, this list will be expanded with Garmin, Fitbit, Mi Fit and other gadgets and tracking applications.

The users that make investments will receive the doubled invested amount on their account in the app and will be able to use the money to participate in competitions.

Risks & Challenges

The app was already released on AppStore and Google Play. We regularly hold big champions with big prize pools. All users that invest will guaranteed get the funds on their account in the app for participating in paid competitions with prizes.  

 

Follow us:

Website

AppStore

Google Play
story_txt:
About YChamp 
YChamp is an activity tracking app that selects ideal opponents for users in competitions, considering and comparing their capabilities. To become the champion, it is not necessary to be a professional athlete. It is enough to overcome distances daily and synchronize your results. 
We motivate people to be more active every day by engaging them in competitions.
Participate in competitions, win and get real money prizes.












 
What We Need & What You Get

We want to expand the existing functions within the app to raise the engagement and retention. To develop new features we need $20000.
User ratings
New functions will allow users to see the ratings of their achievements, compare them with other users and will give them an opportunity to get special prizes. For regular victories in competitions it will be possible not only to get game and real awards, but also to be at the top of the list of leaders of the application. The higher the position is, the more people see your profile.
Chats in competitions
Participants will have the opportunity to communicate in group chat of each competition. It will allow opponents to get acquainted, share their impressions and recharge their gambling mood.
Data synchronization
Now the application is synchronized with Apple Health & Google Fit. In the future, this list will be expanded with Garmin, Fitbit, Mi Fit and other gadgets and tracking applications.
The users that make investments will receive the doubled invested amount on their account in the app and will be able to use the money to participate in competitions.

Risks & Challenges
The app was already released on AppStore and Google Play. We regularly hold big champions with big prize pools. All users that invest will guaranteed get the funds on their account in the app for participating in paid competitions with prizes.  
 
Follow us:
Website
AppStore
Google Play

story:
Dear Friends, Family & Community,

This November, I have the high hopes of participating in a trip to Nicaragua with Natural Doctors International. The purpose of this trip for me personally is to gain clinical herbal medicine skills in a clinic where they use herbal and natural remedies as primary care. This is a very unique and special opportunity for me to deepen skills that are very hard to gain in the United States. In addition, I will have the opportunity to study medical Spanish at Escuela Horizonte, and be able to offer healing services to a wider community upon my return.

I will be able to spend time with leading U.S. herbalists and licensed naturopathic doctors and gain hands on experience using skills needed in a clinical setting including: interview, physical exam, differential diagnosis, and preparation and administration of integrative treatments, which may include herbal medicine, nutritional supplements, homeopathy, acupuncture, massage and bodywork, flower essence therapy, counseling, and pharmaceutical medicine. I will also have the opportunity to review patient cases in daily round table discussions, attend special classes on relevent topics, and learn more about global health.

The cost of the trip supports the continued work of Natural Doctors International in the clinic in Omtepe, which is an extremely medically under-served island. The remaining cost of the trip goes toward payment for medical Spanish classes as well as the families providing homestays and airfare. I will also be delivering donated medical supplies and herbal medicines that I have gathered upon my arrival.

Please consider donating to make this dream a reality for me and to support the continued and much needed work of Natural Doctors International.


Many Thanks in Advance to All of You!

Love,
Ricky

story:
Adam

Adam was diagnosed with a very aggressive type of brain cancer when he was in his early 30s.   After surgery, chemo, radiation and over a year of fighting his cancer went into remission giving him a couple precious years to live life full out.  

Last year he discovered that his brain tumor had returned.   He found the best brain surgeon he could and underwent an aggressive brain surgery just to find the tumor had increased in size.

I am so moved at the incredable outreaching of friends and family.   The show of love and support for Adam and his family has been huge.  Even when Hospice recommended that Adam be moved to a health care facility, Adams family and care givers as well as over 70 people donating through this sight took a stand for him to live out his days in a way that was absolutely Adam worthy!!! The Impact of this support was that Adam was able to spend the last of his days in a room at a beach front hotel without worry of cost.   From his room he could watch the waves and ocean wildlife pass by.

Adam went peacefully in that room the morning of March 11th...After a bath, in the arms of loved ones, with the sounds of the ocean...he drifted off to his next adventure.

I ask that we continue to raise money for the remaining days of this fund raiser show our support to Adams family.   I can not thank you enough for your contribution.

story:
Bringing better healthcare to the people of Oyugis

Hearts for Kenya’s mission is to build self-sufficient communities in Oyugis, Kenya through agricultural development and other sustainable initiatives.

Over the past year, we’ve worked to turn a dilapidated duplex into a much-needed medical clinic for the community. Built with local materials by Kenyan workers and volunteers, the clinic has been designed to use renewable sources of energy, including rainwater and solar power.

Slated to open in June 2014, the Mary Ballard Medical Clinic will provide four exam rooms and a pharmacy, an administrative office, two washrooms and a spacious waiting area for patients. A staff nurse will be available three days a week with a conservative estimate of 60 patients seen each day.

Not only will the clinic provide a source of income for staff, it will also offer digital record-keeping for better diagnosis and treatment of patients. This is a life-changing benefit for the people of Oyugis.


Help us reach the finish line!

While all major construction is complete and the building has running water, there is still some work to be done. Two more water tanks would ensure adequate water for the clinic. A septic system would allow the washrooms and sinks in the exam rooms to be used properly. And two exam rooms still lack cabinets and beds.

The cost to complete these remaining projects is $5,000. Please consider making a donation at the following levels:

·  Contributors at the $50 level and above will receive a beautiful soapstone carving from Kenya.

·  Contributors at the $100 level and above will receive a colorful, handwoven basket from Kenya.

·  Contributors at the $250 level and above will receive a Masai authority stick.

·  Contributors at the $500 level and above will receive a hand-carved wooden giraffe from Kenya.


Making a measurable difference

For 20 years, Hearts for Kenya has been helping the people of Oyugis, Kenya break the cycle of poverty and build a healthy, self-sustaining community.

·  We support more than 150 farmers in our co-op, providing supplies and educational programs that have helped them increase their crop yields from an average of 300 lbs of corn per acre to 1,100 lbs.

·  We reach more than 8,000 students in 20 schools where 7th and 8th grade students are taught how to farm and use their harvest to give each of their fellow classmates what may be their only meal of the day. 

·  And now, we are increasing access to quality medical care for the people of Oyugis through the Mary Ballard Medical Clinic. This is critical to the sustained success of our efforts in the community.


Spread the word!

After you’ve made your contribution, share our story with your friends! Send them a link to this page, post it on Facebook or share it on Twitter. The more people that know about our campaign, the more we can grow our efforts in Oyugis!

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone, we need your help please... You all know I have not asked for anything before....My BEST friend and her children are in a very volatile, abusive domestic situation. I can't stress enough how imperative it is to make them safe.  I am appealing to all of you, my wonderful FRIENDS who may be able to provide anything you can spare, even the smallest donation will help if we all contribute just a little bit. Our goal is approx $2,500, probably less than your normal donations to your favorite charities. Thank you all so much in advance for your generosity. ~~~L~~~ by the way, most of you know who this is for, and after what she just fought and WON, she needs our help..... Please help everyone......<3

We set our goal at $2500.00. This is what we have figured out it will take for 3 airline tickets and a bit of money for the small necessities they need in the beginning...
They will be safe, once they are back "home".

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

story:
Flying Medical Service

We are a U.S. non-profit, strictly volunteer organization which provides regular preventive and curative health care mostly for Maasai people, air transport for medical emergencies, as well as health education services.

We've been based at Arusha airport in Tanzania since 1983. We provide our services for people throughout the region regardless of religious affiliation, ethnic background, or ability to pay immediately. We work in remote areas that are far from regular health care facilities.

FMS has full-time volunteer staff, most of whom are pilots and paramedics. We also have volunteer doctors and nurses on stand-by from nearby hospitals and clinics. The government of Tanzania has granted us important exemptions which help us to provide our services as affordably as possible for the average Tanzanian citizen

The area where Flying Medical Service operates is one of the most remote and spectacularly beautiful places in the world. The people who live here are equally spectacular. But when someone is sick, and medical help is so far away, the vast distances can turn this beauty into a nightmare.

We recently had an accident

That's why we are starting this campaign. The accident happened while performing medical outreach in the Tanzanian bush. Without an aircraft, we can't provide emergency flights or clinical services. Since insurance for the type of flying we do is prohibitive, we need to raise the money in order to purchase another one.

The kind of bush flying we do carries a lot of risks, but it is worth it, as last year alone we saw almost 30,000 people on clinics. The accident however, has left us with limited means in bringing our services to those in need. Tanzania, has the worst doctor to patient ratio in the world with only one doctor for 125,000 people!

That is why Flying Medical Service is here. The world gets smaller every day. We're all in this together. So, we humbly ask for your help in making this happen. Your kindness and generosity will enable our organization to resume it's work for the people who you will likely never see, but who benefit tremendously from it. Thanks for being with us.

  • To see more about our work, then please visit http://www.FlyingMedicalService.org
  • Here is a small gallery of clinical outreach photos: http://imgur.com/a/9ZpSu#0
  • Or you can see our volunteer crew on our facebook page here
If you would like to see the fate of our airplane, and the miracle it is that everyone survived and is out of the hospital, you can view those here: https://imgur.com/a/Vyiok#0

story:
My name is Peter. I'm the Assistant Secretary of LongeCity.Org. I'm raising money to cryopreserve or chemical preserve my grandmother. Chemical neuro preservation is $2500 plus shipping of the whole body. Cryonic neuro preservation for indefinite storage starts at $14,000 plus whole body shipping. Shipping would be from New Jersey to Oregon (I'm located in Delaware). My grandmother has been given a week to live and I'd like to get her the best preservation possible. Her caretakers have stopped feeding her as she has lost the will to live. 

My Grandmother's name is Charlotte and she's 88. I've never had the opportunity to ask her about cryonics, but I feel that she would be well served by it. I've seen her end of life documents she didn't wish to prolong a painful existence, so time is tight. She did look forward to the good years. Cryonics will offer her a chance to live again without the pain or disability of old age.

My first goal is to reach $5,000. This should allow me to have her prepared and shipped to Oregon Cryonics for chemical preservation(I won't bother you with the details). I hope to have this arranged with the paypal donations (funds available immediately) by the the time she expires (or as we cryonicists say, she deanimates). Chemical preservation will preserve someone for between 100-200 years with current projections though reanimation may be more difficult or lossy, so if possible, I'd like to preserve her using cryonics. The goal for this including shipping is $22,500 or $14,000 plus shipping, with the remainder going to establish a reanimation fund with the American Cryonics Society or being donated to the next person to raise money to cryopreserve a loved one by a donation earmarked to either the Church of Perpetual Life, the Society for Venturism, or another brain preservation/cryonics charity at your request. Some money may also be spent to test Google ads to put the fundraiser in front of more people.

I fully realize that I'm against the clock and might fail to achieve these fundraising goals. However, with the founding of Oregon Cryonics, cryonics is now more affordable than ever and I believe people will benefit from knowing it's available. At the very least, someone who does want cryonics will benefit from this fundraising even if my grandmother does not. Unspent monies will be donated to one of the afformentioned charities/churches and earmarked for cryonics charity. I hope that many others will be inspired by this campaign to raise money for their loved ones. I am presently a member of the Cryonics Institute and an Associate Member of Alcor.

Presently, my grandmother has a prepaid, presumably nonrefundable arrangement for cremation and is in the care of two of my aunts. While they aren't cryonics supporters, I don't foresee any issue with preserving my grandmother should I have the funds to do so on my own.

Please share this campaign in any way you can. Remember, we're racing the clock and even if we aren't able to make the objectives, we can still help those who follow.

story:
What is this all about?

My project is designed to bring joy and laughter to cancer patients as well as to create awareness.

My name is Michelle, a wife and mother of two lovely children.  I have spent the last year fighting an aggressive life threatening cancer and thankfully I am now almost done my nightmare journey.  I have been so supported by my friends and my community that it has left me with an incredible desire to give back.  

My project is a three-part project.

The First Part:
Is a book called "The Cancer Warrior Handbook".  This is a funny, real, down to earth handbook on how to live through chemo, radiation etc.   This is not another nutritional guide or health guide on how to live with cancer.  No WAY!  There is enough of that out there.  
 
The Second Part:
Currently being produced by Gadbois Photography, a documentary that will shine some light on the beauty that can lie within each one of us.
 
The Third Part:
Our "Warrior Bags", these are lovely gift baskets created to help newly diagnosed cancer patients pamper themselves and bring a little joy back into their lives.  Specially designed by Michelle, herself a Cancer Warrior, these goodie baskets contain facial lotions, lap blankets, hand crafted soap, washcloths, lip balm, a toothbrush, bracelet, a sugar free lollipop, a copy of "The Cancer Warrior Handbook", a delicious treat, etc.  These bags will be sent out to cancer patients free of charge.

I need your help to ensure my dream to help others comes true.

Click to Tweet and share:

Help @pammenter make her dream of giving back come true http://goo.gl/Po492

What will it cover?

Here is where the funds raised will go.  

Cost for a graphic artist on the book $500
Professional editing fees $500
Shipping of Free books & DVD's to those who donate $1200
Setting up of the book on Amazon and creating a site for Warrior Bags $500
Book tour and promotion costs of the book and the documentary $3000
Costs to produce and send out the first 100 Warrior Bags $3500
 
Other undefined costs for marketing, promotion and product for the book and the Warrior Bags will continue over the course of the next twelve months and are not included in the total goal.  Any funds received in excess of the defined goal will go into an account that will be used to continue to cover these costs for as long as is possible.
 

What is in it for YOU?

Of course there will be goodies for everyone who donates to this project.  Here are just some of the ways you will be thanked.
  • Receive an invitation to the book and documentary launch party
  • Personal Thank You card or email sent out to you
  • Receive a complimentary copy of the documentary
  • Receive a signed copy of my book "The Year I Died"
  • Personal mention on my blog and Facebook page thanking you
  • Have a "Warrior Bag" sent to a cancer patient of your choice
  • Have a signed copy of "The Cancer Warrior Handbook" sent to a person of your choice.

If of course we do not reach our goal, which I sincerely hope we do, then the funds raised will go first towards the book project and I will work with the local community to help fully fund the "Warrior Bags".  We already have four businesses that have come on board to provide product for the bags and three companies are currently being considered. 

Help your friends get some of these great gifts too.  Click to tweet and share:

Want some great goodies check out @pammenter and her campaign to pay it forward.

Why help out?

If you help fund this project, you are helping create a great resource for cancer patients as well as bringing joy to someone whose life has just been devastated by the news that they have cancer.

I know only too well how life changing this can be and know that any little bit of love and caring goes a very long way.  

If you cannot help financially, please consider some of these other ways to help.

Share this Indiegogo page via email with your friends or on your Facebook page.  Use this text:

After a one year battle with Inflammatory Breast Cancer, Michelle Pammenter Young is launching a program to bring joy into the lives of other cancer patients.  Her new book "The Cancer Warrior Handbook" and her "Warrior Bags" will provide some humour, love and kindness to many.  She just needs your help in the final stages of launching the program.  Please show your support by checking out her Indiegogo campaign at http://goo.gl/Po492.

Put me in touch with cancer patients who need a little joy in their lives.

Click on the text below to post a tweet on twitter with a link to this campaign.

Help @pammenter bring the "Warrior Bags" program to life.

 

So..that is it, a small donation will go a long way and helping by sharing this with your network of friends will play a great part in reaching the funding goal.

Thank you in advance,

Michelle and team.

Other undefined costs for marketing, promotion and product for the book and the Warrior Bags will continue over the course of the next twelve months and are not included in the total goal.  Any funds received in excess of the defined goal will go into an account that will be used to continue to cover these costs for as long as is possible.
 

What is in it for YOU?
Of course there will be goodies for everyone who donates to this project.  Here are just some of the ways you will be thanked.


Receive an invitation to the book and documentary launch party
Personal Thank You card or email sent out to you
Receive a complimentary copy of the documentary
Receive a signed copy of my book "The Year I Died"
Personal mention on my blog and Facebook page thanking you
Have a "Warrior Bag" sent to a cancer patient of your choice
Have a signed copy of "The Cancer Warrior Handbook" sent to a person of your choice.

If of course we do not reach our goal, which I sincerely hope we do, then the funds raised will go first towards the book project and I will work with the local community to help fully fund the "Warrior Bags".  We already have four businesses that have come on board to provide product for the bags and three companies are currently being considered. 
Help your friends get some of these great gifts too.  Click to tweet and share:
Want some great goodies check out @pammenter and her campaign to pay it forward.



Why help out?
If you help fund this project, you are helping create a great resource for cancer patients as well as bringing joy to someone whose life has just been devastated by the news that they have cancer.
I know only too well how life changing this can be and know that any little bit of love and caring goes a very long way.  


If you cannot help financially, please consider some of these other ways to help.
Share this Indiegogo page via email with your friends or on your Facebook page.  Use this text:
After a one year battle with Inflammatory Breast Cancer, Michelle Pammenter Young is launching a program to bring joy into the lives of other cancer patients.  Her new book "The Cancer Warrior Handbook" and her "Warrior Bags" will provide some humour, love and kindness to many.  She just needs your help in the final stages of launching the program.  Please show your support by checking out her Indiegogo campaign at http://goo.gl/Po492.
Put me in touch with cancer patients who need a little joy in their lives.
Click on the text below to post a tweet on twitter with a link to this campaign.
Help @pammenter bring the "Warrior Bags" program to life.
 
So..that is it, a small donation will go a long way and helping by sharing this with your network of friends will play a great part in reaching the funding goal.

Thank you in advance,
Michelle and team.

story:
Stressful living is known to lead to heart disease (HD). Veterans, especially those who have been involved in combat missions, are highly likely to suffer from such short-term and long-term stressors. The information below explains how your funding can provide the most cost-effective, safe and accurate approach to early detection for HD among veterans -- starting with the Veterans Hospital in Albany, NY.

All hospitals and doctors face similar difficulties in determining whether patients who experience chest pain really have heart dysfunction or if their pain originates from more benign causes. One of the reasons for the difficulty is that cardiologists still rely on the EKG (also known as ECG) as the first test to establish this distinction. However, that test is over 100 years old, and is only 40-50% accurate for identifying early- or later-stage indications of HD.

A new technology exists called MagnetoCardiography (MCG). This test is safe, non-invasive, and -- with accuracy well over 90% and within 10 minutes -- can distinguish between the existence of HD and normal heart function. Results are available right away, and patients remain fully dressed. Benign chest pain only requires medication, while HD requires other major tests and procedures. 
  
The Veterans Hospital in Albany, NY is anxious to use an MCG system for the veterans they serve. This capacity for early detection of HD can also enable early treatment as well as periodic safe monitoring of the efficacy of treatment. The ultimate goal is to improve heart function without surgery or invasive tests that involve radiation.

The CardioMag system has already been extensively tested at major hospitals in the US, including the Mayo Clinic and Cedars Sinai, as well as other prestigious institutions overseas.  We urge you to donate generously so that the Veterans Hospital of Albany, NY can bring immediate improvements to heart healthcare for all veterans --- and to help lead the way toward better healthcare for all of our citizens.

story:
WE NEED YOUR HELP………THANK YOU

My niece, Chanel was diagnosed with ALS (Lou Gehrig's Disease) in 2008 at the age of 39.  God is Good and Chanel is still with us smiling.  However, she has lost use of all her muscles except the use of her eyes and thumbs.  Chanel continues to have 100% of her mind and with the assistance of electronic devices, she is able to communicate with us.  Even though Chanel is on a portable ventilator 24 hours a day, she works full time, serves as First Lady of her church and inspires so many people.   We are expecting a miracle and we need your help.  The ALS Association is sponsoring their annual Walk to Defeat ALS on Saturday, October 26, 2013 at Brown's Island in Richmond, Virginia (check in - 10:00 am, walk-11 am).  We need walkers to walk for Chanel with at least a $5.00 donation to help find a cure. If you are unable to walk that day, we accept your donation and prayers. 

Chanel is very passionate about finding a cure for ALS.  In the past 5 years, she has raised over $100,000.00.  This year, her goal is $20,000.00 by October 26, 2013.  Over $3,700.00 have been raised.

Also, share this information with your friends and families.

To make your donation you can use the Indiegogo tool: http://igg.me/p/542898 or you can go to this website and make your donation:

http://webdc.alsa.org/goto/BeatriceJohnson  click on Donate to Beatrice; Honoree’s: Chanel Hobbs

Why We Need Your Help

Often referred to as Lou Gehrig's Disease, Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) is a progressive, fatal neuromuscular disease that slowly robs the body of its ability to walk, speak, swallow and breathe. The life expectancy of an ALS patient averages 2 to 5 years from the time of diagnosis.

Every 90 minutes a person in this country is diagnosed with ALS and every 90 minutes another person will lose their battle against this disease. ALS occurs throughout the world with no racial, ethnic, or socioeconomic boundaries.

This crippling disease can strike anyone. Presently there is no known cause of the disease though support is bringing researchers closer to an answer. In the mean time it costs an average of $200,000 a year to provide the care ALS patients need. Help make a difference and donate or join a walk today.”

    -ALS Association


Thank you,

Beatrice Johnson, Aunt

story:
The Background

After years of brushing his teeth as Mom ordered, Doug went into the dentist and got hit with some very hard and difficult news: major dental work was needed.  Big problem: Doug doesn't have dental insurance, and due to an ongoing war between insurance companies and dental offices, rates are ridiculous.

What He Needs Done

The most pressing issue is a root canal in a very prominent tooth in his mouth.  It's causing him exceptional pain.  Due to the further pain associated with the procedure, sedation would be lovely.

But there's more!  Two cavities need to be filled, along with some other misc. work.

Why You Should Help

Cost of living is insane right now here in Vancouver, and a fella who works two-part time jobs can keep his head above water, but simply can't afford huge expenses.  This is a chance for us all to really communicate to Doug how important he is in our lives, and to put money where our mouths are.

I'm Pretty Broke...

Hey, I hear you.  I am too.  But even $5 means a lot.  Even $1.  Passing it on to people and really explaining why this is important would help.  But more to that: what if it was you?  What if you were in pain?

IF ALL OF DOUG'S FRIEND GAVE $4, THIS CAMPAIGN WOULD BE FULLY FUNDED AND DOUG WOULD BE SET AND GRATEFUL!

story:
I'm Amy and I'm a physician assistant. 

This year I set a goal to do more and volunteer my time and medical knowledge to a good cause. I am scheduled to go to Guatemala with Timmy Global Health in March of 2014 to provide medical services at a local clinic.

My cost for the trip is $1000 for food and lodging and $756 for airfare. I plan to pay for 50% of this myself. This campaign is to raise money for the other half of my cost and  donate the remainder to Timmy Global Health for supplies and medication. 

How your donation makes a difference: 

Your donations will allow children and families in Guatemala to gain access to quality healthcare that they desperately need. As a non-profit corporation Timmy organizes regular trips to Guatemala, Ecuador, and the Dominican Republic. They return to each location on a regular basis to ensure that chronic conditions are cared for and medications refilled. 

More information: 

For more information on Timmy Global Health go to: http://www.timmyglobalhealth.org/

If you are a medical professional interested in volunteering go to: http://timmyglobalhealth.org/index.php/get-involved/medical-professionals/
